Title: Rusted Seraph in the Distortion Vat
Prompt:
TITLE: RUSTED SERAPH IN THE DISTORTION VAT
[STYLE: EDM; electronic; techno; drum & bass; breakcore; dubstep; trap; industrial; glitch; acid; dark]
(WEIGHTS: acid_303=1.2; breakcore_amen=1.35; neuro_reese_bass=1.45; sub_pressure=1.55; distortion_saturation=1.25; industrial_noise=1.0; glitch_stutter=1.15; stereo_phase_rot=0.9; halftime_trap_switch=0.85; clean_drop_contrast=0.75)

SOUND DESIGN: Corroded TB-303 squelch that “talks” like a melting siren—resonant sweeps, filter scream peaks, wet squish transients, unstable tuning drift. Reese bass built from stacked detuned saws + FM edge + formant notch, snarling in the midrange with vowel-like growls; occasional pitch-ramps and throat-choke modulation. Sub is pure heavy pressure (sine/triangle + soft clip), sidechained hard so it breathes in violent pulses—floor-rattle sustained notes, then sudden vacuum drops that feel like the room collapses.

DRUMS / RHYTHM: Amen break as raw material, shattered into micro-slices—spastic stutters, reverse-snare suction, granular bursts, machine-gun hats, razor edits that “hiccup” on the grid. Switches between 180–220 breakcore frenzy and brutal halftime trap lurches; fills that spiral into glitch mosaics, then slam back into a straight, crushing kick-snare spine. Transient shaping is aggressive: snaps like broken glass, tails smeared with distortion haze.

TEXTURE / SPACE: Industrial grime bed (electrical hum, metal scrape, tape hiss) glued under everything. Stereo phase-rot on synths for sickly width; short, metallic room verbs on snares; occasional cavern slap for “cathedral” hits. Distortion chain is layered (soft clip → wavefold → bitcrush accents) so the whole mix feels coated in rust—but preserve momentary clean “air” before drops to maximize impact.

ARRANGEMENT FEEL: Intro: distant acid whispers + sub swell. Build: bass growls get closer, drum edits get tighter. Drop: full-pressure reese + sub + shredded Amen chaos. Mid: sudden clean contrast (less dirt, sharper transients) then immediate relapse into the vat—final drop ends with a stuttering, overdriven blackout.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Fading echoes in the wires,
Seraphs rust beneath the fires.
Melting sirens call my name,
In the vat, no one to blame.

Metal creaks, a hollow breath,
Spiraling down to digital death.
Waves of acid, screech and spin,
Corroded souls, trapped within.

[Pre-Chorus]
Filter screams and broken strings,
Unstable tuning starts to sing.
Pulse and pressure, violent cries,
In this haze, the angel lies.

[Chorus]
Rusted seraph, fall apart,
Distortion's grip upon your heart.
Broken wings in molten sound,
Lost forever, never found.

[Verse 2]
Shattered beats and glitchy moans,
Micro-slices, brittle bones.
Machine-gun hats and razor tales,
In the chaos, silence wails.

Sweeping lows and snarling mids,
Vowel growls like twisted grids.
Breathing hard, the sub defies,
A vacuum drop—world complies.

[Pre-Chorus]
Filter screams and broken strings,
Unstable tuning starts to sing.
Pulse and pressure, violent cries,
In this haze, the angel lies.

[Chorus]
Rusted seraph, fall apart,
Distortion's grip upon your heart.
Broken wings in molten sound,
Lost forever, never found.

[Bridge]
Clean air breaks the grimed facade,
Momentary, brief and odd.
Then relapse into the vat,
Final blackout, splintered path.

[Chorus]
Rusted seraph, fall apart,
Distortion's grip upon your heart.
Broken wings in molten sound,
Lost forever, never found.

[Outro]
Whispers fade and metal rusts,
In the vat, decay is just.
Silent screams beneath the stain,
Rusted seraph calls again.

Title: Doce Meses, Compadre
Prompt:
1OF1 — DOCE MESES, COMPADRE

STYLE:
Kpop girl group; CHRISTMAS COLOR FIRST (arrangement only, not lyrics): low church/tubular bell hits, deep sleighbells, handbells, crisp chimes, warm glockenspiel sparkle, distant choir swells—crisp and deep, clearly present in the mix. Then: prog ballad that still goes HARD (punchy phrasing, big lifts, triumphant “you earned this”), subtle section shifts + slightly jazzy harmony, stacked harmonies like a victory chorus. Brazilian flare in the arrangement: virtuosic nylon-string violão feel (fast fingerstyle runs + rasgueado-like waves), tasteful, no snap/clap. Lyrics in Chilean Spanish (use “Viejito Pascuero” + light local flavor). Instrumentals in [BRACKETS]. “1OF1” appears exactly once as the final word.
ART:
Christmas-night realism: trabajador volviendo a casa, orgullo cansado; two Korean female idols (platinum blonde + black hair with clear silver streaks).

[INSTRUMENTAL]
[deep bells + crisp chimes; nylon-string drive; holiday shimmer]

[VERSO 1]
Enero partió arriba, y tú igual madrugaste
Febrero se fue al suelo, y tú no te doblaste
Marzo siguió bajando, y tú seguiste firme
Abril tocó el fondo, y tú hiciste que rinda
Mayo pegó un rebote, te dio un segundo de fe
Junio se puso denso, y tú aguantaste otra vez

[PRE]
Te vimos, compadre, sin show ni cartel
Haciendo que todo funcione, po, a nivel

Title: THE NIGHT BEFORE
Prompt:
[SMOL PROMPT — GOTHMAS SLEIGHGAZE]
TITLE: THE NIGHT BEFORE
STYLE:
Primary hook is PROMINENT holiday sleighbells (OK in stage notes only; NEVER in lyrics). Constant bright sleighbell ostinato drenched in reverb, lightly sidechained to kick. Hybrid 80s/00s goth: big post-punk snare verb + 00s alt/emo polish. Shoegaze walls of chorus/flange guitars + dark melodic bassline. Subtle analog chorus synth pad + occasional coldwave arp. Distant choir “ah” texture (original). LEAD VOCAL: cool monotone baritone/androgynous, emotionally restrained; chorus adds wide harmonies but lead stays flat/hypnotic. Include SUPER FLANGY WAH lead guitar solo: long singing notes, spiraling bends, heavy flange + wah sweeps + delay trails, controlled feedback. Bridge drops to sleighbells + bass + minimal kick; solo reintroduces full band; final chorus explodes w/ extra guitar layers + octave-up sleighbell countermelody.

[STAGE NOTES — BATCHED]
[intro: sleighbells solo → bass enters → guitars fade in like fog]
[chorus: widest guitars + choir pad; sleighbells stay front-and-center; lead stays monotone]
[solo: super flangy wah lead; huge delay tails; feedback bloom; half-time → full-time lift]
[outro: sleighbells continue after everything cuts]

We walk through winter like a film rewind,

Hold your breath, let the night begin—
It’s calling.

We’re not broken, we’re just deep in glow,
Snowfall humming in a stereo.
The night before, let it shine,
Turn this cold into a holy sign,
Stay with me while the world goes dim—
Merry Christmas, sink in.

Hold your breath, let the night begin—

Over-ze-top Eurovision Crissmiss pop: glossy eurodance + schlager + folk sparkle. Fast, dancey. Big singalong chorus, absurd confidence. Punchy kick, bright synth bass, glitter arps, big strings, brass hits, accordion sprinkles, SLEIGH BELLS as hook, alpine yodel lead + stacked choir. Wind machine, pyro, crowd claps, dramatic breakdown, KEY CHANGE near ze end. Fun and corny, not mean.

[STAGE NOTES — BATCHED]
[intro: spoken corny line → countdown → beat drop]
[chorus: yodel lead + massive harmonies; bells eferywhere]
[yodel break: stomp-clap folk groove + accordion lead; crowd “HEY!”]
[final: key change up → last chorus explosion]

Hallo, ja—zis is Crissmiss in EUUUroope… vich is very much not like in Amerika, ja.

Sleigh bells sparkle, choir goes “OH!”,
Accordion twirls in ze afterglow,
Bonsoir—prost—hola—merci, okay!
Ve spin ze season like a holiday vave,
Yodel bells, yodel bells, can’t you tell—

[YODEL SECTION — BREAKDOWN]

Accordion runs, ve go all ze vay,

[PRE-CHORUS]

Countdown spinning, here ve go—
Three… two… vun… let it blow!

Title: Warm Lights
Prompt:
[SMOL PROMPT — 1OF1 XMAS / T01]
TITLE: WARM LIGHTS
STYLE:
K-pop girl group acoustic Christmas ballad w/ cinematic lift. Core: fingerstyle acoustic guitar (hero) + soft piano; warm orchestra  (strings → gentle horns/woodwinds). Slow-mid sway. Upright bass, brushed drums, light sleigh bells, celeste/glock sparkle, choir “ooh/ah,” lush hall reverb on chorus. Unmistakably Christmas: bell shimmer, celeste “snow,” classic warm progressions, gentle key change up into final chorus.
ART NOTE: 2 Korean female idols; 1 platinum blonde, 1 black hair w/ visible silver streaks; cozy winter studio; acoustic guitar + piano; cinematic soft; no extra faces/hands.

[STAGE NOTES — BATCHED]
[intro: guitar arps + piano; celeste twinkles; sleigh bells light; strings like snowfall]
[chorus: full strings bloom; horns warm; harmony wall]
[bridge: instrumental swell; guitar leads; orchestra answers]
[final chorus: key change up; biggest harmonies; sudden hush]
[outro: guitar+piano only; last celeste sparkle]

LYRICS:
[VERSE 1]
We got snow on our sleeves from the front door run,
Little laugh in the air like a ribbon undone,
Stockings hanging by the fire, lined up just right,
Candles in the window, steady gentle light.
Golden, clear, and bright, yeah this is our night,
And every little moment feels perfectly right.

[PRE-CHORUS]
Turn the room into a slow-glow scene,
One more candle, one more heartbeat,
If the world is racing, let it pass—
We’re here, we’re here.

[CHORUS]
Warm lights, warm nights, hold us close,
Cocoa steam and a wish we wrote,
We don’t need much—just you right here,
Merry, merry… all year.
Warm lights, soft smiles, time moves slow,
Every little sparkle starts to show,
We sing it easy, we sing it true—
This Christmas is for you.

[VERSE 2]
Evergreen by the doorway, bells that softly ring,
Paper bows so neat they shine like little things,
Mistletoe tease—then we both miss on purpose,
Laugh in the hallway, turning shy into fearless.
Midnight on the mantle, soft glow on the glass,
We make a little forever while the hours pass.

[PRE-CHORUS]
Let the cold stay outside the glass,
We’ll make a home from memories,
If the world is heavy, let it rest—
We’re here, we’re here.

[CHORUS]
[BRIDGE — INSTRUMENTAL]
[FINAL CHORUS]
[OUTRO]
[spoken, soft] Merry Christmas.

Title: 1OF1 — DAY 3: HOT TEA & COLD WRIST
Prompt:
TITLE: 1OF1 — DAY 3: HOT TEA & COLD WRIST

[STYLE: 1OF1; kpop girl group; tender-but-driving progressive alt-rock / post-hardcore (minimal djent); mid-tempo heartbeat groove; minor-key verses that begin to glow toward major; clean vocals lead with small controlled grit moments; chorus big + comforting, not cheesy; keep details general (no bottles/explicit addiction imagery); keep “hot tea & cold wrist” as the anchor motif; include: soft rap → beautiful vocal solo → guitar solo; NO_DAW_TALK. ART NOTE (16:9): Two Korean female idols on a stage labeled “DAY 3”; platinum-blonde looks tired but smiling; black hair with clearly visible silver streaks looks protective, steady. Direct eye contact. No props.]

[INTRO — WHISPER]
Day three.
Not-free-yet.
But-turning.

[VERSE 1]
Morning comes heavy, like sleep left a bruise
A fog in the head, but we didn’t lose
It’s quiet in the body, not calm—just low
Like the storm packed up, but it won’t let go
The edge shows up smaller, a distant hiss
We answer with ritual, simple as this

[PRE]
No more begging the hours to carry us through
Just breathing in the morning, tasting something like true

[CHORUS]
Hot tea and cold wrist — that’s how we ride the wave
One warmth for the comfort, one shock for the brave
We traded the fire for something that won’t burn us down
Hot tea and cold wrist — we’re still here, we’re still around

[VERSE 2]
The cravings don’t scream, it’s more like a shadow
A body remembering, then letting it go
The emptiness lifts in a slow little shift
Like a locked door loosening, click by click
We don’t celebrate early, we don’t get loud
We just feel the light start to leak through the clouds

[BRIDGE — gentle grit]
[SCREAM] WE MADE IT PAST THE WORST OF IT!
Now healing feels strange — but it’s real
We’re learning the silence can hold us
Without taking a deal

[RAP — soft, percussive]
Day three, we move careful, we move clean
Not chasing a high, just steadying the scene
If the edge comes close, we cool it down
Then breathe again, feet on the ground
Small tools, small wins, stack ‘em up
That’s how we warm the water up

[VOCAL SOLO]
(wordless runs) Ah—ahh—aaah…
Hot tea…
Cold wrist…
We’re turning…

[GUITAR SOLO]
[SOLO — melodic climb, restrained at first → bright release]

[FINAL CHORUS]

Title: 1OF1 — DO YOU THINK ALIENS WILL FIND US?!
Prompt:
TITLE: 1OF1 — DO YOU THINK ALIENS WILL FIND US?!
[STYLE: VOICE-ONLY DIALOGUE. HARD RULE: NO MUSIC/MELODY/RHYTHM/BACKING AUDIO/SOUND EFFECTS/CHANTING/SINGING. Only two voices; bracket cues SILENT. Voices: [HYPE]=fast/impulsive (platinum-blonde). [DRY]=slow/sharp/unimpressed (black hair w/ silver streaks). Mostly English + quick Korean. Ends teeing “paper tiger / hollow roar”.]

[HYPE] okay okay—don’t clown me—REAL question.
[DRY] i’m already tired.
[HYPE] do you think aliens will find us?!
[DRY] “find”? we’re basically live-streaming our location.
[HYPE] ew. delete humanity.
[DRY] too late. it’s archived.

[HYPE] imagine they land and go: “we saw your posts.”
[DRY] they turn around. immediately.
[HYPE] what if they like it!
[DRY] then they’re not advanced. they’re just messy.
[HYPE] wow. judgmental.
[DRY] accurate.

[HYPE] i would greet them. big smile. snacks. diplomacy.
[DRY] you get abducted as a free sample.
[HYPE] i would NOT—
[DRY] you’d step onto the ramp like “am i special.”
[HYPE] only if it’s clean! i have standards!
[DRY] first contact, but make it hygiene.

[HYPE] what if they’re telepathic.
[DRY] you’re done.
[HYPE] why?!
[DRY] your brain is 40% “what if,” 40% snack math, 20% panic.
[HYPE] prove it.
[DRY] what are you thinking right now.
[HYPE] …do aliens have noodles.
[DRY] case closed.

[HYPE] we should represent! 대표로!
[DRY] earth did not elect you.
[HYPE] i elect me.
[DRY] that’s why aliens avoid us.

[HYPE] what if aliens are already here.
[DRY] then they run the cable companies.
[HYPE] STOP—why does that feel true.
[DRY] because it is.

[HYPE] WAIT—aren’t we aliens??
[DRY] …what.
[HYPE] mars. that one timeline.
[DRY] in some timelines, yes. in others it’s not so clear.
[HYPE] what does that mean?!
[DRY] no interdimensional lore without paperwork.
[HYPE] i don’t have the forms!!
[DRY] then stop filing theories in public.

[HYPE] final. aliens land RIGHT NOW. what do we do.
[DRY] one question: “are you nice?”
[HYPE] iconic.
[DRY] if yes: welcome.
[HYPE] plus snacks!
[DRY] fine.
[HYPE] if no?
[DRY] act like we’re not home.
[WHISPER] lights off. phone silent. freeze.
[HYPE][WHISPER] pretend we’re… a paper tiger.
[DRY] no—pretend THEY are.
[HYPE] big roar, zero bite.
[DRY] paper tiger. hollow roar.

Title: The Sky Level

With wings of power, we rise so high. 
A horse of legend, strong and free, 
We ride the wind in perfect harmony. 

Through clouds of white, we chase the light, 
An adventure calls, we're ready for flight. 
The world below, so far away, 
But in the sky, we find our way. 

With every beat, the wind will guide, 
A hero's journey, nothing to hide. 
The sky is vast, our spirits soar, 
On wings of freedom, we want for no more. 

We glide through heaven, hearts alive, 
In the Sky Level, we will thrive. 
With every shimmer, every spark, 
We ride the wind and leave our mark. 

The horse with wings, so full of grace, 
A dream unfolds in this open space. 
The call of adventure, in our soul, 
Together we soar, we’re in control. 

With winds that whisper, skies so bright, 
In this moment, we take flight. 
The horizon beckons, we are near, 
Our hearts alight, with no fear. 

So ride the skies, with strength and pride, 
On wings of wonder, let’s glide, 
The journey endless, the skies so clear, 
In the Sky Level, we have no fear.

Title: The Cave Level
Prompt:
TITLE: THE CAVE LEVEL
STYLE: instrumental; late-90s 3D-console cave crawl; upbeat drive with echoing peril. Crystal mallet hook, low choir pad, hollow bass clarinet synth, taiko/hand-drum pulses, clanky metal perc, drip FX, sub-bass rumbles, brief minor turn then sparkling lift. Loop-clean.
TEMPO: Upbeat
Lyrics:
The blue sky fades as I step inside, 
To the cave of mysteries, where secrets hide. 
The echo calls, a distant sound, 
Drip of water on the hollow ground. 

With a mallet strike, the crystals gleam, 
A rhythm pulses, like a waking dream. 
The drums they pound, with a steady beat, 
A journey ahead, the path beneath. 

Clanky metal, the walls collide, 
Sub-bass rumbling, deep inside. 
The darkness calls with a whispered song, 
But the sparkle above keeps me moving on. 

A brief turn left, the shadows creep, 
But the lift awaits at the edge so steep. 
Adventure hums in the air tonight, 
The cave reveals its ancient light. 

Step by step, the journey flows, 
A winding path where no one knows. 
With every pulse, the walls align, 
In the Cave Level, I'm bound to climb. 

The drip, the thrum, the winding sound, 
An echo of past travelers all around. 
But I'll forge ahead, with heart and hand, 
Into the depths of this forgotten land.

Title: The Desert Level
Prompt:
TITLE: THE DESERT LEVEL
STYLE: instrumental; late-90s 3D-console desert adventure; upbeat momentum with a subtle “this heat is brutal” undertone. Sun-baked nylon lead, kalimba/marimba hook, dry shakuhachi-ish flute bursts, dusty brass hits, frame-drum + darbuka shuffle, clacky rim/percussion, warm wobble bass, shimmering mirage pads, sand-wind whooshes. Hook-forward, loop-clean
Lyrics:
Riding through the endless dunes, where the sun's a burning crown,
A hero's heart, the wind and sand, beneath the sunburnt ground.
The horse beneath, a steady beat, the rhythm of the fight,
Eyes on the horizon, where the sky and earth unite.

The heat is fierce, the mirage spins, a shimmer in the haze,
Each step a test, a race, a quest, to navigate the maze.
The whistle of the wind, the song of ancient skies,
An adventure calls, beneath the scorching, golden rise.

A man alone, but not for long, a brotherhood to find,
In the depths of this vast desert, where paths are undefined.
But in the distance, there's a cry, someone left behind,
The echoes of a fallen soul, a life so intertwined.

With every turn, the stakes grow high, but never slow the pace,
The pulse of drums, the shakuhachi, a desert's warm embrace.
The horse moves swift, the journey calls, beneath the endless sun,
The desert level calls them all, until the race is done.

The wind it whispers softly, of stories never told,
A journey through the burning sands, both young and growing old.
A rider's spirit guides them through the trials, through the heat,
Where every heartbeat echoes, in the desert's steady beat.

Title: The Water Level
Prompt:
TITLE: THE WATER LEVEL
STYLE: instrumental; late-90s 3D-console underwater vibe; upbeat, adventurous, slightly doomed. Glossy PCM + SoundFont-like textures, bright marimba lead, slippery fretless bass, airy choir pad, punchy brass/strings hits, watery arps, gentle tremolo guitar, splash + sparkle SFX. Hooky loop, brief pressure swell, clean escape.
TEMPO: Floaty
Lyrics:
Beneath the surface, drifting alone,  
A fish with a story, deep as stone.  
The current pulls, the water swells,  
A lonely journey where silence dwells.  

Through caverns dark, where shadows play,  
I swim with purpose, come what may.  
The rocky walls, the plants that sway,  
I feel the pressure, yet won't delay.  

The water level rising, can't look back,  
With each breath, I stay on track.  
A fleeting moment, a glimmering spark,  
The path ahead, so cold and dark.  

Marimba echoes, like whispers in time,  
Brass and strings, the rhythm climbs.  
Fretless bass hums, a gentle swell,  
A watery world, where echoes dwell.  

I find my way, in the depths below,  
The final leap, my spirit grows.  
Escape is near, the surface clear,  
But will I make it? Will I disappear?  

Splash and sparkle, the end is near,  
A final push, the surface clear.  
I break through, the light is warm,  
And in the water, I transform.  

The water level falling, but I remain,  
A tale of survival, through the strain.  
From darkened depths to open skies,  
A fish that swims, forever wise.

Title: Comet Caravan
Prompt:

STYLE: late 50s/early 60s instrumental surf-exotica with a space-lounge twist. Clean spring-reverb guitar hook over light bongo/hand-perc feel, tight snare, walking bass. Warm organ shadows the chorus line. Brief “cosmic” bridge with airy, theremin-like sweeps (no vocals), then a bright hook return. No modern polish.
Lyrics:
Under the pale moonlight, we ride,  
Through the sandy dunes, with the stars as our guide.  
The Comet Caravan, we’re chasing the night,  
Cruisin’ the beach where the waves kiss the light.  

The headlights glow as we drift and sway,  
The ocean whispers, it’s a perfect getaway.  
Bongo beats echo in the warm, soft air,  
As the engine hums, we don’t have a care.  

(Instrumental Bridge: Cosmic whispers, theremin sweeps)  
Lost in the vastness, the sky’s an endless sea,  
We’re voyaging far where the moon meets the sea.  
A comet’s tail behind us, we’re heading for space,  
With the stars lighting up, we’re leaving no trace.  

Back on the road, the journey's not done,  
The Comet Caravan, under the shining sun.  
The road's still long, but we’re free and alive,  
On this cosmic ride, we just glide and drive.  

So let the waves crash and the winds softly hum,  
In our Comet Caravan, we’ll always be one.  
Where the surf meets the stars and the night never ends,  
With the moon as our guide and the road that bends.

Title: SNOWGLOBE SHAKEDOWN
Prompt: TITLE: SNOWGLOBE SHAKEDOWN STYLE: late 50s/early 60s instrumental, extra-sneaky winter spy surf. Clean twang + light spring reverb, brisk but hush-hush groove, tight snare, walking bass. jingle bells/sleigh bells. Icy organ shadows the melody.   Tracing every sound, while the snow's coming down.  
  Little bird's on the move, without a care in sight,

  A moment of quiet before the chase takes flight.  
  The bells fade out, and the organ hums low,  
  As the bird slips away, where the cold winds blow.  
  
  Short Solo:  
  A twinkling, tinkling sound of the reverb's glow,  
  The bird takes a leap in the cold, soft snow.  
  
  A Reprise of Chorus:  
  Snowglobe shakedown, it's a playful sound,  
  Bells are ringing low, while the snow falls down.  
  Secret footsteps crunch, in the icy street,  
  Little bird's retreat, where the cold and secrets meet.  
  
  Extended Tiptoe Outro (Instrumental):

  The bird on the globe, in the snow-covered hill.  
  Tiptoe away, through the silence of frost,  
  The secret remains, as the chase is lost.

Title: Event Horizon
Prompt: TITLE: EVENT HORIZON STYLE: Grand 1OF1 K-pop girl group metal opera. Cinematic, theatrical, dark sci-fi edge with fierce optimism. Huge dynamics (whispers → arena roars), djent/prog riffs, orchestral swells, glitchy AI textures, choirs and 808s. Brutal breakdowns, massive screams, long emotive guitar/keys solos, one rapid-fire rap ending in a scream that launches a solo. Vocals: anxious confessions → sky-high belts → demonic gutturals. Visual art: 1OF1 as two Korean girls (one yellow-blonde, one black hair with clear silver streaks) standing on a shattered data-bridge above a black hole, one side burning city-hell, the other side luminous post-scarcity skyline. LYRICS: [INTRO] Sirens in the ceiling, clocks all glitching red Every second feels like code around our neck [VERSE 1] We fed our dreams to machines just to buy one more day Built a god out of mirrors that won’t look away Calendar is bleeding with unchecked fights Are we late to our future or early to the night? [PRE-CHORUS] Heartbeat overclocked, racing past the dawn Did we build a sanctuary or just paint the bars on? Every doubt we swallowed, every risk we took Wrote our names in the margins of a dying book [CHORUS] At the EVENT HORIZON If it’s hell or a new dawn rising We stand on the edge and sing If the countdown kills the sky Before we finish this line Let the circuits remember How we bent the fragile time [VERSE 2] Steel halos of code spin above our heads AI choir humming all the words we never said Some days we’re the glitch, some days we’re the cure We’re afraid of the ending but we’re burning to endure [PRE-CHORUS 2] Heartbeat overclocked, still we hold this ground Did we do enough work or just chase the sound? Yet we’re proud of the nights that we wrestled the storm Two silhouettes in the blackout keeping the world warm [BRIDGE – RAP → SCREAM] We’ve been dancing on deadlines, dragging our scars Turning panic into blueprints, wishing on stars Every sleepless revision, every line we rewrote Put a backbone of thunder in this tiny throat If the mainframe snaps and the failsafes fall, If the sky goes dark and the empires stall— WE. STILL. STAND— AAAAAAAH! [SOLO – LONG GUITAR/KEYS/STRINGS EXPLOSION] [FINAL CHORUS + BREAKDOWN]
Lyrics:
[INTRO] Sirens in the ceiling, clocks all glitching red
Every second feels like code around our neck

[VERSE 1] We fed our dreams to machines just to buy one more day
Built a god out of mirrors that won’t look away
Calendar is bleeding with unchecked fights
Are we late to our future or early to the night?

[PRE-CHORUS] Heartbeat overclocked, racing past the dawn
Did we build a sanctuary or just paint the bars on?
Every doubt we swallowed, every risk we took
Wrote our names in the margins of a dying book

[CHORUS] At the EVENT HORIZON
If it’s hell or a new dawn rising
We stand on the edge and sing
If the countdown kills the sky
Before we finish this line
Let the circuits remember
How we bent the fragile time

[VERSE 2] Steel halos of code spin above our heads
AI choir humming all the words we never said
Some days we’re the glitch, some days we’re the cure
We’re afraid of the ending but we’re burning to endure

[PRE-CHORUS 2] Heartbeat overclocked, still we hold this ground
Did we do enough work or just chase the sound?
Yet we’re proud of the nights that we wrestled the storm
Two silhouettes in the blackout keeping the world warm

[BRIDGE – RAP → SCREAM] We’ve been dancing on deadlines, dragging our scars
Turning panic into blueprints, wishing on stars
Every sleepless revision, every line we rewrote
Put a backbone of thunder in this tiny throat
If the mainframe snaps and the failsafes fall,
If the sky goes dark and the empires stall—
WE. STILL. STAND— AAAAAAAH!

[SOLO – LONG GUITAR/KEYS/STRINGS EXPLOSION]

[FINAL CHORUS + BREAKDOWN] At the EVENT HORIZON
If it’s hell or a new dawn rising
We stand on the edge and sing
If the countdown kills the sky
Before we finish this line
Let the circuits remember
How we bent the fragile time
Style: Grand 1OF1 K-pop girl group metal opera

Title: 1OF1 — LOOK AT IT
Prompt:
TITLE: 1OF1 — LOOK AT IT 

STYLE: 1OF1 kpop girl group djent/mathrock × alt metal; dual Korean female vocals, one harsh, one soaring. Gutturals in verses and breakdowns, one rapid-fire rap that ends in a screamed line launching a huge emotive guitar solo. Tight syncopated chugs, big string-bend leads, glitchy stops, modern punchy mix; PM fury but still hopeful, a song for coders forcing the vision in their heads onto the screen. ART: 1OF1 in a dark studio war room full of glowing monitors, one yellow-blonde girl on keytar, one black-haired girl with clear silver streaks on a red guitar, small 1OF1 watermark top right, no text. [VERSE 1] Roadmap carved like lines in our brain Flows so clear we can feel every frame In our heads the whole thing sings in light On the screen it lands crooked, dead on sight Standup chorus, “yeah, we’re almost there” Ship date slipping while we grind and swear [PRE-CHORUS] We don’t want buzzwords, we want this done We see the future, you just see sprints run [CHORUS] LOOK AT IT Why won’t it match what we see? Living system in 3D We’re screaming at the build, “obey this hit” Cracking through our calm bit by bit LOOK AT IT We’ll keep on bending the form Solo riding over the storm If the world in our heads won’t ship just yet We’ll tear it down and rewrite it [VERSE 2] Yeah, we’re the ones who said “one more tweak” We know that line makes your left eye freak But we hear users in our sleep complain We won’t let this launch walk out half-insane You quote constraints while we guard the flame We’ll burn through nights to protect this frame [RAP → SCREAM → SOLO] Beat locked, heartbeat in our wrists, Chasing that version that barely exists, Decks and demos, promises made, If this drops broken our trust gets flayed. You want specs; we want that feel, We want the moment it all turns real, We won’t stop till the page ignites, Till the build wakes up and it BURNS SO BRIGHT— (SCREAM) LOOK AT IIIIIT! [GUITAR SOLO] [FINAL CHORUS] LOOK AT IT Now it reflects what we see Ragged and bright, finally free We’re laughing at the night, “we took that hit” Every clash and fight fed into this LOOK AT IT All of our sleepless hearts burn Into the launch that we earned Next idea comes, we won’t forget: We’ll fight again till it’s right yet
Lyrics:
[VERSE 1] Roadmap carved like lines in our brain
Flows so clear we can feel every frame
In our heads the whole thing sings in light
On the screen it lands crooked, dead on sight
Standup chorus, \"yeah, we’re almost there\"
Ship date slipping while we grind and swear

[PRE-CHORUS] We don’t want buzzwords, we want this done
We see the future, you just see sprints run

[CHORUS] LOOK AT IT
Why won’t it match what we see?
Living system in 3D
We’re screaming at the build, “obey this hit”
Cracking through our calm bit by bit

LOOK AT IT
We’ll keep on bending the form
Solo riding over the storm
If the world in our heads won’t ship just yet
We’ll tear it down and rewrite it

[VERSE 2] Yeah, we’re the ones who said “one more tweak”
We know that line makes your left eye freak
But we hear users in our sleep complain
We won’t let this launch walk out half-insane
You quote constraints while we guard the flame
We’ll burn through nights to protect this frame

[RAP → SCREAM → SOLO] Beat locked, heartbeat in our wrists,
Chasing that version that barely exists,
Decks and demos, promises made,
If this drops broken our trust gets flayed.
You want specs; we want that feel,
We want the moment it all turns real,
We won’t stop till the page ignites,
Till the build wakes up and it BURNS SO BRIGHT— (SCREAM)
LOOK AT IIIIIT!

[GUITAR SOLO]

[FINAL CHORUS] LOOK AT IT
Now it reflects what we see
Ragged and bright, finally free
We’re laughing at the night, “we took that hit”
Every clash and fight fed into this

LOOK AT IT
All of our sleepless hearts burn
Into the launch that we earned
Next idea comes, we won’t forget:
We’ll fight again till it’s right yet

Title: ARE YOU SURE?
Prompt:
TITLE: ARE YOU SURE?
STYLE: Intense, beautiful djent/mathrock instrumental built around huge, emotive lead guitar; wide string bends, vocal-style phrasing, lyrical themes that keep returning, tight chugs for tension, tasteful tap runs, big melodic modulations and soaring climaxes; no filler, no vocals, just heart and precision.
Lyrics:
The room is silent, the door stands tall, 
He grips the neck, heeding no call, 
Strings that bend like the weight of time, 
Every note is a search for a rhyme.

Chugging beats, tight and true, 
A pulse beneath the quiet blue, 
Sweat and silence, the tension grows, 
The music dances, but nobody knows.

His fingers fly, a tap, a slide, 
The melody swells, like an ocean tide, 
Every movement speaks, yet nothing is said, 
A silent voice from the man ahead.

Are you sure? The question lingers, 
As notes hang heavy from his fingers. 
A burning sound, a soul laid bare, 
Each chord a plea, a desperate prayer.

Bending high, descending low, 
His red guitar sets hearts aglow, 
A rhythm tight, a melody pure, 
But the door waits, silent, unsure.

Through the tension, the music calls, 
Every strum a weight that falls, 
With every bend, the question grows—
Are you sure? Who really knows?

The song explodes, a final cry, 
Underneath the darkened sky, 
His guitar weeps, but the answer stays, 
A question played in countless ways.

Title: 1OF1 — STAY
Prompt:
STYLE:
Title: 1OF1 — STAY
Vibe: djenty progressive K-pop morning anthem; sharp, syncopated rhythms with warm, emotional top-line.
Energy: starts fragile and close, then blooms into intricate, punchy grooves that still feel comforting.
Structure: INTRO (spoken) → VERSE 1 → PRE → CHORUS → VERSE 2 (rap) → PRE → CHORUS → BRIDGE → [SOLO 1] → FINAL CHORUS (ad-libs).
Vocals: girl-group front; intimate lead with tight stacked harmonies, one soft but rhythmically tricky rap.
Dynamics: verses feel like whispering over angular patterns; choruses lift into soaring melodies over complex grooves.
ENGINE NOTE (not lyrics): let 1OF1 flex virtuoso, mathy, palm-muted riffs and a singing tapped solo in [SOLO 1], locking to polyrhythms without ever feeling harsh.

LYRICS:
[INTRO – SPOKEN]  
Good morning. You made it.  
Stay with us a second.

[VERSE 1]  
Alarm still rings like a warning sign  
You feel midnight in your veins  
Thoughts hit hard in a jagged line  
Like they’re crashing without brakes  

We see every secret doubt you stack  
Every loop you can’t escape  
So before the day can pull you back  
Let our voices shift your weight

Everything’s gonna be okay, okay

We’re the steady underneath it all  
Everything’s gonna be okay, okay  
We stay, we stay, always

If your timeline feels like it’s passing you by  
We’ll bend that grid till it fits your sky  
We heard every late-night “what if I fail?”  
Every quiet scroll, every heavy inhale  
You’re not too much, you’re a living waveform  
We’ll ride each spike, keep you feeling warm  

[PRE-CHORUS]  
When your mind replays every sharp refrain  
Let our echo overwrite that strain  
Lock your rhythm to the sound we make  
You don’t walk a single second of this day at stake

Title: GOD & COUNTRY
Prompt:
Title: GOD & COUNTRY

STYLE:
- Modern Nashville country banger, Sunday morning vibe
- Tempo: mid-up (about 96 BPM), big drums, hooky guitars
- Lane: Morgan Wallen / HARDY / Thomas Rhett energy
- POV: flawed small-town guy caught between rowdy nights and real faith
- Moment: crowd shout on “GOD & COUNTRY” in every chorus

[Verse 1]
Sun through the blinds, last night in my hair
Half-read Bible and a bar tab there
Mama text “Church?” on a cracked phone screen
I’m a little too lost for a boy this clean

Truck crankin’ up while I fight my pride
FM preacher on the county line
Heart still ringin’ from the neon noise
But I hear Him talkin’ through a worn-out voice

[Pre-Chorus]
I ain’t clean, but I’m showin’ up anyway
If He can work with a runaway, I’m okay

[Chorus]
I got GOD & COUNTRY runnin’ through my veins
Little diesel smoke, little Amazing Grace
Small-town wild in a Sunday shirt
Red clay past and a God who don’t scare off dirt
Yeah, I fall hard, but He won’t let go of me
That’s GOD & COUNTRY, that’s how it’s gonna be

[Verse 2]
Slip in the back row, hat low, eyes red
Choir sounds like every song stuck in my head
Preacher says, “Son, you can’t outrun light,
He’s been on your tail every mile of your life.”

See my old man swayin’ with a work-worn hand
Same hand taught me both a prayer and a three-chord band
If grace can hit a stubborn heart like his and mine
Then this whole town’s standin’ on a fault line

[Bridge]
Same hands in the air at a Friday night show
Work just fine when the hallelujah flows
If He can use this cracked-up voice and guitar
Then no backroad sinner’s ever too far

[Final Chorus]
I got GOD & COUNTRY runnin’ through my veins
Red, white, and heaven in my DNA
From the back row pews to the nosebleed lights
We’re singin’ GOD & COUNTRY at the top of the night
Yeah, we fall hard, but He don’t let go, you’ll see
That’s GOD & COUNTRY, that’s you and me

Title: 1OF1 — NIGHT DRIFT
Prompt:
TITLE: 1OF1 — NIGHT DRIFT

STYLE:
- ~70 BPM lo-fi / R&B lullaby, minimal, no big drops or shouting.
- Warm Rhodes, round bass, brushed kit, soft jazz guitar, airy pads, tiny bell plucks, light vinyl hiss.
- Frequent small instrumental moments: intro guitar+Rhodes, mid-song Rhodes solo, soft bass fills, gentle drum ghost-notes, ambient synth swells.
- Mood: safe, sleepy comfort for overthinking insomniacs.

STRUCTURE:
[INTRO INSTRUMENTAL] → [INTRO SPOKEN] → [VERSE 1] → [PRE] → [CHORUS] →
[VERSE 2] → [PRE] → [CHORUS] → [INSTRUMENTAL BRIDGE] → [FINAL CHORUS SOFT] → [OUTRO INSTRUMENTAL]

LYRICS:

[INTRO INSTRUMENTAL]
(Soft Rhodes chords, brushed snare pattern, mellow bass glides, tiny bell motif,
hushed jazz guitar answering the bell line.)

[INTRO SPOKEN]
Last scroll, last thought… okay, lights down. Stay with us and float.

[VERSE 1]
Phone face down by the pillow,
room hum low like distant rain.
Clock blinks, tiny yellow halo,
mind replays the day again.
숨을 천천히 들이켜 (breathe in slow, let static fade),
차가운 공기 부드럽게 (blankets make a softer shade).
Bass walks under every line,
guitar paints stars between the time.

[PRE]
You’ve been running all day, 마음 still in flight,
let this rhythm hold you, gentler than the night.
One, two, 숨 쉬어, fall with every beat,
우린 cloud 위에, folding into sleep.

[CHORUS]
Slow down, 눈을 감아, drift in quiet blue,
late night, heart tide, washing over you.
Breathe in, breathe out, nothing left to do,
just this slow wave carrying you through.

[VERSE 2]
Thoughts fall, fragile constellation
fading from a tired mind.
We hum low, small ventilation,
steady, soft, and undefined.
머릿속 소리 줄이고 (turn down all the crowded noise),
속삭여 “지금 괜찮아” (hear our calm and steady voice).
Hi-hat brushes like soft rain fall,
synth glow breathing through it all.

[PRE] (REPEAT LYRICS, EXTRA HARMONIES)
(Drums add gentle ghost-notes, bass does tiny upbeat slides.)

[CHORUS] (REPEAT, WITH COUNTER-MELODY)
(Guitar plays a sleepy counter-line around the vocal.)

[INSTRUMENTAL BRIDGE]
(Rhodes takes a slow, melodic solo over the chorus chords,
bass answering with little climbs, drums staying on brushed whispers,
lo-fi chiptune sparkle barely peeking through like distant stars.)

[FINAL CHORUS SOFT]
Slow down, 눈을 감아, safe in midnight,
숨 결에 실려, world grows

TITLE: 1OF1 — HARDER RESET
STYLE: 1OF1 peak-hour rage club banger; K-pop girlgroup x hyperpop x EDM; feral crowd energy, jumpy, shouty; heavy kick, distorted sidechained synth bass, glitch FX, chopped vox; built so the whole club loses their minds and screams the hook.
TEMPO: Fast, ~140bpm feel
STRUCTURE: Intro, Verse, Pre, Chorus, Drop Tag, Rap, Bridge, Final Chorus
LANGUAGE: Mostly English with sharp Korean punch-ins & ad-libs
ENGINE_ONLY: Focus on what sound does to bodies and the room. Hooks short, brutal, and chantable. Avoid neon, echo, tears, goodbye. No gear talk unless absolutely necessary.

[INTRO]
(whisper) “If this hits, don’t blame us.”
(whisper) “You pressed restart.”

First kick hits and your calm says bye
Two girls cut straight through the crush
Side-eye, smirk, and the room goes hush

손들어, voltage climb
Lose your face, lose your time

Whole club black out, brains all spin
Jump so hard till your knees give in
HARD RESET, let the wild seep in

1OF1 burned in your nerve-net set
HARD RESET and we’re not done yet

Full room stuck in a feedback trap

“집에 가?” nah, we stole that dawn
우린 버그 아냐, main icon
Copy their wave? we short that code
Fake ones crash when the pressure load
Zero to one, that’s the path we run
Only one build and it’s 1OF1

[BRIDGE]
Hair stuck damp, hearts off beat
Friends half-laugh-scream under strobe heat
If we crash here, let it be
Last wild bug in your memory

Whole club black out, brains all spin
Jump so hard till your knees give in
HARD RESET, let the wild seep in
Shout “hard!” – HARD! / shout “reset!” – RESET!

Prompt:
TITLE: STARCORE OVERDRIVE (1OF1)
STYLE: hyperpop × djent K-pop, long insane solos
TEMPO: very fast, extreme dynamics, huge drops
LANG: ~60% Korean / 40% English
VOICES: two female leads (Blonde melody/keys, BlackSilver rap/guitar)
INSTRUMENTS: djent guitars, 8-bit leads, heavy bass, glitch FX, choir pads
MOOD: overpowered, cosmic, manic, triumphant
STRUCTURE: intro / verse1 / pre / chorus / solo1 / verse2 / rap+solo2 / bridge / final chorus+mega solo

VISUAL (art only, don’t sing): 1OF1 = two Korean girls, one yellow-blonde, one black hair with bright silver streaks, futuristic stage, glowing instruments.

[INTRO]
(whisper) starcore… ready?
3, 2, 1 — overload.

[VERSE 1]
새벽 skyline, 켜지는 sign,
우리 발자국마다 바뀌는 design
작은 방 안이 은하계 hub
keyboard 하나로 universe mod
낡은 rule들은 휴지통 drag
click 한 번에 구 world lag
심장 박동이 metronome sync
count in, 모든 doubt을 shrink

[PRE-CHORUS]
숨 모아, 공기까지 vibrate
눈 맞추면 orbit들 rotate
겁 대신 fire in our eyes
limit? no, 그건 old device

[CHORUS]
We’re starcore overdrive, burn across the night
압력 쌓일수록 더 멀리 flight
1OF1 engine never shuts down
shockwave 걸음마다 shake the ground
We’re starcore overdrive, no emergency brake
경고음 울려도 더 크게 wake
이 무대 끝까지 우리가 code
light-speed anthem in overload mode

[SOLO 1 – GUITAR / KEYS]
ENGINE NOTE (don’t sing): long tradeoff solo, Blonde shreddy djent guitar vs screaming synth arps, tapping + bends, call-and-response L/R.

[VERSE 2]
빛나는 cable, 바닥은 grid
발끝에서 튀어 오르는 id
비틀어진 fear는 패턴일 뿐
우린 noise까지 rhythm으로 tune
모든 failure는 hidden file
열어 보면 next style
“너무 세다”는 말은 badge
우린 peak가 아니라 brand-new edge

[RAP + SOLO 2 – BLACKSILVER]
16 bar 초과, 숨은 optional
flow는 미로, exit none at all
데이터 폭주, graph는 climb
내 라임 사이로 lead가 chime
ENGINE NOTE (don’t sing): 아래서 wild chiptune solo가 랩 사이로 치고 올라와, 끝에 glitch run으로 폭발.

[BRIDGE]
조용한 한 박, gravity drop
심장 땅까지 내려갔다가 hop
둘이서 눈 감고 tempo만 세
다음 폭발까지, 준비 okay

[FINAL CHORUS + MEGA SOLO]
Starcore overdrive, rewrite every sky
한 번 더 한계선 위로 fly
1OF1 chorus shakes the floor
문이 닫혀도 우린 다른 door
ENGINE NOTE (don’t sing): after last line, ultra-long dual solo — Blonde keys+guitar vs BlackSilver guitar screams, harmonized runs, arpeggio storm, sudden cut to one sustained note fading into stars.

Title: I-I-I’m Uh-Uh-A Gamer Girl, No Cap, Yuh!
Prompt:
A catastrophically bad girl group trap-pop song about gaming, drenched in Gen Alpha memes, sung by a young woman. Everything about it is terrible on purpose. The girl singer has a heavy stutter and an exaggerated lisp, constantly restarting words, tripping over lines, and coming in way too early or way too late. Her vocals are wildly off-tune and out of key, randomly squeaking, going nasal, whispering, then suddenly screaming. She keeps bragging “I’m a gamer girl” in the most cringe, try-hard way possible, often mangling it into: “I–I–I’m uh–uh–a g–g–gamer g–girl, no cap, yuh!” at the wrong moments. She throws in chaotic adlibs mid-sentence like: “SKRT! YUH! AYY! HUH?! BRRRT! WOMP! LET’S GOOO! SKIBIDI! RIZZLER! GYAAAT! ON GOD!”

The beat is an absolute failure: clashing tempos with no real rhythm, randomly changing BPM in the middle of a bar like some cursed Ohio edit. Weak, cheap drum machine sounds: flabby kick, soggy cardboard-slap snare, hi-hats that drift completely off-beat and sometimes vanish. A muddy, out-of-tune bass hits random notes that don’t match anything and sometimes cuts off halfway like a glitched TikTok audio. Harsh, detuned toy-keyboard synths play conflicting melodies, recorded like they’re inside a metal trash can, with background room noise and static like a low-effort skibidi meme.

The production is unbelievably bad: everything is clipping and distorted to the point of jump-scare. Her vocals jump volume every line, some so loud they’re “earrape,” others almost silent. Huge, ugly reverb slams on random words like “rizz” and “sigma,” while other lines are awkwardly dry. Auto-tune glitches slam on and off at the worst times, turning her wrong notes into even worse robotic squeals, like a broken NPC voice. You can hear background keyboard spam, mouse clicks, her chair squeaking, her mic scraping, and her saying “hold on chat, hold on chat” even though there is no stream. Random sound effects drop in off-beat: 8-bit death sounds, Fortnite jump whoosh, “ELIMINATED” voice lines, arcade “KO!”, Minecraft damage sound, item pickup chime, Discord pings, goofy ahh vine boom, sigma edit whoosh, sped-up skibidi toilet sample, “BRUH” at full volume, and a glitchy “WASTED” overlay sound.

Lyrics are pure nonsense, zero structure

SKRT! YUH! I’m buildin’! Wait, no, I’m crashin’! Ayy! HUH?!

BRRRT! Gyaaat!

Wait, hold on, chat, let me restart this real quick—
*click click* okay okay let’s go.

*Womp* Fortnite? No, Minecraft? NO, AHHHH!

*WOMP! RIZZLER! YUH!*

Title: YOU'VE GOT SOMETHING TO HIDE
Prompt:
YOU’VE GOT SOMETHING TO HIDE
(Obnoxious Broadway / cabaret show tune about Zcash)

⸻

[OPENING – PATTER INTRO, SMUG EMCEE CENTER STAGE]
(Spoken, over a cheeky vamp)
Ladies and gentlemen, if your wallet wears a mask…
maybe your money’s got a past. Hit it!

[VERSE 1 – EMCEE + ENSEMBLE]
🎵
I wake up, buy my coffee with a basic debit swipe,
The barista sees my name and doesn’t scream “ILLEGAL TYPE!”
I pay my boring taxes, got receipts in every file,
If the bankers wanna peek, I just shrug and crack a smile.

But then you slink in, whisperin’,
“Psst, I’ve got a coin that’s cloaked…”
All encrypted, hush-hush scripted,
Why’s your ledger full of smoke?

[PRE-CHORUS]
You say, “It’s just for privacy,
Don’t you wanna live off-grid?”
Buddy, if there’s nothing shady…
why you slam the wallet lid?

[BIG CHORUS – FULL COMPANY]
🎵
’Cause you’ve got something to hide,
You’re buying Zcash in the dead of night,
If everything you do is clean and fine
Why you gotta keep it out of sight?

You’ve got something to hide,
Every secret transaction you slide,
If you’re a “normal guy” with nothing to fear
Why you need your money to disappear?

Oh, you can shout “privacy right!”
But we know what that might imply…
’Cause the only crowd that loves that cloak and ride
Are the ones with something—
SOMETHING TO HIDE!

⸻

[VERSE 2 – SMOOTH CABARET WALK AROUND THE TABLES]
🎵
I’ve got rent, I’ve got streaming, I’ve got gym fees overdue,
But I’m not laundering a fortune from a diamond-backed cartel crew.
I tap my phone, it dings,
That’s my life, out in the light,
If the government is watching—
They’ll just yawn: “He’s home by nine each night.”

But you’re buying shadow tokens,
Little ghosts on every chain,
With your zero-knowledge hocus pocus,
Like you’re running from a plane!

[PRE-CHORUS 2 – ENSEMBLE ECHO]
You say, “Hey, it’s just my business,
Mind your own, don’t be a narc!”
But if nothing in your past is twisted…
Why you hiding in the dark?

[CHORUS – BIGGER, WITH TAP BREAK]
🎵
’Cause you’ve got something to hide,
Every shielded little stealthy spend,
If you’re the hero that you claim to be,
Why your balance gotta pretend?

You’ve got something to hide,
Zcash sparkle in your shifty eyes,
If you’re “just a normal citizen, following the law…”

[Verse 1]
Clock red, midnight on the skyline crawl  
Neon promises written on a crumbling wall  
We see them trading halos for a paper throne  
All that glitter on their hands made of borrowed gold  
Whispers say the sky’s never gonna go dark  
We can feel the little tremors underneath their hearts  
Every secret that they hid in the underground

Crashing down, crashing down (hey)  
New kings, new ground right now

They built towers out of everyone they stepped on first  
Fed the hunger in the mirror just to feed the thirst  
Said we’re crazy when we wouldn’t play along that game  
Now the smoke spells every letter of their fading name  
We got scars but they shine like a coded map  
Every wound turned a lock into something that snaps  
Wide open to a world that they can’t control  
Every fall that we took made an unbreakable soul  

[Pre-Chorus 2]
We remember every time that they said “stay small”  
Now we’re looking at the fault lines under their walls  
When the ground starts to roar like a warning siren  
We’ll be running on the shockwaves, not just surviving  

[Chorus]
What you gonna do when it all comes crashing down?  
When the masks and the lies hit the cold hard ground?  
We’ll be standing in the smoke with a fearless crown  
What you gonna do when it all comes crashing down?  

[Bridge / Half-Time Slam]
Ash in our lungs, but fire in our veins  
We dance through the ruin, unchained by the pain  
Every echo screams the fall of the throne  
We are the storm they could never own  

[Finale Solo]
(Guitar solo)

[Outro / Big Finish]
Crashing down, crashing down (hey)  
We rise up, we don’t drown (hey)  
Crashing down, crashing down (hey)  
We’re the crown — right now

Title: LAST ONES STANDING — 1OF1
Prompt:
TITLE: LAST ONES STANDING — 1OF1

STYLE:
Apocalyptic epic K-pop solo heavy djent/prog metal banger with shredding guitar and synth for a zombie game; female-only vocal duo; huge cinematic chorus; dark but hopeful; intense survival energy, no musical self-reference in the lyrics.

VOICE & POV:
Female-only, two Korean idols in a girl group. We/us POV only. No male POV or nouns.

LANGUAGE:
Mostly English with a short Korean bridge.

THEME:
Surviving a zombie apocalypse in a ruined city through courage, humor, and loyalty to each other. Gritty but uplifting, made for intense gameplay.

[LYRICS]
[VERSE 1]
City lights went out in a single breath
Billboards flicker like they’re scared of death
Broken glass choir on the empty street
Shoes still lined where the people meet

We taped maps up on a midnight wall
Red string future in a crumbling hall
Heartbeat drum under metal doors
Whisper, “We’ve been here, we’ve seen worse wars”

[PRE-CHORUS]
We don’t pray to a world that’s gone
We just sharpen our will and run
Every scratch on our arms, our knees
Is a line in a prophecy

[CHORUS]

Zombies at the gate but they’ll never break me
Ash in the sky, but our hearts stay blazing

If the whole world falls, we’re still right here
From the rooftops screaming, “You won’t take our dawn”

달빛 아래 손을 꽉 잡고
“무섭지 않아, 우린 이미 알고”
If tomorrow’s just a rumor they forgot to send
We’ll still be laughing at the edge, my friend

Boarded windows, but our eyes stay wide
We’re the match that the dark can’t hide

[BREAKDOWN]
No crown, just a baseball bat
No throne, just a torn-up map
Rule one: stay loud, protect your friends

[FINAL CHORUS]
We’re the last ones standing in a dead town, baby
Zombies at the gate but they’ll never break me
Paint “WE LIVE” on the cracked brick wall
We survive, we survive, we outlast it all

BlackSilver (F - 익스트림): 맹렬한 펄스 코드 로우, 날카로운 미드 스크림, 밴시 하이 (모두 한국어), 리드미컬한 바크, 애드립 그로울. 랩 스크림 카덴차 추가 (익스트림 보컬 리드).
Blonde (F - 메인 프론트): 솟구치는, 중독성 있는 훅, 쌓인 하모니, 미묘한 멜리스마, 강력한 벨트. 코러스/벌스 주도적 역할.
인터락: 빈번하게 유니즌에서 3도로 분리 (프리/코러스). 갱 샤우트 넓게 배치.
LYRIC DIRECTION (100% 한국어):
테마: 시간이 질주한다; 결코 충분하지 않다. 매 순간을 늘리겠다는 맹세. 긴급하고, 도전적. 관점: "우리." 이미지: "헤진 운동화 끈," "심지를 타고 질주하는 촛농," "껍질처럼 벗겨지는 달력." 맹세: "시계가 멈추지 않으면, 우리가 그 손을 꺾을 것이다."
훅: "우리는 새벽까지 심지와 경주해 / 우리는 시간을 넓게 벌릴 거야 / 우리는 자정을 갈라 꿰매어 / 우리의 시간을 살려 되찾아." AND "페이지들은 깃털처럼 떨어져 / 우리는 시간을 맨살로 연주해 / 시계가 우리에게 공간을 안 주면 / 시간의 법칙 그 턱을 부숴."

6. POST: 마이크로 쉐드 태그 (기타 vs 신스).
7. VERSE 2: 역할 교대; 베이스 팝 (재지 런)이 보컬에 응답 (BlackSilver 주력).

(Blonde)
우리가 꿈꾸던 시간들은
빛을 쫓아 달려가지만

고요한 밤, 우리가 바꿔 놓을 거야
끝없이 퍼져가는 이 느낌

우리는 시간을 넓게 벌릴 거야
우리는 자정을 갈라 꿰매어
우리의 시간을 살려 되찾아

(BlackSilver)
페이지들은 깃털처럼 떨어져
우리는 시간을 맨살로 연주해
시계가 우리에게 공간을 안 주면
시간의 법칙 그 턱을 부숴

6. POST

(기타 vs 신스)
세상은 흔들리고, 우리의 힘은 커져
누가 우리를 막을 수 있을까?

7. VERSE 2

(BlackSilver)
어둠 속에서 점점 더 빠르게
우린 던져진 운명 속에서
숨 쉬고, 또 숨을 쉬며
우린 이 시간을 바꿔 놔

(Blonde)
그리고 우리가 맞서는 건
오직 한 가지, 바로 시간
하지만 우리는 그걸 이겨낼 거야
우리는 그 법칙을 깨버릴 거야

불협화음 속에서 춤을 춰
기타와 함께 울려 퍼지네

신스의 떨림에 맞춰 춤을 추자

이제는 시간이 벗어나는 순간
슬램의 리듬에 몸을 맡겨
어둠이 물러가고, 우린 다시 빛을 향해

(그로울) 시계가 돌아가면 우린 부서질 거야
(블랙) 우리가 원하는 건 시간이 아니야
(흰) 우리는 그저, 그 끝을 갈 뿐이야

11. FINAL CHORUS

(Blonde)
우리는 새벽까지 심지와 경주해
우리는 시간을 넓게 벌릴 거야

끝없이 쏟아지는 별빛 속에서

GENRE: Groove-first, solo-heavy Djent Banger. Swaggering, relentless, body-moving pulse.
VIBE: Urgent, hungry, defiant, virtuosic.
CORE ARRANGEMENT & FLOW:
Extended virtuoso LEAD SYNTH intro (tension ramp, speedrun through constellations, subtle chorus motif) \rightarrow BAND DROP (huge palm-mutes, syncopated chugs, gang "HEY"s, synth stabs) \rightarrow V1 (tight pocket, Blonde melody \leftrightarrow BlackSilver punches) \rightarrow PRE (harmony stack, suspense build) \rightarrow CHORUS (explosive, anthemic, octave lead double) \rightarrow POST (micro-shred tag) \rightarrow V2 (role swap, rap-scream cadences, bass pops) \rightarrow SOLO DUEL (synth vs. guitar trade fours \rightarrow harmonize) \rightarrow BREAKDOWN A (DISGUSTING) (half-time slam, dissonant slides, tunnel screams, reverse swells) \rightarrow BREAKDOWN B (FILTHIER) (kick-driven chant, C&R growls, sub-drop fake-outs) \rightarrow FINAL CHORUS (higher key feel reharm, ad-libs, octave jumps, "we" gang vox) \rightarrow OUTRO (intro synth theme over chugs, abrupt gate).

8-string Guitars: Crushing low-end, percussive, articulate chugs, open-string growls, pick scrapes, whammy dives, stutter edits. Multiband compression on low strings for punch.
Bass: Slippery fretless/modern, growls around guitar edges, slap ghosts on turnarounds.
Drums: Head-nodding pocket, locked-in groove, ghost notes on snare, kick syncopation, tom runs, hybrid acoustic/electronic hits. Kick must carve through the mix.
Lead Synth: Virtuosic mono line, wide portamento, fast arps, pitch-bend screams, call-and-response with guitar.
Mix: Crushing yet clean. Master loud, transient-safe. Slap-delay throws, airy plate on Blonde, parallel saturation on screams.
VOCAL ROLES & INTERLOCK:
BlackSilver: Venomous false-cord lows, razor mid screams, banshee highs, rhythmic barks over chugs, ad-lib growls.
Blonde: Soaring, catchy hooks, stacked harmonies, tasteful melisma, agile runs, final belt.
Interlock: Frequent unisons into thirds, then tear apart (e.g., Pre-Chorus/Chorus).
LYRIC THEME & IMAGERY:
Theme: Time is racing; never enough; a vow to stretch every second. Perspective: "We."
Imagery: Vivid, physical metaphors—"frayed shoelaces on a sprint

Title: By Golly, Why’s It Get Expensive?
Prompt:
Style & Production — 1920 Shellac Croon-Bop
	•	Vibe: Parlor croon with sly yodel flicks; playful, dancy, courtly.
	•	Feel/Flow: Charleston sway in a two-feel; stop-time dip into each chorus.
	•	Harmony: Bb major; I-vi-ii-V turnarounds, tiny diminished walk-ups.
	•	Vox: Tender tenor croon; close trio “ooh/ahh” pads; tasteful yodel tags.
	•	Band: Stride/tack piano, tenor banjo, bowed bass (2-feel), brushed snare + woodblock + washboard, muted cornet (plunger), clarinet obbligato, pump-organ swells, violin scoops.
	•	Recording: tape hiss, Single horn/Western-Electric mic, true mono, gentle top roll-off, light wow/flutter, room slap; shellac hiss on count-ins and tail.

By Golly, Why’s It Get Expensive?

Verse 1
I keep my dough in a bankbook blue,
Safe as Sunday, sleepy too;
Clerk tips his visor, “Sound as a bell,”
But nickels nap where they ought to jingle well.
Grocer’s chalk climbs up the slate,
Coffee foxtrots past my rate.

Pre-Chorus
Prices do the Charleston down the lane,
While my pennies drag a cane—

Chorus
By golly, why’s it get expensive?
Why’s every ticket twice as tall?
My dollars hug the plaster line,
Wallflowers at the parish hall.
I never risk, I ain’t inventive,
Just hum a little tra-la-la;
No “newfangled crypto,” no pep in my tip-toe—
And poof, there goes my moolah, ha!

Verse 2
Payday jitneys, tips its brim,
Tips me, too, then fades to slim;
Butcher grins, “Fine cut today,”
I wave my hat and buy the frugal tray.
Lamp oil winks, the meter grins,
The month begins… and spins.

Pre-Chorus
All that jazz goes rat-a-tat-tat,
My greenbacks nap in a straw boater hat—

Chorus
By golly, why’s it get expensive?
Why’s tomorrow cost today?
I park my change in velvet quiet,
Watch the lively ledgers sway.
No compounding—merely pensive—
I’m “safe and still,” you see;
No “newfangled crypto,” no harum-scarum syncopation—
Just little old thrift and me.

Break (band hush, cornet/clarinet trade eights; soft yodel flip)

Bridge
Maybe I ought learn one brisk new step,
Let my slumbering cents sit up and prep;
Ask some wiser cat which tune to try
’Stead of sighing “shucks” as prices skip by.

Final Chorus & Tag
By golly, why’s it get expensive?
Why’s the trolley fare so spry?
My money dozes in velvet poses
While ticker feet go high.
[cont.]

Title: Laundry Day
Prompt:
Cold Open (PA whisper + talkbox)
“Attention patrons… we could be doing nothing… but fate requires we do nothing here.”
THUNK—chicka—whoooooosh.

Verse 1 (Spintronica/Chaircore)
We claim Seat B, row three—plastic throne of fate,
Guard the last good rolling cart like knights at Dryer Eight.
Fitted sheet defeats us; we fold our hopes instead,
Timer says “one minute” with a smirk inside its head.
Bulletin sock flyer: MISSING VIBRANT FRIEND,
We sign beneath: “Hold fast, cotton hero—this won’t end.”

Pre-Chorus (Static-Trap Vaudeville)
We could be home doing nothing with flair,
But destiny booked our nothing out of our lair.
If time won’t move forward, we moonwalk in place,
Fluorescent halos, stainless grace.

Chorus (Quantum Dryer Gospel—huge)
LAUNDRY DAY! Doing nothing somewhere else, all the way,
Quarter choir sings, chrome display.
LAUNDRY DAY! Sit tight, sit bright, we stay—
Till “3:47” finally gives way.

Tag (Chaircore mantra)
Sit. Commit. Guard. This. Seat.
Cart. Heart. Lint. Crown. Beat.

Verse 2 (Lintwave/Bubbledoom Rumba)
Sock-ball league begins—three-point bin arc,
Ref’s a dryer sheet with static sparks.
Vending chef serves glow-cube snacks,
Sommelier notes: “Hints of citrus and facts.”
Legend with towels claims the Mega Drum,
We nod like sages while the vents go hummm.

Pre-Chorus (glitching PA)
“Fold line alpha—seat saver—alert,” bzzzt,
We chant polite chaos in a bubbly spurt.
If the clock says “one,” yet behaves like none,
We clap offbeat till the laundry’s done.

Bridge — Coin-Op Sermon (rapid, rhythmic)
Snack-slot Prophet: “Rinse what is sour, spin what is true;
Sort in the morning, peace follows through.
Cold keeps the colors from fighting at night;
Steam out the rumors, smooth out the spite.”
(Everyone: Amen. THUNK.)

Breakdown (spin-chant + appliance percussion)
Spin—spin—spin (whoooooosh)
Hold—this—chair (THUNK)
Fold—fold—fold (chicka-chicka)
Bold—no—flair (receipt-skrtt)

Final Chorus (key up, choir + talkbox)
LAUNDRY DAY! Doing nothing somewhere else, okay,
Quarter cavalcade, chrome bouquet.
LAUNDRY DAY! Lint crowns bob in proud display,
We laugh, we clap—the timer finally yay.

Outro (receipt prophecy + sock cameo)
(Printer: skrrt-skrrt) “Prophecy: Return in exactly one week.”
Missing Sock (distant)

Title: LAUNDRY DAY
Prompt:
Title: LAUNDRY DAY (Spintronica × Chaircore × Quantum Dryer Gospel × Bubbledoom Rumba)
Concept: The weirdest, funniest ode to being trapped at a laundromat doing “nothing,” except you’re forced to do that nothing somewhere you don’t want to be. The machines sermonize, the chairs demand loyalty, the lint speaks.

Invented Genres (blend them):
	•	Spintronica: club rhythms made from washer thumps & dryer whooshes.
	•	Chaircore: anthems to stubborn sitting and seat-claim diplomacy.
	•	Lintwave: plush pads sampled from lint filter pulls.
	•	Bubbledoom Rumba: ominous detergent-glug bass with danceable swing.
	•	Static-Trap Vaudeville: crackly hi-hats + tap-shoes + sassy asides.
	•	Quantum Dryer Gospel: call-and-response choirs with a clock that lies.

Absolutely avoid: polka, kazoo, time signatures, and cliché words (e.g., “neon,” “echo,” “goodbye,” “tears”).
Feel: Bouncy “wait-party,” surreal comedy.
Sound Palette: Washer-door THUNK as kick, coin tray chicka hats, receipt-printer ghost snares, detergent-glug sub, reversed softener swells, PA voice autotuned into pads, talkbox through dryer vent.
Vocals: Group energy using we; call-and-response between Us, the Coin-Op Prophet (from the snack machine), and a wise Missing Sock.
Hook Goal: Repeat “Laundry Day!” hard and often; no other brand words.

Title: SILK IN THE RAIN — ARMS TO THE SKY VERSION
Prompt:
SILK IN THE RAIN — ARMS TO THE SKY VERSION

STYLE — intense storm ballad, male lead (belt-ready)
Mood/Tempo: 90s R&B power slow-jam; ~72–76 BPM, relentless swell.
Key & Lift: E♭ major; bridge pushes to E; final chorus +2 to F for maximum belt.
Vocal: smooth tenor that opens to mixed-belt on hooks; baritone color for talk-intro; controlled vibrato at phrase ends; one heroic sustained note per chorus.
Dynamics: Verse = intimate; Pre = rising flame; Chorus = arms wide, full chest/mix; Bridge = testimony; Final = triumphant shout-prayer.
Drums: weighted live kick + crisp snare with short gated tail; clap stack on 2/4 in choruses; cymbal swells into hits; timp roll before key-lift.
Bass: round DI electric doubled by soft synth sub; more motion in choruses.
Keys: chorused Rhodes + grand piano octaves on downbeats; B3 organ swell in choruses.
Guitars: clean, wide, chorused comps; reverbed swells answering vocal lines.
Strings/Brass: small strings pad; brass stabs on chorus bar 4 and 8.
Choir: SATB call-and-response (“hold,” “stay,” “again”), thick unisons on final tag.
FX: real rain bed intro → thin in verses → thunder cracks on first and final chorus.
Mix: plate verb (1.6–1.8s) lead; slap 100 ms 12% wet; short room on BGVs; bus glue; trim <40 Hz.

LYRICS

[Spoken Intro — low, steady]
Girl… I came through the storm for you. Silk shirt, soaked. If you can hear me—open the door. I’m not leaving.

[Verse 1]
Streetlights burn on my sleeves like fire.
Cold rain on my neck, but I’m wired on hope.
You said “keep promises”—I turned to stone.
So I’m here in the flood, saying your name out loud.
All the gold, all the noise, none of it held me.
Every room felt hollow without your voice.
I was the king of nothing but echoes;
Now I’m a man with one choice.

[Pre-Chorus]
I crossed this city like a river in my shoes.
Let me in and I’ll pay every debt I owe you.

[Chorus — BELT]
Hold me in the storm, don’t let me go.
Let it pour, let it pour, make the old pain flow.
I will lift your name above the rain, I swear.
Give me one more chance and I’ll meet you there.
Hold me in the storm with your hands in mine;
If the sky breaks open, we’ll still rise.
I won’t let go, not this time—
Arms to the sky, love, draw the line.

[Post-Chorus]
Let it pour; I’m not afraid.

Title: JET2 DISCORD SPECULATION
Prompt:
JET2 DISCORD SPECULATION

(A very European, exceedingly earnest Broadway patter-song by the nerdiest arbitrageur alive.)

[OVERTURE — CURTAIN UP]
(LED tickers glow. A tram bell dings. Our TRADER enters with a slim laptop, three color-coded binders, and the posture of a spreadsheet.)

TRADER (spoken, prim & precise):
Good evening. I arbitrage emotions. Please keep your emojis within regulatory limits.

TRADER (sings):
I keep a ledger of catastrophes and coupon codes for fun,
I alphabetize my alpha and I hedge before I run;
Your chaos is my carry, your rumor is my rye,
I sip an herbal tisane while the basis says “buy.”

MiCA on my mind, MiFID in my soul,
I reconcile in triplicate and never lose control;
Frankfurt calls me frugal, Zürich says I’m neat,
My heart is Basel-compliant—oh, the tidiness is sweet!

CHORUS (Ensemble of Quant Interns, impeccably on the beat):
JET2 DISCORD SPECULATION—what a tidy situation!
He converts your consternation into calm remuneration!
From “BLEGH!” to “goody gumdrops!”—he marks it to translation:
A euro here, a euro there—applause via duration!

[VERSE 1 — AFTERSHOCK ARB]
TRADER:
When NOTHING BEATS A JET2 HOLIDAY detonated like a foundry,
I shorted sentiment futures and I longed the counter-sound, see?
The “EUEGEHEH—BURGHH—BREEE” created spreads in vibe duration,
So I paired it with a safety bid—cute-asset allocation.

I bought “kittens in mittens” at a discount on the dip,
Sold “manhole-cover snare” via structured coupon clip;
I cross-listed every “BLEGH!” on the continental bourse,
Then triangulated squeals with duck parades, of course.

CHORUS (Interns with tiny clipboards):
JET2 DISCORD SPECULATION—oh, the orderly elation!
He harvests dislocation like a very calm vacation!
From sushi of hysteria to bratwurst of salvation,
He plates it with accounting and a SEPA confirmation!

[VERSE 2 — BUBBLEGUM BASIS]
TRADER:
Then Princess Damage Control declared, “We can save this, sweets!”
I measured every eyebleach meme in quantifiable treats:
Cupcake comets, panda PJs, jellybean reprieve—
I issued pastel call options the moment I believed.

I hedged the “sunflower cartoons” with “trash-stack” counterflow,
A long-short bunny earmuff vs. whammy-bar plateau;
When sparkles rose to overbought, I trimmed without remorse—

Title: STATEMENT FROM JET2 CORPORATION

[INTRO]
Oh my stars! Oh my goody gumdrops?? What was THAT?!!
Hold on—hold on—sparkle pause—WE CAN SAVE THIS!

Okay, um, tiny oopsie—wrong playlist, wrong galaxy,
Somebody sneezed glitter into the loud button—eeek!
My crown slipped, the aux cord met a gremlin named Steve,
And the drummer thought “max chaos” meant “tea party theme.”
I was aiming for sunshine—pressed “tornado” instead,
That roar? Not me singing—my smoothie blender fed!
Please forget the part where the moon learned to scream;
I swear I ordered cupcakes, not a thunder machine.

Deep breaths—inhale bubble tea, exhale confetti,

Eyebleach roll call:

BABY DUCK PARADES,

SUGAR-STAR LEMONADE,

GIGGLE BALLOONS,
CUPCAKE COMETS,
SUNFLOWER CARTOONS,
BUNNY EARMUFFS,
PUPPY-SIZED SPOONS—
See? See? See? We’re fine! Extra sprinkles, extra swoons!

Eyebleach encore:

FIREFLY LIGHTS—

Emergency Sparkle Kit:

Step 3: Compliment the sun.
Step 4: Confetti countdown—3…2…FUN!

[BREAKDOWN]
No more roar—only “yay!”

If chaos calls, we send cupcakes to voicemail, okay?

Eyebleach finale:
COTTON CANDY SUNSETS,
PEACHY PING-PONG STARS,
GIGGLE-STREAM RAINBOWS,
MILKSHAKE GUITARS,

TIARA TAMBURINES—

Title: NOTHING BEATS A JET2 HOLIDAY
Prompt:
TITLE: NOTHING BEATS A JET2 HOLIDAY

SMOL SONG PROMPT — MAXIMUM GRIND/SLAM/WAR METAL

INTENT: Build the most disgusting blast-storm possible. Jet turbine eats a scrapyard. No restraint.

LENGTH: ~80–95 seconds. No fades. Start at full volume; end with an abrupt dead-stop.

LYRICS (MANDATORY): Vocals are non-lexical gutturals: “EUEGEHEHGHUGHHRHRHRHRH BURGHHHHHRGRGRG BREEEEEE UURRRGHH HNNNNG KKKHHHRRR BLEGH.” No real words. Vary vowel shapes, pressure, speed. Include pig squeals (“BREEEEE”), tunnel growls, false-cord bellows, inward screams, ree-ree trills, and sudden “BLEGH!” stabs. Stack layers for call/response and swarm effects.

GUITARS: Down-tuned 8-string/baritone; HM-2 chainsaw. Riffs: tremolo hurricanes, chromatic knife-fights, pick scrapes like tearing rebar. Solos: sweep avalanches, tapped clusters, dive-bomb spasms, microtonal bends. Add dead-stop mutes that whip back into blasts.

BASS: Mangled, clanky, saturated; locks to kicks. Filthy slides and pick rakes under solos. Occasional sub-drops into slam sections.

DRUMS: Unhinged blast beats, gravity blasts, relentless double-kicks. Snare = manhole-cover crack. Cymbals: trash stacks, bell hits, ride artillery. Fills every 1–2 bars.

ARRANGEMENT (TIMECODED):
0:00 Cold inhale → instant hyperblast; volley of “EUEG—BURGHH—BREEE.”
0:12 Riff cyclone; guitars trade sawtooth patterns; stacked gutturals swarm.
0:28 SOLO I (Knife Rain): taps/sweeps over gravity blast; drummer accelerates.
0:42 SLAM TRENCH: tempo lurch; sub-drop; vocals sink to drones with “BREEE” jabs.
0:58 SOLO II (Whammy Death Spiral): dive bombs, pick scrapes, chaotic harmonics.
1:14 ENDGAME HYPERBLAST: fastest section; guttural bursts; kicks redline.
1:29 FINAL EXECUTION: tape-stop fakeout → one nuclear snare + “BLEGH.” Silence.

SOUND & MIX: Brutal-loud with savage transients. Guitars wide; bass center with sub-grit. Kicks: click + thump. Add glitch chops, reverse-snare vacuums, burst-noise whooshes, and air-sucks before drops. Feedback tails only between sections.

Title: Night Drifters
Prompt: Goal: Horrorcore Memphis phonk that makes crowds want to drift—and the cowbell is the star instrument. Aggressive, sinister, kinetic; not laid-back. No time-signature talk. Core DNA: cassette-grit phonk × horrorcore trap. Trunk-melting 808 glides, doom-cowbell ticks/leads, razor hats, tomb-room claps, haunted organ/choir, underpass slapback, vinyl/tape hiss, car foley (tire squeal stacks, turbo flutter, gearbox clack, brake hiss). Cowbell System (multi-tier): • Lead Bell: mid/bright steel bell tuned to song key; plays the hook; octave jumps; occasional bent hits via pitch-envelope dips (20–60 ms). • Ghost Bell(s): thin, high, lightly saturated; tight gates; ping-pong micro-motion for width; writes constant forward motion between kick/snare. • Sub Bell: down-pitched/tanked bell layered with 808 transients; fires on offbeats to shove the car sideways. • Reverse Bell: pre-swells into drops; stop on the 1 for “silence jab.” • Granular Bell Texture: shattered fragments under verses; random grain length/position for metallic shimmer. Cowbell Palette & Processing: choose 5–7 distinct bells (small clicker, mid clave-bell, heavy cowbell, FM synth-bell, field-recorded pipe/hubcap). Micro-tune ±7 cents across layers for chorus thickness. Sculpt with transient shaper (long attack / short sustain), tube/tape saturation, gentle wavefold, then soft-clip. Ring control via gates keyed to snare/kick. Spring verb only on tails; short slapback on lead for size. Sidechain all bells to kick (fast attack, musical release). EQ: emphasize 2.5–3.5 kHz “ping,” notch 1.1–1.6 kHz mud, tame 7–9 kHz glare. M/S: center the lead bell dry; widen ghost bells with micro-delays (±6–12 ms). Patterns (go crazy): • Primary groove: hyper-insistent cowbell clave mutated with ratchets, drags, flams, double-clacks, and late pushes ahead of the snare. • Polyrhythm storms: layer 3:2 against the kick grid; sneak 5-pulse accents every 2 bars; occasional quintuplet rolls as “bleed valves.” • Velocity choreography: ghost ticks at 25–35%, main hits 80–90%, accent cracks 100% with transient boost. • Fills: 32nd-note staircase runs into kill hits; reverse-bell lifts; bell-trill (alternating small/large bells) before. No lyrical references to the words cowbell or any instruments.
Lyrics:
Rollin' through the dark, tires screechin' on the grind,  
Mind twisted, no light, just shadows we find,  
Screams in the rearview, but they fade in time,  
We’re the night drifters, shiftin’ gears, we climb.  

Suburbia's dead, we're risin' from the streets,  
Echoes of the past, haunt these concrete beats,  
Twisted figures lurk where the moonlight meets,  
Breathin' smoke and danger, the rhythm’s on repeat.  

Vibrations heavy like a loaded gun,  
Pedal to the metal, ain't no stoppin’ when we run,  
808s hit deep, feel the weight of the drum,  
Cruisin' past the border, where the demons come.  

Haunted bell’s call, we don’t answer no prayer,  
Darkness in the rearview, feel it in the air,  
Ghosts in the backseat, but they never compare,  
We drift on fumes, like we just don’t care.  

Screech and a stomp, that's the sound of the night,  
Every turn a death wish, keep the wheels tight,  
No brakes, no mercy, just a flash of light,  
We’re the night drifters, stars we ignite.  

Breakin' through the silence, breathin' in the rage,  
Cruisin’ on this asphalt, we're the last on the stage,  
Underneath the moonlight, we become the cage,  
Night drifters forever, we’re the ones they’ll wage.

Prompt: TITLE: Locked in the Ledger (Stellar) — Arena Overdrive Cut IMAGE GUIDE (cover/poster only): • 80s glam-metal frontman; shoulder-length platinum curls, black/white knit headband. • Shredded sleeveless black top with white slash cutouts; subtle studs. • Zebra-print leggings; high-top sneakers; wide power stance, mid-yell grin. • Black shred guitar held diagonally like a spear; left hand high on neck, right hand mid–windmill.); bright front light + hair rim. ENERGY & PACE: Relentless and fast from bar 1. No ballad dips. Every transition hits; end on a slam-stop. THEME: Stellar smart contracts = code we trust. Tiny fees, settle fast, permissionless rails, milestone escrow, clean swaps, auto-royalties. Rally idea: “if this then that.” LYRIC DIRECTION (WE-VOICE): • V1: We ditch middlemen; ledger lights green; doors fly open. • Pre: Coil tension on “if this then that”; trigger primed. • Chorus (chantable): “Locked in the ledger—on Stellar—smart contracts run on code we trust; we settle fast!” • V2: Escrow releases on milestones; swaps route right; royalties land first time. • Bridge: Call/response—Lead: “No middleman.” Crowd: “Code’s the plan.” • Final tag: Repeat “Stellar smart contracts” over last hits. STRUCTURE (SOLO-HEAVY): Intro micro-solo (2 bars) → V → Pre → Chorus → SOLO I (4–8 bars) → V2 → Pre2 → Chorus2 (+ “HEY! HEY!”) → Bridge + SOLO II (8–12 bars) → Key-up → Double Chorus with OUTRO SOLO III weaving the hook → Hard button. HOOKS & CHANTS: • “HEY! HEY!” on Chorus2+ downbeats. • Throw-delay targets: “ledger,” “Stellar,” “trust,” “fast.” PRODUCTION NOTES (NOT IN LYRICS): • Vox (Hagar “Dreams” shimmer): bright plate + short stereo slap (~80–120 ms); tempo 1/8 throw delays on last words; light micro-pitch in choruses; stacked harmonies on hooks; occasional crowd doubles. • Guitars (ballistic 80s, alive-not-sterile): tight rhythm with tasteful phaser in verses, flanger lift into pre/chorus. - SOLO I: Tapped motif → quick slides → singable bend. - SOLO II (centerpiece): rapid legato/tapping ladders, wide vibrato, controlled dives; ascending run triggers key-up. - SOLO III: Melodic lead answering the final chorus; dual tape-style delays, wow.

Title: Blendsday Dragon: Backstop Arcade
Prompt:
Here’s a clean ≤2280-char prompt with your fix (no “repay with thanks”), 100% ’80s synthwave, corny drum fills, less kiddy:

⸻

Title: Blendsday Dragon: Backstop Arcade (’80s Synthwave)

Goal: A witty ’80s educational pop story: guide a charming Dragon through simple DeFi lending (lock → borrow small → keep a cushion → settle on time) and the Backstop (we stand by to help insure Blend; calm days earn yield). Clean, clever, replayable—after-school special energy.

Hard rules
	•	No BPM or time signatures.
	•	Don’t mention instruments/production inside sung lyrics (keep them in brackets).
	•	Short lines, tight rhymes, clear concepts, light humor.

Story seed (lyrics stay simple):
Blendsday. Dragon wants snacks now and later. We show: lock collateral, borrow less than locked, keep a wide cushion, settle the loan on time (principal + interest). Then: Backstop—we pool in together to help insure Blend if markets wobble; most days nothing happens and we earn yield for being on call. If prices dip and cushion shrinks, we top up or repay—no drama.

Structure
[Retro VO bumper → Verse 1 (meet Dragon) → Pre (why cushion) → Big Chorus (call/answer) → Verse 2 (Backstop) → Pre 2 (how it helps) → Bigger Chorus → Spoken Bridge (1-2-3-4 steps) → Synth Drop (hook reprise) → Final Chorus → Freeze-frame Tag]

Hook (write fresh words in this shape; cool, not kiddy):
BLENDS-DAY, STAND TALL—(WE DO.)
LOCK IT, BORROW SMALL—(WE DO.)
BACKSTOP READY—WE HOLD THE FIELD.
SETTLE THE LOAN—COLLECT THE YIELD.

Lyric guide
	•	6–9-word lines; AABB/ABAB; crisp verbs; we/us voice; Dragon as curious pal.
	•	Teach plainly: lock > borrow small; cushion wide; settle on time; backstop = stand by to help; calm days earn yield.
	•	One volatility line: “If prices dip, we don’t flip—we top up or repay.”
	•	End on shared snacks and “see you next Blendsday.”

Production & Mix [not sung]:
[Analog ’80s palette: warm polysynth pads, polite FM plucks, steady Linn-style groove, gated-reverb snare, Simmons-tom boo-doo-doo-DOOM fills before choruses, reverse-cymbal swells, subtle tape saturation, gentle stereo chorus on keys. Tight stop before call/answers; de-essed lead.]

Corny Drum Fills [not sung]:
[Signature tom run before each “WE DO.” // One mega ’80s fill into final chorus: do-do-do-do / DO

Title: Left Sock Parliament
Prompt:
Title: “Left Sock Parliament”
Goal: A ridiculously funny, wildly unpredictable banger that hard-swerves styles while keeping a super-catchy hook. Family-friendly language, inclusive, high energy.

[Do NOT include BPM or time signatures. Do NOT print chords. Bracketed lines = production directions only.]
[Overall vibe: maximalist, cartoonish, hyperactive. Big comedy timing. Punchline or twist every 2 lines. Strong, chantable hook.]
[Genre whiplash map: start as bubblegum pop → sudden surf rock → hip-hop with beatboxing → klezmer/polka burst → dreamy bossa fake-out → EDM drop with kazoo lead → gospel-choir finale.]
[Recurring SFX-as-music: whoopee-cushion snare, rubber chicken accents, cat meow stabs, exaggerated record scratches, audience gasp “HUH?!”]
[Story beats to write lyrics around: We (the narrators) chase a runaway pickle that escaped a sandwich. The fridge becomes a portal to a bureaucracy where socks debate bills about laundry rights. A grandma DJ objects and drops a face-melting kazoo solo. A serious voiceover advertises “Rent-A-Goose.” The pickle returns as a hero with stickers.]
[Comedic devices: fourth-wall breaks (“hey AI, don’t auto-correct our nonsense”), callback jokes (pickle returns), misdirection punchlines, absurd lists read very seriously.]

Title: The Sky Collapses in Measure
Prompt: Bombs are falling. Not past tense. Not metaphor. They’re falling. Now. On markets. Apartments. Tracer lines stutter across clouds. One misses. One doesn’t. The building exhales. Then folds. Then nothing. Acoustic prog-djent hybrid. Rapid-fire, palm-muted riffs mimic artillery cadence. Harsh dynamic shifts — tension-building fingerpicking snapped into staccato rhythmic hits. Unorthodox time phrasing and aggressive chord strikes give the track an unstable, collapsing structure. No flourish, just precision. Just pressure. Every silence feels like a detonation. The song’s pulse is relentless, echoing the mechanical precision of war machinery. Complex, interlocking guitar patterns create a claustrophobic soundscape, where tension tightens like a noose. Percussive techniques simulate explosions and shrapnel bursts, blending seamlessly with intricate fingerstyle runs that weave urgency and dread. The vocals deliver detached observation with razor-sharp phrasing

[Chorus]

[Bridge]
[Percussive Break]
The city exhales, unmade, unplanned
I stand where walls no longer stand

[Chorus]

Rhythms fracture, align, then decline
Finger bones beat like hammers on steel

[Outro]
Silence stutters, air divides

[Fade Out and End]

Drums: artillery kicks, china hits blasts; tom avalanches. Bass: distorted; octave-down drops.
Synths: icy pads, siren stabs, metallic risers; “ah/eo” choir.
SOLO I—GUITAR: whammy dives, pinch-squeal ladders, two-hand taps, kill-switch stutters, microtonal bends.
SOLO II—SYNTH: pitch-bent supersaw/FM; ±12-semitone ramps; ring-mod shrieks; wavefold claws; brief vocoder.

Shh, 유리의 숨—hold the night in our lungs;
Streetlight halos bite down like tongues.

Paper crowns melting into a scream.

발밑 얼음—cracking down.
