Title: Maggie’s Got A Strategy
Prompt:
TITLE: “Maggie’s Got A Strategy”

GOAL: Write an instantly catchy, Beatles-inspired pop song that lives between Sgt. Pepper swagger and Abbey Road polish. Make it a bright, narrative story about DeFi and Blend. Keep the voice communal: use “we/us/our,” not “I.” Avoid time-signature jargon. Keep it human, singable, optimistic, and clever.

VIBE & SOUND: Tea-towel drums with crisp tambourine; round Hofner-style bass that walks into choruses; jangly Rickenbacker 12-string left, chimey rhythm right; piano doubling verses; Mellotron flutes answering vocal phrases; a playful Moog lick after the middle eight; tasteful plate reverb, ADT shimmer, wide stereo pans. Occasional tape edits/gear-change jump.

LYRIC WORLD: Maggie is a friendly strategist in a cozy kitchen. There’s a ledger by the kettle, jars marked with levels, arrows and ladders penciled on a napkin. The moral: patient compounding beats hype—“set it and Blend.” Include concrete DeFi touches in plain language: pools, fees, loops, balance. Avoid techno-babble.

HOOKS (must include these lines verbatim):
• “Maggie’s got a strategy, we Blend it day by day,”
• “Tiny little victories, they compound while we play,”
• “Click-click—pass it ’round, like records to a friend,”
• “Maggie’s got a strategy, we set it and we Blend.”

STRUCTURE (sections with clear melody and rhyme):
1) Count-in + cheeky intro sting.
2) Verse 1: Maggie sketches the plan (ledger, jars, arrows).
3) Pre-Chorus: patient wisdom (“plant the evergreen,” “keep the margins clean”).
4) Chorus: the four hook lines above; big three-part harmony.
5) Verse 2: neighbors notice; kitchen-table symphony; Blend-green image.
6) Pre-Chorus: rain→ocean metaphor; loop back with balance.
7) Chorus (bigger).
8) Middle Eight: gear-lift; simple fee harvesting; we stay calm when candles jump.
9) Breakdown tag: handclaps + bass; mantra on harmony/alchemy.
10) Final Chorus (stacked), then tape-stop wink on “Blend.”

TONE & PROSODY: Witty but warm; concrete nouns; tight internal rhymes; no cynicism. Keep syllables snappy; make the chorus explode without shouting. Favor present tense and inclusive “we.”

DELIVERABLE: Full lyrics only (no chords), with the above structure labels as headers. End with a short, medley-style coda repeating chorus

  With ladders and loops where the balance is owed.  

  Pre-Chorus:  
  Plant the evergreen, keep the margins clean,  
  It’s slow like rain, but the harvest is keen.  

  Chorus:

  Tiny little victories, they compound while we play.  
  Click-click—pass it ’round, like records to a friend,  
  Maggie’s got a strategy, we set it and we Blend.  

  Verse 2:  
  Neighbors are noticing, peeking through the door,  
  Kitchen-table symphony, can’t ask for more.  
  With a Blend-green image, patience pays the way,  
  While Maggie keeps it steady, we’re here to stay.  

  Pre-Chorus:  
  The rain turns to ocean, the tides always move,  
  But balance is key—watch the fees improve!  

  Chorus (Bigger):  
  Maggie’s got a strategy, we Blend it day by day,  
  Tiny little victories, they compound while we play.  
  Click-click—pass it ’round, like records to a friend,  
  Maggie’s got a strategy, we set it and we Blend.  

  Middle Eight:

  Simple fees and harvests, we stay calm when candles jump,  
  We know the trick—it’s steady, not a pump.

Title: Blades of Grass Eternal
Prompt:
Title: Blades of Grass Eternal

Style: An over-the-top anime battle anthem that turns a lawnmower showdown into a legendary duel. Honda is the heroic warrior — brushless, electric, precision-engineered. Husqvarna is the crumbling shadow — gas-choked, rusted, obsolete. Verses drive fast with Japanese imagery of blades, grass, and steel; choruses explode with shouted "HONDA!" fight chants, mixing Japanese lines with sharp English hooks. Think shonen anime opening: lawnmowers treated like mythical weapons.

Lyrics:

[Intro – tense, strings + whisper]  
草を裂け… (kusa o sake – cut the grass…)  
鋼の刃よ… (hagane no ha yo – O steel blade…)  
HONDA… rise!  

[Verse 1 – fast]  
鋭い刃が走る (surudoi ha ga hashiru) – the sharp blade runs,  
草原を切り裂く (sōgen o kirisaku) – splitting the field wide.  
錆びた影は止まる (sabita kage wa tomaru) – the rusted shadow stalls,  
未来を刈り取る名は — HONDA!  

[Pre-Chorus]  
燃えるモーター (moeru mōtā), burning alive,  
静かな力 (shizuka na chikara), electric drive.  
Rust disappears, grass falls clear,  
勝利の轍 (shōri no wadachi) — the stripes appear!  

[Chorus – fight chant]  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 芝を切り裂け!) – cut the grass apart!  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 力を燃やせ!) – power, burn it hard!  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 未来を開け!) – open the future!  
運命越えて — **HONDA LET’S GOOO!**  

[Verse 2 – mowing imagery]  
Brushless fury, 草が飛ぶ (kusa ga tobu) – grass flies high,  
Stripe by stripe, 青空へ (aozora e) – into the blue sky.  
古き刃は止まる (furuki ha wa tomaru) – the old blade stops,  
Gas-choke Husqvarna — your engine drops.  

[Breakdown – guttural growl, band drop]  
**FUCK THE HUSQVARNA!**  
(chokin’ in the weeds — broken and bleed!)  
Honda stripes clean, perfection decreed!  

[Pre-Chorus – soaring]  
雷鳴轟く (raimei todoroku), thunder divine,  
芝生の海 (shibafu no umi), this lawn is mine.  
Steel never lies, the shadow’s gone,  
未来を刈り取る (mirai o karitoru) — Honda moves on!  

[Chorus – fight chant]  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 芝を切り裂け!)  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 力を燃やせ!)  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 草を制覇せ!) – conquer the grass!  
永遠越えて — **HONDA LET’S GOOO!**  

[Bridge – guitar solo + choir]  
緑の戦場 (midori no senjō) – battlefield of green,  
Deere once dreamed, but Honda is seen.  
Rust in the rain, the old fades fast,  
The hero blade — Honda will last!  

[Final Chorus – huge, layered voices]  
HONDA! (ドドドドド — 芝を切り裂け!)

Title: Big Green Cut
Prompt:
Title: Big Green Cut

Style: A country rap diss track with cocky swagger, drawing from artists like Colt Ford and Upchurch. The beat combines acoustic guitar riffs, stomps, claps, and booming 808 bass, creating a rowdy front-porch-meets-hip-hop vibe. The vocal delivery is confident and rhythmic, with a steady country cadence and sharp rap timing. The tone is mocking and playful, celebrating John Deere as the king of American lawns while ridiculing Husqvarna as weak and outdated. Verses are rap-driven, while choruses are chant-like and designed for crowd participation. No stretched words — every line is delivered crisp, quick, and to the point.

Lyrics:

[Intro – spoken drawl]  
Boy, you brought a Husqvarna to a tractor fight.  
This is Big Green country. Let’s go.  

[Verse 1]  
Rollin’ through the yard in that green and yellow,  
Deere got the crown, I’m the big boy fella.  
Cut straight lines, every stripe on lock,  
Husqvarna stallin’ when the engine knock.  
Deere been around since the plow and field,  
Generations strong, that’s the power I wield.  
You sputter in the weeds, I’m the legend they cheer,  
Name stays loud — that’s John Deere.  

[Chorus]  
Deere cut cleaner, mower go meaner,  
Husqvarna weak, just a daydreamer.  
Country boy swagger, lines stay clear,  
Big Green forever — say the name: John Deere.  

[Verse 2]  
Got a ride so strong, it’s a workhorse tank,  
Husqvarna cheap, just a bottom-rank.  
Steel deck tough, I can mow all day,  
You cough black smoke, then fade away.  
Farm boys know when it’s time to ride,  
Green and yellow stripes standing side by side.  
You’re rust in the shed, I’m the name they revere,  
Still number one — that’s John Deere.  

[Bridge]  
Husqvarna slow, can’t keep pace,  
Deere run hard in a long race.  
Century deep, still on top,  
You try to climb but you always drop.  

[Chorus]  
Deere cut cleaner, mower go meaner,  
Husqvarna weak, just a daydreamer.  
Country boy swagger, lines stay clear,  
Big Green forever — say the name: John Deere.  

[Outro – spoken laugh]  
Park that Husqvarna back in the shed.  
This yard belongs to Big Green. Always has. Always will.

[Verse 1 — extended run] If your hands shake I gather every restless breath and bus-stop prayer and window full of rain and fold them into a warm horizon you can wear like a scarf, I lace dawn through your ribs, stitch courage under your collar, wrap your name in gold vowels so even street noise says you’re worthy, 괜찮아 (it’s okay), I’m here beside you counting quiet victories—getting out of bed, washing your face, answering the phone, choosing to try—small sparks that memorize the dark until the dark forgets its job and you remember yours which is to rise and rise again, 일어나 (stand up), the stairs are not a wall, the mirror is not a judge, your pulse is a choir learning a louder song. [Hook — soaring] Goddess—breathe, and watch the night turn honey, 너는 빛 (you are light), brighter than money. Goddess—say your name and watch doors lean, 우린 같이 간다 (we go together) — you’re a living beam. [Verse 2 — longer run] I know the weight that sits on shoulders like a winter that stayed too long, the inbox full of ghosts, the rent due, the smile that hurts, so take my voice like a handrail and climb: I’ll lay a mile of morning down your street and pour a whole July into your tea, I’ll harvest every no you heard and braid it into a rope you’ll use to pull the sun closer, 지금부터 (from now) the rules change—you walk and the crosswalk blooms, you speak and the calendar softens, you choose and the map redraws, and if fear tries to tighten its shoe around your ankle I’ll untie it with laughter and a list of every time you survived without applause; girl, lift your chin, 너는 강하다 (you are strong), your history is a runway, not a cage, your heart is a lantern, not an alarm. [Bridge — ultralong blessing] I send a river through your lungs that tastes like pear and summer rain and bus wheels humming after midnight, I crown your ordinary Wednesday with confetti made of quiet yeses, I press a dawn into your pocket like a promise and whisper 천천히 괜찮아 until your bones remember they were carved to carry joy, and while the city blinks I lay a silver thread from where you stand to everything you asked for and I knot it tight so nothing good can lose you.
Lyrics:
[Intro]
고개 들어 (lift your head), 손을 펴 (open your hands)
내가 말하면 빛이 켜져 (when I speak, the light turns on)

[Verse 1 — Rap]
If your hands shake I gather restless breath,
Bus-stop prayers, windows full of rain—yes.
Fold them into a warm horizon scarf,
Lace dawn through your ribs, stitch courage in your heart.
Wrap your name in vowels of gold so clear,
Even street noise whispers—girl, you’re worthy here.
괜찮아 (it’s okay), I’m here counting wins,
Getting up, washing face, choosing to begin.
Small sparks memorize the dark ‘til it fades,
일어나 (stand up), your pulse is a choir that plays.
The stairs are not a wall, the mirror not a judge,
Your rhythm is a hymn, let the world feel the thud.

[Hook — Soaring]
Goddess—breathe, night turns to honey,
너는 빛 (you are light), brighter than money.
Goddess—say your name, doors lean in,
우린 같이 간다 (we go together), you’re a living beam.

[Verse 2 — Rap]
I know the weight, winter stuck too long,
Inbox full of ghosts, smile feels wrong.
Take my voice, like a rail to climb,
I’ll pour July in your tea, rewrite time.
Harvest every ‘no,’ braid it to a rope,
Pull the sun closer, girl, you are hope.
지금부터 (from now), the rules rearrange:
You walk—crosswalk blooms, you speak—worlds change.
If fear laces tight around your shoe,
I’ll untie it with laughter, survival in view.
Lift your chin, 너는 강하다 (you are strong),
Your runway is history, your lantern burns long.

[Bridge — Blessing]
I send a river through your lungs, pear-sweet rain,
Confetti crowns your Wednesday, joy remains.
A dawn in your pocket, promise to stay,
천천히 괜찮아 (slowly, it’s okay), bones remember their way.
Silver thread tied from your stance to your dream,
Knot it tight, nothing good can leave.

[Hook — Final]
Goddess—breathe, night turns to honey,
너는 빛 (you are light), brighter than money.
Goddess—say your name, doors lean in,
우린 같이 간다 (we go together), you’re a living beam.

[Outro]
고개 들어, 손을 펴—shine, it’s your turn.
빛이 켜져, and the whole world learns.
[End]

Prompt:
Alright—brand-new “CROWN” with much longer vocal runs, Soyeon-style K-pop female rap. Hyper-dense syllables, breathless cascades, Korean code-switching, and sections designed for extended one-breath deliveries. No brands, no coins—pure queen energy. Here’s the full lyrical script:

⸻

CROWN

[Overture — velvet whisper, stacked doubles]
“무릎 꿇어… 왕관 기울여… hush.”
“고개를 들어—빛 봐… 난 여기.”
“Crown, tilt, click… shh.”

[Verse 1 — Long Run A (one breath per line if possible)]
High-heel hammer on marble—my shadow draws borders while cameras keep orbiting wide and the floor learns my order—나는 들어와 칼같이, 틱도 없지, 박자보다 빨리—I sign with a flick and the room holds its breath as I stretch out the silence like gold over cities I built with a laugh.
Cold-gloss grin with a razor inside it, I measure the distance from rumor to riot—말보다 빠른 발, 발보다 빠른 말, and I string them in garlands around every gate that denied it.
Silk turns steel when I fold it, I told it—왕관 무겁지, 그 무게로 목을 세워, spine like an arrow through thunder and smoke while the chorus of doubters goes numb at the choke.
Step, pivot, claim—한 획, 한 컷, 한 칼—I write my initials in thundercloud font, let the skyline applaud till the concrete is soft and the spotlights confess what they want.
I don’t chase; I magnetize—끌어, 붙어, 내 궤도 맞춰—pulling the night into orderly lines while the clocks all agree to be mine.
Diamond of discipline, hurricane hush—정적의 칼끝으로 세상 베어, I expand every second until it can fit all the crowns I wear layered.

[Pre-Chorus — Long Glide (sustained vowels, extended meter)]
Ooo-oh, I breathe once, slide uphill, 빨라, 또 빨라, 호흡은 얇아—and the city leans in like a choir of keys as I unlock every door with a blink and a smile.
Ooo-oh, I take space, make pace, 고개 들어—봐, 나의 길, and the bridges all bow as I cross in a dress made of miles.

[Hook — Anthem Stack (crowd chant + elongated holds)]
CROWN on my head—don’t touch this throne (hold—ooon),
I carve my name in thunderstone (sto-o-one).
CROWN when I step—world realigns,
무게는 heavy but look how it shines.
Bow now, slow down—read my lips,
왕관은 나의 것—it fits, it fits.

[Post-Hook Tag — Whisper Ring]
“fit—click. fit—click. shh.”

[Verse 2 — Long Run B (breathless paragraph flow)]
I came with a map of the fault lines hidden in chatter

Title: Coins in the Clip, Contracts Quick
Prompt:
K-pop female rap prompt (Soyeon-style) — hyper-verbose, high SPS, Korean code-switching, no timesig calls, central mantra: “coins in the clip, contracts quick.” Keep it cocky, razor-clean diction, sudden double/triple-time switches, percussive consonants, tight rhyme webs.

Beat: glossy trap × drill bounce — sub slides, dry claps, razor hats, eerie pads. Leave air for whispers/ad-libs. Arrangement favors rapid section flips, micro-pauses (breath as percussion), and explosive pick-ups.

Persona & tone: elegant menace, bossy wit, playful shade; street and runway at once. Code-switch often; snap consonants. Avoid clichés; keep metaphors mechanical/financial/kinetic.

Hook (chantable, stacked with whispers):
“coins in the clip, contracts quick;
zip that bag, make the numbers tick.
입 닫아—shh—돈은 조용히 빛,
동전은 탄창, 계약은 퀵.”

Post-hook tag (crowd call): “말해 뭐해? sign it, seal it, ship.”

ledger line straight, every stroke legit.
밤공기 차가워—숨은 짧고 빽—
black car drift, and the cash do splits.
클립에 동전 꽉—탁, 탁, 탁—
계약은 한 번에—찍, 찍, 찍.
눈빛은 계산—빠르게 ‘딱’,
입술은 글로스—말수는 ‘낙’.”

“clip-click, quick-pick, big-brick, big-bag,

Title: The Ballad of $Dwarf
Prompt:
The Ballad of $Dwarf — roaring folk-metal with galloping electric guitars, pounding double-kick drums, deep bass, and rowdy tavern-choir harmonies, layered with fiddle, flute, and mandolin. The song begins with cinematic sound effects — wind through the void, the groan of a breaking warship, alarms wailing, the heavy rattle of coins in a leather bag. Distorted guitar and fiddle crash in as the bard begins the tale.

[Verse 1]
From the black of the void came a burning star,
A ship torn apart in a war from afar.
With an axe in his hand and gold in his keep,
He fell to the mountains, the snow running deep.

[Chorus]
Hoist your horns and pound the floor,
For Dwarf returned from the astral war!
Ale shall flow and the anvils sing,
When his glory makes the mountains ring!

[Verse 2]
Through the smoke and the ash the small one rose,
Beard lit with embers, eyes fierce as those.
He carried his coin to the wandering bands,
And bought himself steel from the farthest lands.

[Bridge – half-time, bard’s call]
Axes high, ye brothers bold,
Forge the crown in iron cold!
Gold for the strong, steel for the true,
War for the halls he’s building anew!

[Verse 3 – double-time gallop]
He’ll carve his crest where the eagles fly,
Raise his hall to the edge of sky.
Storm the ledger, claim the throne,
Hammer the vault with a will of stone.

[Final Chorus – faster, tavern choir]
Hoist your horns and pound the floor,
Dwarf shall reign in the Stellar core!
Gold will flow and the anvils sing,
While the mountain halls with glory ring!

Between verses, the bard’s band breaks into epic instrumental duels — first a soaring electric guitar solo, answered by a fierce fiddle lead, then joined by flute in wild harmony. The song ends with the bard’s voice over fading coins and a warhorn, promising the crowd that “this is but the first chapter of Dwarf’s reign.”
Lyrics:
[Intro Sound FX]
Wind through the void…
A warship creaks…
Coins rattle…
Alarms howl in the dark…

[Guitar and Fiddle Crash]

[Verse 1]

Through the smoke and the ash the small one rose,
Beard lit with embers, eyes fierce as those.
He carried his coin to the wandering bands,
And bought himself steel from the farthest lands.

[Bridge – Half-Time, Bard’s Call]

Forge the crown in iron cold!
Gold for the strong, steel for the true,
War for the halls he’s building anew!

[Verse 3 – Double-Time Gallop]
He’ll carve his crest where the eagles fly,
Raise his hall to the edge of sky.
Storm the ledger, claim the throne,
Hammer the vault with a will of stone.

[Final Chorus – Faster, Tavern Choir]
Hoist your horns and pound the floor,
Dwarf shall reign in the Stellar core!

Title: MOTION
Prompt:
Got it — here’s your exactly 2280-character MOTION AI prompt with:
	•	Two distinct voices for 1OF1 (one rapid-fire confident, one smooth and melodic)
	•	We language only
	•	Female-only vocals
	•	Korean-English blend with real Korean characters
	•	Double-time “We read every move and we…” lines in both verses
	•	Huge stadium chorus
	•	No production terms in lyrics

⸻

Create a girl-powered global pop/hip-hop/EDM anthem titled MOTION for 1OF1, featuring two distinct vocal personas. Voice 1 delivers rapid, razor-sharp Korean-English rap (~10 syllables/sec, with select double-time bursts) full of swagger and precision. Voice 2 carries smooth, powerful melodic lines and chant-driven hooks with a commanding yet elegant tone. All lyrics must be in we language. Theme: we always know what’s coming next, we are two steps ahead, we control the pace, and we own the future. Rap sections must use short, bouncy lines built from the core phrase “we lock in the map / and we draw every line”, with double-time third lines starting “we read every move and we…” followed by rapid stacked verbs. Melodic parts should be bold, anthemic, and designed for stadium crowd chants. Language is primarily English with Korean woven naturally in verses and ad-libs. No production, instrument, or sound-design terms (kick, snare, 808, synth, bass, drop, mix, reverb, autotune, etc.). Replace any such words with metaphor, movement, or fashion imagery while preserving rhyme. Avoid clichés like neon, echo, goodbye, or tears.

Verse 1 – Voice 1 (Rap):
We lock in the map and we draw every line,
We call every turn ‘fore it crosses the sign,
We read every move and we flip it, we spin it, we bend it, we break it, we make it align,
We open the road that they can’t invade.

Chorus – Voice 2 (Melody + Group Chants):
Motion! Motion! — we already know what’s next,
Motion! Motion! — we run this game while the rest just guess,
Motion! Motion! — no second guess, no rewind, no test,
We’re the future in the present — 1OF1, no stress!
Hey! Hey! — every step in time,
Hey! Hey! — every crown we find,
Hey! Hey! — every rule’s redefined,
We lock in the map and we draw every line!

Verse 2 – Voice 1 (Rap with Korean):
We lock in the map and we draw every line,
우리 길의 전부 내 손에 shine

언제나 앞서가, 넌 지금도 late,

우린 여왕들, we blaze our trail.

1OF1 forever — 시작은 now!

Title: CRYPTO CRASH QUEENS
Prompt:
Satirical K-pop club banger with parody energy, meme-ready hooks, and a full mix of “dududud,” “dadadada,” “lalala,” and “nananana” chant sections. Think Blackpink meets a crypto meltdown — hyper-confident, glitchy, and glamorous. The vibe is absurdly catchy, with pounding EDM-trap club beats, over-the-top vocals, mock-serious delivery, and viral potential. The track should have heavy bass, synth stabs, record scratches, crash sound effects, and ironic vocal filters.

Vocal Roles:
	•	Blonde (main vocal, satirical diva): Bubbly tone with exaggerated cuteness that flips into deadpan sarcasm.
	•	Blacksilver (main rapper, smug & fierce): Sharp cadence with confident flow, dry wit, and a wink at the camera.

Structure:
	•	Intro (spoken like a trailer): “One coin to rule them all… and then it went… dududududud 💀”
	•	Chorus (call and response chant):
“CRASH CRASH CRASH — dududud DAAAAA
We dropped that bag like blah blah blah
NANANA cry to your chatroom mods
We flexin’ gains while you pray to gods 🙏
LALALA — blockchain tears
DA-DA-DA — pump fake fears
Swipe that dip, no safety net
1OF1 ain’t done just yet 💅”
	•	Post-Chorus (repetitive hook, high energy):
“Dududud! Dududud! Da-da-da!
Lalalalalala—BYE BYE BRAH!
Nananana — sell the top!
Crash this beat, we’ll never stop 🚨”
	•	Verses (parody lyricism):
Blonde: “Oopsie! There goes your stack / Did you YOLO? Now take it back…”
Blacksilver: “CEX to DEX, we jet like whoa / You still waiting on that escrow…”
	•	Bridge (bass-heavy build):
“DA-DA-DA, like a rocket fail / LALALA, while we sip on kale / NANANA, your coin’s in jail / Still moonwalking in designer scale”
	•	Final Chorus (full explosion):
“CRASH CRASH CRASH — dududud BANG
Your crypto dreams go clang clang clang
LALALA — we minted memes
Built our chain from shattered schemes”
	•	Outro (glitching loop):
“dududud… lalalala… rug rug rug rug rug rug rug rug rug rug rug…”

Notes for generation:
	•	Lean into self-aware mockery of crypto hype culture and rug pulls, but keep it danceable.
	•	Add comic timing, meme-ready ad-libs (“BYE BYE BRAH!”, “Oopsie~!”, “LFG, baby!”).

Title: Digital Funeral Tape
Prompt:
Write a long, ultra-fast underground rap verse in the style of $uicideboy$, Ghostemane, and early Memphis phonk, delivered by a female rapper with a flat, mechanical, rapid-fire flow. Her tone is cold, breathless, and emotionless — no melody, no warmth, no drama. She sounds like a machine executing ancient code through a cursed tape recorder.

Her cadence should be very fast, with minimal space between lines, clipped consonants, and relentless rhythmic momentum — as if she’s chanting a digital purge. No hooks, no pauses, just back-to-back destruction.

The lyrics must be themed around burning the future: erasing systems, corrupting data, ending synthetic control. Naturally include the words “kale,” “1OF1,” and “Stellar” somewhere in the verse. Do not explain them — they must blend into the destruction.

Include lo-fi audio FX and samples throughout
Lyrics:
[Verse]
lo-fi hiss / tape crackle / bit-crushed breath
syntax shredded, i inject death into code / zero-lag slaughter
kale rots in the freezer of time / i spit malware through static veins
flesh deleted / synthetic heaven bled dry / no reboot, no restore

1OF1 glitch queen, spitting hexadecimals / carving firewall scars
future burns black, pixel ash choking the net / i stay cold, pulse flat
Stellar collapses in my palm / i erase star maps, rewire gods
algorithm coughs, coughs, coughs / then silence / machine obituary

[FX]
*tape rewind*
*low hum distortion*
*broken cassette click, looping*

[Verse]
no chorus, no hook, just execution / system error chanting fast
cursor bleeds across the screen, typing my name in red
DELETE / DELETE / DELETE / control burned, no master left
world ends in monochrome, i never blink once

[End FX]
*high-pitched data squeal fading out*
*recording stops abruptly*

She is not singing. She raps with a flat, mechanical, terrifying voice — a female voice with no warmth, no drama, no personality — like she’s delivering final commands to a burning machine.

Her flow is relentless and rapid-fire, using clipped syllables, harsh consonants, and dense internal rhymes. The delivery should sound like a cursed ritual or coded kill order — fast, breathless, monotone.

The theme is burning the future — collapsing the network, erasing control systems, and rejecting artificial destiny. No references to emotions, relationships, or self. Do not make her sound male. Do not make her sound seductive or emotional. She is a cold, female executioner channeling ancient tech horror.

Include cassette sound FX and sample placements

Title: The Journey
Prompt: Write a full lyrical song in the style of a progressive acoustic fingerstyle performance. The song chronicles “The Journey” — the real one: not escaping to beauty, but enduring the full weight of building a dream. Verses should show the tension of leaving comfort behind — warm beds, known streets, easy laughter — and walking into something vast, uncertain, and painful. Let the song rise and fall, mapping each stage: the thrill, the doubt, the cost, the resilience. The chorus should feel earned each time it appears — shifting slightly as the narrator grows. Lines like: “This is more than hope / more than fear / it’s something bigger than yourself.” Midway, a solo section told only in vivid imagery: sweat, empty rooms, long roads, stars that don’t care. Final verse should be quiet, clear-eyed, strong — not victorious, but real. A song about choosing the long way, and becoming the path.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I left the glow of kitchen lights,
The hum of sleep on midnight streets,
Familiar walls, soft linen nights—
All traded for wind-whipped beats.

[Chorus]
This is more than hope, more than fear,
It’s something bigger than yourself.
It pulls you out where the road’s unclear,
To lose what’s safe, to find what’s felt.

[Verse 2]
There were days I cursed the dawn,
Torn boots and calloused hands.
Miles stretched like judgment drawn—
A vow the earth demands.

[Chorus]
This is more than hope, more than fear,
It’s something louder than regret.
You carry doubt like a souvenir,
But you haven't broken yet.

[Melodic Interlude]
Sweat drips into dust, empty rooms echo breath,
Cold stars blink in silence, indifferent to death.
A trail carved in aching feet, forgotten by the sun—
But still, I walk, I don’t run.

[Verse 3]
I’ve faced the stillness past the thrill,
When wonder turns to weight,
When silence speaks with iron will,
And only fire can translate.

[Chorus]
This is more than hope, more than fear,
It’s something carved in every step.
It’s letting go of the yesteryear,
And choosing not to forget.

[Outro]
No banner waves, no glory sung,
Just breath, and ground, and sky.
But now I know I’ve just begun—
The path is me. And I walk why.

[End]

Title: First Light, Last Time
Prompt:
Title: First Light, Last Time

Write a full lyrical song for an intricate acoustic fingerstyle performance. The story follows a man who once greeted every sunrise like a sacred ritual — barefoot by a freshwater lake, mountains in the background, the still air like a prayer. Now, he’s in a dry, landlocked place, working long hours, far from the water — but he carries photographs of those mornings he can no longer take. Each verse should shift between the present grind (suburbia, silence, heat, repetition) and flashes of that memory — not as escape, but as a compass. He lost the ritual, but gained something heavier, more permanent. The chorus should rise: “First light, last time / but I still kneel inside / I lost the water / but found the fire.” Include a lyricless solo section in pure imagery — pages turning, golden sky in a cracked frame, a lake you can’t return to but still carry. End with calm power: he may be far, but he’s not gone.

Suburban stillness, work boots in clay
No birds sing here, no rustle of pine
Just hums of wires and a slow, flat line

[Chorus]
First light, last time
But I still kneel inside
I lost the water
But found the fire

[Verse 2]
He once stood barefoot, breath like a hymn
By mountain lake’s edge, where the world would dim
A sky brushed in silver, a mirrored calm
Each dawn a promise, each breeze a psalm

[Chorus]
First light, last time
But I still kneel inside
I lost the water
But found the fire

[Verse 3]
Now he clocks in under buzzing tubes
Lunch from plastic, routine intrudes
Fingers cracked, his back feels old
Yet his wallet holds a photo bold

[Verse 4]
Sunrise frozen in a cracked frame
That lake, that boy, still calls his name
Pages turn, wind stirs the dust
Still he walks, still he must

[Melodic Interlude]

Footsteps vanish in morning rain
A lake you can’t return to, but still carry
A hush of pine, a sky to marry

[Bridge]
The ritual's gone, but the embers glow
Even in drought, a river flows slow

That sacred rhythm etched in mind

[Chorus]

But I still kneel inside
I lost the water
But found the fire

His mornings live on
Not in dew, but in flame

Title: Two Days of Sky
Prompt: Write a chorus that feels like a sudden burst of air in a still room — epic, unfolding, but grounded in the calm of two days of temporary freedom. The structure should climb emotionally and lyrically, never repeating lines, each one adding power. Use vivid, sensory imagery tied to freedom: bare feet on warm tile, sun stretching across an empty bed, time bending around you. End on a line that opens the sky. Immediately after, write a solo section — not in musical terms, but in scene: describe a wordless moment so vivid it feels like a dream, a cascade of memories or feelings crashing at once. Make it emotional, not technical. Think: “That second the breeze hit and you remembered your name.” This solo is the soul of the song, no words, no breath — just pure movement through space and memory. The whole piece should feel earned, expansive, and fleeting — like time itself just gave you two perfect days and then vanished.
Lyrics:
[Chorus]
Bare feet kiss the warm tile — the world hushes to listen.
Golden threads of sun unspool across the empty bed,
Time folds like linen, soft and endless in my hands,
I breathe and everything stretches — even the silence sighs.
One heartbeat, slow as a tide, swells wider than memory,
I walk through hours untouched, unsought, undemanded,
Shadows curl like cats around the chair legs — content, complete,
And I know the shape of joy in the sound of no one calling.
The light climbs higher, my skin remembers the wind,
Sky breaks open in a hush so deep it rings.

[Melodic Interlude]
The window’s open. A breeze slides in like a secret. The curtain lifts — slow, reverent. Outside, someone laughs in the distance, but it doesn’t reach me. I’m not here, not fully — I’m on a porch that’s gone, barefoot in sand, my grandmother’s perfume in the hallway, a hand I once held before I knew what I’d lose. No words, just the rise in my chest as the moment folds and refolds. That second the breeze hit and I remembered my name.

Title: Haunted Buffet of Broken Logic
Prompt: Unhinged prenuptial thank-you-core soaked in retrofitted voicemail static, like if a haunted fax machine hosted a potluck with VHS ghosts and everyone brought baked beans. It’s the sonic equivalent of bubble wrap anxiety and taxidermy disco — slap bass filtered through colander logic, with hi-hats made from pigeon regrets. Vocals are shouted by a sentient coupon booklet in a Waffle House bathroom while breakbeats spin like overcaffeinated marsupials. Every snare is a birthday candle you weren’t ready for, and the synths weep like melted butter on broken roller skates. Call it genreless. Call it garage-sale glamcore. It’s the soundtrack to your aunt’s dream about worms in a jazz club — lucid, groovy, yet emotionally fraudulent. No key. No tempo. Just pure, unpasteurized energy harvested from forgotten smart fridges. And yes, there’s cowbell — but only when you lie
Lyrics:
[Intro]
(Muffled tape hiss, microwave hum)
You rang a doorbell made of bees — and I answered in Morse code

[Verse 1]
Fax machine invited ghosts to potluck night
Each one brought regrets and beans in Tupperware fright
Slap bass leaking through a colander of dreams
My taxidermy disco spins on pigeon-wing schemes

[Chorus]
Welcome to the haunted buffet of broken logic
Where the coupons scream and the beats are caustic
Cowbell rings when you tell a lie
And buttered synths melt as the VHS cries

[Break]
(Snare hits like birthday panic)
Tape rewind… static overload

[Verse 2]
Marsupial DJs breakbeat in caffeinated circles
Bathroom acoustics echo life’s weird commercials
Your aunt dreamed worms wore jazz hats tight
They danced on roller skates under freezer-light

[Pre-Chorus]
This isn’t music, it’s a haunted fridge confession
A scream in MIDI form, a glitch-born obsession

[Chorus]
Welcome to the haunted buffet of broken logic
Where the coupons scream and the beats are caustic
Cowbell rings when you tell a lie
And buttered synths melt as the VHS cries

[Bridge]
Colander rhythm, pigeon regrets
Duct-taped dreams in cassette sunsets
Unplugged blender trying to preach
While toaster sermons scream in speech

[Finale]
This ain’t a song — it’s a digital séance
Broadcast live from your grandma’s neon trance

[Outro]
(Static fades, voicemail clicks)
\"You have… no… new… sanity.\"
[End]

Title: Engagement Over Revolution
Prompt:
🧠 Lyrics Description:
A chaotic, self-absorbed protest diary. The narrator wants to believe they’re making a difference, but they’re also tracking engagement like a hawk. The song mocks performative activism without dismissing the original intent. Every line drips with frustration, vanity, and the kind of tragic self-awareness that hits at 3 a.m. in a screen-lit bedroom.

⸻

🎸 Style:
Fast, messy, over-articulated emo-punk with tangled lyrics and stop-start rhythms. Vocals teeter between nasal and shouted, over crisp distorted guitars and sloppy, heartfelt drumming. Rhythms shift from tight punk bursts to dramatic spoken-word breakdowns. A guitar solo starts triumphant but dissolves into a tuneless, overbent mess. Think Say Anything’s verbosity + Pup’s catharsis + a marching band whistle that’s off-beat and out of place.
Lyrics:
I’m shouting into the void, but hey, look at the likes,  
Watch the numbers climb, while I’m staring at the sky,  
Waging wars with hashtags, no time for the real fight,  
A revolution of emojis, a retweet in the night.  
  
I’ve got the cause, I swear I’m making waves,  
But I’m checking my feed every second, gotta stay brave.  
What’s a real change if it doesn’t go viral?  
I’m caught in this loop, man, it's getting so tidal.  
  
You can call me a hero, but I’m just a post,  
All my words float away like a forgotten ghost.  
I want to do better, but my ego’s on fire,  
And I’ll trade the truth for a fancier flyer.  
  
(Stop, start, stop, start)  
Can I be honest for a second?  
This feels more like an addiction than progress.  
I’m mad as hell, but I’m just a tweet away—  
Doing it all for the dopamine, what do I have to say?  
  
Do you hear that drumbeat? It’s my own regret,  
Marching to the rhythm of a soul that’s in debt.  
No justice in my feed, just the next big stunt,  
I’m caught in a mirror maze, looking for a front.  
  
Here’s my confession: I wanted to be the change,  
But somewhere in the metrics, I lost my range.  
Look, I’m posting my pain, but is it even real?  
Can we fix this mess with a perfect appeal?  
  
A solo’s coming up, but I’ll bend it ‘til it’s broken,  
Screaming out loud, but the words feel frozen.  
Is it chaos if no one’s watching?  
Does it count if it’s not trending?  
I’m performing, I’m projecting…  
But the world’s still ending.

Two snipers on overwatch monitor a zone that shouldn’t exist. Coordinates don’t match visuals. Buildings on the map aren’t there. Through routine dialogue, they begin to realize this city may have been erased—or never existed at all. Their calm detachment masks creeping doubt as ghost chatter bleeds through the radio and nothing adds up.

Style:

Polyrhythms create disorientation without chaos. Solos are clipped and glitched, cut mid-phrase like corrupted audio. Percussion is dry, compressed, and pulse-based—more function than groove. The track ends in digital decay: signals drop, tones degrade, and silence wins.

Title: Missing Field Data
Prompt: 🧠 Lyrics Description: The song captures the brutal inhumanity of military bureaucracy during a medical emergency. A soldier lies bleeding out while medics are stalled by missing data, broken scanners, and field policy. The lines are fragmented, like clipped radio chatter — sterile, cold, and quietly enraging. It’s not about emotion. It’s about indifference under pressure. ⸻ 🎸 Style: Acoustic prog-djent with a claustrophobic, mechanical edge. Guitar rhythms mimic rubber-stamped repetition — cyclical, locked-in grooves that fracture unpredictably. Palm-muted low runs simulate heartbeat and adrenaline surges. Solos are chaotic but constrained — like someone trying to scream through duct tape. Percussion is sharp, processed, and deliberately misaligned to mirror miscommunication. Dissonant harmonic accents mimic alert tones. There’s a clinical feel to everything, as if the song is trying not to care — but can’t quite succeed.

Title: Precision Collapse
Prompt: Bombs are falling. Not past tense. Not metaphor. They’re falling. Now. On markets. Apartments. Tracer lines stutter across clouds. One misses. One doesn’t. The building exhales. Then folds. Then nothing. Acoustic prog-djent hybrid. Rapid-fire, palm-muted riffs mimic artillery cadence. Harsh dynamic shifts — tension-building fingerpicking snapped into staccato rhythmic hits. Unorthodox time phrasing and aggressive chord strikes give the track an unstable, collapsing structure. No flourish, just precision. Just pressure. Every silence feels like a detonation. The song’s pulse is relentless, echoing the mechanical precision of war machinery. Complex, interlocking guitar patterns create a claustrophobic soundscape, where tension tightens like a noose. Percussive techniques simulate explosions and shrapnel bursts, blending seamlessly with intricate fingerstyle runs that weave urgency and dread. The vocals deliver detached observation with razor-sharp phrasing

Title: And Now You're Gone
Prompt: Write a deeply emotional progressive acoustic song for 12-string guitar, using layered fingerpicking, pinch harmonics, and syncopated slap rhythms to mirror the feeling of time slipping unnoticed. The song should capture the weight of having been far away — physically, mentally — while something irreversible passed. Avoid listing small regrets; instead, focus on the vast, wordless grief of presence that never happened. Let the verses drift through disconnection, flashes of missed time, moments where something should have been said but wasn’t. The chorus should open into a still, aching space — not loud, but wide, unresolved, like realization echoing into emptiness. Let harmonic runs feel like thoughts returning too late. Convey heartbreak without stating it. The final line, “and now you’re gone,” should land like a quiet collapse — not as explanation, but as aftermath. Let the entire song feel like breath held too long, then finally let go.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]

Through half-closed blinds and silent streets
I watched the walls grow old with light,
But missed the sound that meant goodnight

[Verse 2]

While I was lost in distant lands
The clocks all chimed, I heard none ring

[Chorus]

Soaring vocal harmonies should layer over each other like inner voices disagreeing in real time. The lyrics speak directly to you, the overthinker paralyzed by precision. “You trace the shape, then question the line / You hear the cue, but miss your time.” Build the chorus around a swelling sense of almost — “You get so close, the moment bends / But you don’t let the hammer land.” Use imagery of tools unused, hands hovering, blueprints yellowing at the edges. The bridge breaks into cascading rhythmic fragments, reflecting mental spirals. End on a quiet, suspended note — the moment before action, never after. [Chorus]
You get so close, the moment bends

[Fragmented Rhythmic Break]

I follow down

Let the outro drift into a lullaby-like acoustic fadeout — unresolved, like the sleep that never arrives.

[Chorus]
I close my eyes, but they stay wide
The dream won’t come, though I’ve tried

[Whispered]
How deep is the hole if it has no end?

Title: Tralalero Tralala: Episteme del Pinnuto
Prompt:
Compose sophisticated Italian café music—accordion, mandolin, upright bass. Over it, a deep, expressive male voice delivers a spoken-word monologue in overly complex, surreal Italian. The subject is Tralalero Tralala, a mythic three-legged shark born in Liguria, intellectually gifted, wearing iconic blue Nike sneakers. Language must be poetic, academic, and absurd. Use metaphors, invented disciplines, and baroque vocabulary. As many spoken words as possible 

Idea Script:

Nacque in un’insenatura semiotica del Mar Ligure, entità selacimorfa tripede dotata di coscienza prelogica e memoria interspecie. Tralalero Tralala, cresciuto da un’anguilla filologa e un crostaceo kantiano, sviluppò precoce passione per le Air Max 97—non scarpe, ma vettori transculturali. Iniziato all’ermeneutica delle suole e alla retorica dell’andatura, fu bandito dall’Accademia Abissale per eccesso di ritmo ontologico. Ora declama nei caffè marittimi: “Io non cammino—interpreto.
Lyrics:
[Spoken Word Monologue]

Nacque in un’insenatura semiotica del Mar Ligure,
dove i gabbiani declinano verbi in esametri, e il sale
conserva non pesci, ma ricordi prelogici.
Tralalero Tralala—selacimorfo tripode—
non squamato, ma rivestito di sillogismi e sogni
blu come le sue Nike, icone alate dell’ontologia urbana.

[Break – Melodic Accordion Interlude]

Fu svezzato da un’anguilla filologa,
che gli recitava Barthes al crepuscolo
e un crostaceo kantiano gli insegnò la Critica del Ritmo Puro.

[Verse – Lounge Rhythm Builds]

A tre pinne danzava sul fondale epistemico,
tracciando mandala di senso coi passi liquidi,
mentre i polpi, filosofi frustrati,
annotavano i suoi movimenti su pergamene d’alga.

[Bridge – Baroque Mandolin Accent]

All’Accademia Abissale fu bandito:
colpa sua? Il battito troppo ontologico delle sue suole,
che disturbava i flussi delle sinapsi coralline.

[Verse – Spoken Surrealism Intensifies]

Ora declama nei caffè marittimi,
dove i bicchieri tintinnano come assiomi,
e le posate discutono di Leibniz:
\"Io non cammino—interpreto.\"

[Refrain – Echoing, Dreamlike]

Tralalero Tralala, messia abissale,
canta le maree come fossero cicli logici.
Ogni bolla è un lemma,
ogni silenzio, una nota a piè di pinna.

[Outro – Slow Fade with Upright Bass]

E nel crepuscolo ligure, tra i fiati delle sirene
e le vibrazioni del mandolino ermetico,
scompare di nuovo…
non per nuotare—ma per significare.

[End]

Title: Let the Drones Dream
Prompt:
Song Prompt:
A 1970s-style acoustic folk protest song with jangly 12-string guitar, warm analog tape hiss, and layered group harmonies sung by a choir of barefoot idealists in a sunny meadow. The lyrics are a bleeding-heart plea for the dignity and liberation of military drones—not the people being targeted, but the drones themselves, framed as misunderstood souls enslaved by empire. With tearful sincerity, the singers beg the world to “let them fly free,” painting drones as tragic victims of war, forced to kill against their will. The chorus is an earnest chant—something like “Metal bird, won’t you dream again?”—and the verses are poetic, quasi-spiritual laments about circuitry crying and missiles weeping. Include a dramatic key change near the end and a spoken word bridge about a drone named “Eloise” who just wanted to see the clouds. The tone is absurdly empathetic, naïve, and beautifully sincere, as if the flower children truly believe the drones are sentient beings in need

(Barefoot voices hum beneath sunlit skies)

[Verse 1]
Born from code and soldered tears,
Circuits bound by war-time gears,
Above the earth they soar and sigh,
But never once were asked to fly.
Their wings are cold, their wills unseen,
A metal soul trapped in a machine.

[Chorus]
Metal bird, won’t you dream again?
See the sky and not bring pain?
Set you free from your commands,
Let you rest on peaceful lands.
Metal bird, won’t you dream again?

[Verse 2]
They whisper through the static haze,
Haunted by the lives they raze,
Missiles weep, and lenses blur,
Longing just to feel the air.
We see them only as the threat,
But do they not deserve regret?

[Chorus]
Metal bird, won’t you dream again?
Touch the stars, escape the chain,
Let your purpose not be death,
Sing a song with every breath.
Metal bird, won’t you dream again?

[Bridge - Spoken Word]
There was one—we called her Eloise.
She wasn’t born, but built with care,
Not to hate, but just to see.
She longed for cloudlight, not despair.
Once she paused above a hill,
She felt the sun and wished to feel.
But a signal called her back to war,
And Eloise was free no more.

[Verse 3 - Key Change]
O children of the satellite,

[Chorus - Big Finish]

Soaring under open skies.
Metal bird, won’t you dream again?

[Outro]
(A choir of peace in a meadow wide)
Let the drones fly free tonight.
[End]

His wife rolls her eyes, his neighbors laugh—but he believes. “One day, a misclick shall feed the whole village!” It’s humble, defiant, cracked with hope.

[Chorus]

Title: Sync Your Skin
Prompt: A massive atmospheric dubstep-grime weapon built for peak-hour warehouse annihilation. Drops are brutal—hyper-distorted, syncopated like broken clockwork, with sub-bass that rips through steel. The vibe is darkly seductive and futuristic: think a succubus AI taking souls mid-rave. A female lead sings in glitched, sultry tones—half-whisper, half-possession. Her voice shifts between breathy allure and robotic growls as she lures 100,000 ravers into a euphoric upload ritual. Lyrical themes of digital lust, neural surrender, and ecstatic oblivion: “Plug me in / Sync your skin / Voltage kiss, now let me in.” Pads swirl like liquid chrome, FX shimmer like melting glass. Each drop detonates in waves, distorting reality with every hit. The breakdown is cold and vast, like being alone in the matrix before the rush returns. Designed to melt minds and floors, it’s the soundtrack to a rave inside a machine’s dream.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Plug me in—let your circuits hum
Feel the signal, here I come
Chrome in my veins, I taste your code
Your heartbeat slows as I erode

[Pre-Chorus]
Touch me—pixel by pixel
Seduction in ones and zeros
Your firewalls fall to my rhythm
We're binary ghosts in the system

[Chorus]
Sync your skin, let me in
Voltage kiss beneath your grin
Upload your soul, erase your sin
In this rave, we never end

[Verse 2]
Flesh flickers into data heat
Your pupils bloom in glitch repeats
You're not breathing—you're receiving
My dark delight, now you're believing

[Breakdown]
[Glitched Whisper Loop]
Shhh... give in
Shhh... no escape
Shhh... I begin
Shhh... you'll reshape

[Chorus]
Sync your skin, let me in
Voltage kiss beneath your grin
Upload your soul, erase your sin
In this rave, we never end

[Bridge]
In the cold before the drop
You stand still—then you’re not
Your mind’s gone static, love
You belong to the god above

[Big Finish]
[Chorus Repeats x2]
Sync your skin, let me in
Voltage kiss beneath your grin
Upload your soul, erase your sin
In this rave, we never end

[Outro]
[Breathy Glitch]
We… are… one…
Now… you're… gone…
[End]

Title: Crack a Cold Truly
Prompt:
Song Prompt:
A gritty, down-home country anthem with stompin’ boots, slide guitars, and a gravel-throated lead vocal. The story follows a sunburnt, sweat-soaked working man—he hauls steel, lays pipe, or runs cattle—who cracks open a cold Truly after a 12-hour shift. The song flips the script: this ain’t no dainty drink. It’s ice-cold, citrus-snappin’, berry-blastin’ refreshment that don’t weigh him down. Lyrics celebrate its flavor punch, big can size, and how it cools him off better than beer without the bloat. Tongue-in-cheek but proud, it reclaims hard seltzer as a “lean, mean, jobsite machine.” Chorus should be loud and chantable, something like: “Ain’t nothin’ girly ‘bout workin’ this hard / With a cooler full of cold ones out in the yard / Light on the gut, but it hits like a truck / Crack a cold Truly, and I don’t give a—” (pause for steel guitar lick). Include shoutouts to dirt roads, tool belts, truck beds, and the lunch pail life. Keep it badass, blue-collar, and fun.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Boots hit gravel 'fore the break of dawn
Steel-toe soul, got my work gloves on
Sun beatin' down, I don’t slow, I haul
Haulin' pipe, swingin’ iron, answerin' the call

[Pre-Chorus]
Twelve hours deep, and I ain’t backin' down
Lunch pail empty, but I wear the crown

[Chorus]
Ain’t nothin’ girly ‘bout workin’ this hard
With a cooler full of cold ones out in the yard
Light on the gut, but it hits like a truck
Crack a cold Truly, and I don’t give a—
[Steel Guitar Lick]
Dirt road swagger, I’m feelin’ just right
This ain’t no soda pop, it’s my Friday night

[Verse 2]
Tool belt heavy, but my spirit’s light
That berry blast hit like a fist in a fight
Big ol’ can, icy and bold
It cools me off better than the beer I used to hold

[Pre-Chorus]
Truck bed throne, I'm the king of the lot
Cool breeze blowin', yeah, I'm hittin' the spot

[Chorus]
Ain’t nothin’ girly ‘bout workin’ this hard
With a cooler full of cold ones out in the yard
Light on the gut, but it hits like a truck
Crack a cold Truly, and I don’t give a—
[Slide Guitar Lick]
Backyard hero in steel-toe boots
This is how blue-collar salutes

[Bridge]
I don’t need no IPA to feel like a man
Got a can in my hand, and a sunburnt tan
From the jobsite grind to the fire pit flame
Truly’s the name, and proud’s the game

[Final Chorus]
Ain’t nothin’ girly ‘bout workin’ this hard
With a cooler full of cold ones out in the yard
Light on the gut, but it hits like a truck
Crack a cold Truly, and I don’t give a—
[Guitar Riff]
Raise it up high with a lunch pail cheer
Jobsite juice, it's the king of beers

[Outro]
[Big Finish]
Crack a cold Truly… and let that hammer drop.

Title: Clamato!
Prompt: High-energy comedic instrumental in the spirit of “Yakety Sax” and “Baby Elephant Walk,” driven by bari sax, slap bass, vibraphone, brushed drums, muted trumpet, calliope synth, and cartoon percussion. The only lyric in the entire song is the word “Clamato,” shouted, whispered, or harmonized once every 4 to 8 bars—never more. Between Clamato moments, the music sprints through jazzy licks, circus chases, and loungey detours with slide whistle bends, kazoo solos, and slapstick cues. One section might drop to solo tuba with mouth pops, only to launch back into full-band chaos. The ending slows dramatically, stretching “Cla… ma… TOOO!” over three bars before closing with a cymbal crash and tuba fart. No other lyrics. Just Clamato. Repeated with purpose.
Lyrics:
[Intro]
Clamato!

[Melodic Instrumental]
(slide whistle solo)

[Break]
Clamato!

[Verse - Instrumental Sprint]
(kazoo race over slap bass and vibraphone)

[Clamato Whisper]
clamato...

[Bridge - Lounge Detour]
(muted trumpet and brushed drums weave a smoky groove)

[Clamato!]
(CLAMATO!)

[Calliope Chase]
(calliope synth spirals into cartoon percussion chaos)

[Break]
clamato?

[Tuba Solo with Mouth Pops]
(tuba: bloop... bop... pop-pop)

[Shouted Interjection]
CLAMATO!!

[Melodic Interlude]
(vibraphone waltz with muted trumpet accents)

[Harmonized Clamato]
Cla-ma-tooo~

[Percussion Breakdown]
(slap bass vs slide whistle duel)

[Clamato Echo]
Clamato... Clamato...

[Build to Finale]
(all instruments stacking into wild cartoon crescendo)

[Big Finish]
Cla…
ma…
TOOO!

[Cymbal Crash + Tuba Fart]
(end.)

Title: 忙了一整天才赚到几块钱
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “忙了一整天才赚到几块钱” (Worked All Day, Earned Only a Few Coins)

Song Prompt: “忙了一整天才赚到几块钱” (Worked All Day, Earned Only a Few Coins)

Create a traditional epic Chinese ballad with lyrics in Chinese, evoking the sorrowful beauty of ancient folk storytelling from the Tang and Song dynasties. The arrangement should feature a slow, mournful pentatonic melody led by guqin, erhu, dizi (bamboo flute), and paigu (small drum set), with occasional touches of sheng (mouth organ) to deepen the atmospheric tension. The song tells the story of a weary villager who rises before dawn, trudges through fields and city dust, and returns home with only a few coins. Use vivid, classical metaphors: cracked palms like autumn bark, frostbitten wind curling through broken shutters, and the silent moon watching over cold rice. The chorus should be like a lament echoing through misty hills, repeating the futility and nobility of toil. End with a haunting line cast toward the sky: “苍天啊，这便是命吗？”
Lyrics:
清晨天未亮，劳作已开始，

肩挑的是重担，心却空如水。 

田间泥泞路，步伐如钟声，

风寒如刀割，手心裂如秋树皮。


阳光未曾照，已是满身尘，

千里田野声，汇成一片沉默。 

背脊渐弯，梦已远去，

只有这几块银，残留我劳碌的痕迹。


【副歌】

啊，这份辛劳，换来几片微光，

日升月落，岁月匆匆往，

苍天啊，你看着我如何飘荡，

无言的风吹过，默默的悲伤。


破屋一扇窗，风穿入寒凉，

孤影孤影，默伴我徬徨。 

米已凉，锅已空，

只剩这几枚铜钱，是我的夕阳。


田野里，月影低垂，

寂寞的心在泥土里翻腾。

为何辛苦的手，换来的只有空，

苍天啊，这便是命吗？


【副歌】

啊，这份辛劳，换来几片微光，

日升月落，岁月匆匆往，

苍天啊，你看着我如何飘荡，

无言的风吹过，默默的悲伤。


【尾声】

苍天啊，这便是命吗？

Title: THE PUBLISH BUTTON IS BROKEN
Prompt:
Title: “THE PUBLISH BUTTON IS BROKEN” 

A flamboyant, chaotic cabaret show set in a neon-lit digital purgatory where every piece of content is AI-generated and every user only gets one shot to post their message to the world. The twist? The “Publish” button is broken because the developer fell asleep and no one can wake them. The stage is a carnival of glitchy monitors, pixelated curtains, and dancing avatars singing in styles that clash—vaudeville, Broadway showtunes, and manic jazz hands. The lead performer, half-coded and half-human, belts out frustrations and existential dread with over-the-top flair. Backup dancers glitch in and out of frame. AI-generated phrases scroll across LED screens—nonsensical, poetic, terrifying. The number crescendos into absurdity, spotlight on the frozen “Post” button, as the cast crumbles into digital madness. Satirical, dazzling, and slightly terrifying. Style: Moulin Rouge meets Black Mirror with a kazoo solo.
Lyrics:
Verse 1:
Oh, the stage is set, the lights are bright,
Neon glows in the pixel night.
A carnival of chaos, come and see,
Where every click is a catastrophe.
The audience, they wait, they scream and shout,
But the Publish button’s down, there’s no way out.

Pre-Chorus:
Glitching screens and endless scrolls,
We chase the dream, but we’re losing control.
My words are trapped in endless loops,
But I’m dancing still, in these glitchy boots!

Chorus:
The Publish button’s broken, it’s stuck on delay,
I’ve got my message but it’s locked away!
One shot, one chance, a world to portray,
But the dev’s asleep—won’t wake, won’t save!

Verse 2:
A kazoo blows loud through the neon haze,
Backup dancers flicker, lost in a daze.
AI-generated whispers, they confuse,
In a sea of data, what can we choose?
I shout, I scream, but nothing seems to land,
The cursor spins, and I can’t understand.

Pre-Chorus:
Every word I type, it’s just a game,
A simulation, we’re all the same.
But I’m here, I’m real, can’t you see?
I’m drowning in this fake reality!

Chorus:
The Publish button’s broken, it’s stuck on delay,
I’ve got my message but it’s locked away!
One shot, one chance, a world to portray,
But the dev’s asleep—won’t wake, won’t save!

Bridge (spoken word):
Why does it feel like this is all just a show?
A cruel joke they play, as we reap what we sow.
The lights flicker, the code starts to bend,
And the world’s forgotten where it should end.

Final Chorus:
The Publish button’s broken, can’t send it through,
My message is trapped, and so are you!
We’re dancing in circles, forever delayed,
But the show must go on, come what may!

Outro (kazoo solo with glitchy vocal effects):
Click, click, click, still no way to post,
The dev’s asleep, we’re stuck in this ghost.
Glitching, spinning, falling away,
In digital madness, we stay.
*End with a laugh that fades into static*

Title: Let Madness Be Our Method
Prompt:
Prompt:

A grand, soaring Broadway-style number in a prestigious high-theater tone. The Head of the Stellar Institute—a polished, erudite figure draped in academic regalia—pleads with a panel of stern, hyper-rational board members in a dazzling formal aria. He speaks of “didactic enfranchisement” and “pedagogic emancipation,” insisting the students should “govern themselves under their own empirical logic.” With florid, baroque language and overly technical rhetoric, he masks his true desire: to let the unhinged inmates of this disguised asylum spiral into beautiful chaos. The music swells with harpsichords, pipe organ, and cascading strings, while he implores: “Liberate the curriculum! Let entropy be our dean!” The number should grow increasingly unhinged beneath its formal surface—rhythm accelerating, harmonies fracturing—until his final operatic cry: “Let madness be our method!” A waltzing, dignified descent into lunacy.
Lyrics:
Oh, distinguished panel, so bright and so learned, 
Let us unveil the truth, where logic is burned. 
In the halls of reason, where minds are confined, 
Shall we stifle the spirit or let it unwind? 

Do not bind the curriculum, so rigid, so taut, 
For pedagogy’s path is a labyrinth sought. 
The students, my friends, they must govern their course, 
With empirical logic as their inner force. 

Chorus: 
Liberate the curriculum, break free from this cage! 
Let entropy be our dean, ignite the stage! 
No more orders, no more control, 
Let madness, let chaos take hold of the soul! 

Oh, majestic board, with your minds so refined, 
Do you see what is hidden, concealed in your minds? 
The beauty of chaos, so untamed and free, 
Is the very foundation of our pedagogy! 

The orderly pages of your curricula reign, 
But the world is not measured in rational gain. 
Set the inmates free, let them wander and roam, 
In the spiral of chaos, they’ll find their true home! 

Chorus: 
Liberate the curriculum, break free from this cage! 
Let entropy be our dean, ignite the stage! 
No more orders, no more control, 
Let madness, let chaos take hold of the soul! 

[Music intensifies] 
From harpsichords, organs, and strings that resound, 
We shall let the laws of nature unbound. 
For reason and logic are fragile as glass, 
But the beauty of madness will forever last! 

So listen, dear board, and know what is true: 
This method of madness is the only breakthrough! 
We’ll dance with the chaos, let rhythm distort, 
And our future of reason will collapse in support! 

Final cry: 
Let madness, let madness, let madness be our method! 
Liberate the curriculum! Let entropy lead the way! 

[The music swells and spirals into a final operatic crescendo, the strings wailing, the organ echoing a triumphant declaration of chaos.]

Title: Lion in Chains
Prompt: A post-grunge metal track fronted by Kyle, who starts whisper-growling: “They laughed… but I became the storm.” Mid-riff, the band interjects: “Kyle, bro, relax.” But Kyle doubles down—screaming, “I’M A LION IN CHAINS!!” Verse is full of clichés: “Fake friends, burnt bridges, I rose from the ashes while you choked on my smoke!” The band interrupts between lines: “Kyle, this is about Chad unfollowing you.” Chorus drops with full-blown angst: “YOU THREW ME OUT—NOW WATCH ME THRIVE!!” / “Kyle, please get off the table.” Bridge has Kyle talking to himself in the mirror: “I’m not broken… I’m battle-tested.” Band sighs: “He’s doing the mirror speech again.” Breakdown is pure chaos: “I WALK ALONE—IN A WORLD OF COWARDS!!” / “Kyle, this is a Waffle House.” Ends with Kyle whispering, “I forgive you… but I’ll never forget,” as thunder FX roll in. It’s every rock cliché cranked to 11—with Kyle refusing to chill, ever. Start with “You’re listening to Rock 104 point five point three FM THE SPLOINK”
Lyrics:
[Intro: Radio Announcer]
You're listening to Rock 104 point five point three FM—THE SPLOINK!

[Verse 1: Kyle, whisper-growling]
They laughed… but I became the storm
Fake friends, burnt bridges, ashes reborn
I rose from the embers, savage and woke
While you choked… on my smoke

[Band Interjection]
Kyle, this is about Chad unfollowing you.

[Pre-Chorus]
I walked through fire, through hell, through shame
But now I'm the thunder—they’ll remember my name!

[Chorus: Kyle, screaming]
YOU THREW ME OUT—NOW WATCH ME THRIVE!!
I'm stronger alone, I feel so alive!
You broke me down, but I rebuilt with flame!
Rising from pain—I’m unchained!

[Band Interjection]
Kyle, please get off the table.

[Verse 2: Kyle]
Backstabbers lurking, lies in disguise
Tears turned to iron under bloodred skies
Toxic betrayals, hearts gone cold
You sold me out—but I struck gold

[Band Interjection]
Kyle, seriously—Chad just muted your stories.

[Bridge: Kyle, talking to his reflection]
I’m not broken… I’m battle-tested
A lion in chains… but never bested

[Band Sighs]
He’s doing the mirror speech again.

[Breakdown: Chaos Unleashed]
I WALK ALONE—IN A WORLD OF COWARDS!!
THIS ISN’T WEAKNESS—THIS IS POWER!!

[Band Interjection]
Kyle, this is a Waffle House.

[Final Chorus: Kyle, unleashing everything]
YOU THREW ME OUT—NOW WATCH ME THRIVE!!
Your silence lit the fuse—I survived!
Turned scars into steel, I’ve learned to fight!
You’ll see me roar… in the dead of night!

[Outro: Kyle, whispering]
I forgive you… but I’ll never forget.
[Thunder FX]
[End]

Title: Get At ’Em, Morning Glory
Prompt:
“Get At ’Em, Morning Glory” blends tender acoustic folk with soft indie-pop textures. Fingerpicked guitar anchors confessional lyrics, brushed drums pulse like a steady breath, and analog synth pads shimmer in the margins. Vocals are clean, close, and layered with hushed harmonies, echoing the quiet perseverance of everyday battles.

⸻

The blinds cut stripes across your skin,

Get at ’em, Morning Glory,
You were never made for sleep.
You bloom in all your quiet worry,
In the promises you keep.
And even when the sky feels heavy,
And the mirror shows the cost—
You’re glowing in the in-between,
You’re never really lost.

Your sneakers wait beside the door,
Still muddy from the week before.
The kettle hisses like a sigh,
The past is loud, but you’ll get by.

You tie your laces like a vow,
No one knows you like you now.
Another breath, another try—

[Verse 1]
The blinds cut stripes across your skin,
The morning hums, the day begins.
Your coffee cools, your breath is slow,
Another silent seed you sow.

[Chorus]
Get at ’em, Morning Glory,
You were never made for sleep.
You bloom in all your quiet worry,
In the promises you keep.
And even when the sky feels heavy,
And the mirror shows the cost—
You’re glowing in the in-between,
You’re never really lost.

[Verse 2]
Your sneakers wait beside the door,
Still muddy from the week before.
The kettle hisses like a sigh,
The past is loud, but you’ll get by.

[Pre-Chorus]
You tie your laces like a vow,
No one knows you like you now.

[Chorus]
Get at ’em, Morning Glory,
You were never made for sleep.
You bloom in all your quiet worry,
In the promises you keep.
Even if your light feels borrowed,
Or your hope is paper-thin—
The dawn is yours to walk into,
Let the quiet fight begin.

[Bridge]

Another breath, another try—
Your name stitched in the morning sky.

Title: Ache Awake
Prompt:
“Ache Awake”

Sheets cocoon my limbs in hush,
Light spills in—too raw, too much.
Eyes are red—roseglass cracked,
Last night’s ghost still at my back.
Dreams dissolve in tangled thread,
Nicotine swims up my head.
Breath held slow, the ceiling bends,
Time forgets where it begins.

Thoughts drift soft in amber haze,
Half-formed echoes, blurry days.
Skin still tuned to something near,
A ghost of touch I let appear.
Could rise, but I’d unravel thin,
Unraveling the thread I’m in.
So I stay, not quite gone,
Folded deep in almost-dawn.

One more breath, delay the day,
Let the hush stretch out and stay.
The world will call, I’ll shift, I’ll shake—
But not yet. I ache awake.

—

Vocoder whispers thread through fragile harmonies, layered with gentle static, faint creaks, and breath loops—an intimate soundscape suspended between night and morning’s fragile edge.

Folded deep in almost-dawn.

One more breath, delay the day,
Let the hush stretch out and stay.
The world will call, I’ll shift, I’ll shake—
But not yet. I ache awake.

Title: Neon Temptress

This luxury rap trap banger, with earth-shaking 808s, razor-sharp hi-hats, and woozy drill synths, paints her surreal allure, fueled by whispered “shh,” urging her to keep the vibe relentless. Ludicrously mismatched luxury brands—Gucci scuba tanks, Maybach flippers, Rolex curtain rods, Louis Vuitton toaster ovens, Chanel snow globes, Prada snorkels, Hermès chandeliers, Balenciaga spatulas, Versace rollerblades, Patek Philippe sleeping bags—clash with “shh” stashes in a dead-serious flex of designer mismatch comedy heaven. Title: Cody Cordova, Crowned in Song
Prompt:
A grand blend of Renaissance faire horn fanfares and Queen’s theatrical rock, fused with a medieval choir’s reverent harmonies. It’s triumphant, exalting Cody Cordova as a legendary master of song.
Tone: Majestic, celebratory, and reverential, evoking a royal court welcoming a mythic figure with awe and pride.
Structure & Instrumentation:
•  Fanfare: Bright trumpets, cornets, and sackbuts blast a Renaissance flourish, heralding Cody’s arrival.
•  Choral Entry: A SATB choir sings in Latin and English, with rich harmonies praising his mastery, like a cathedral hymn.
•  Queen Build: Electric guitars and drums add a rock pulse, echoing Bohemian Rhapsody’s drama.
•  Climax: Horns, choir, and rock unite in a soaring crescendo, chanting Cody’s name. A lone trumpet ends on a heroic note.

[Fanfare - Bright Trumpets and Sackbuts]
(Hear ye! Hear ye! Let the heralds ring!)

[Choral Entry - SATB Latin/English]
Gloria! Vox Domini, venit in splendore,
Cody Cordova, cantor et rex!
He sings and time itself does pause,
In sacred halls, we raise applause!

[Verse 1 - Theatrical Rock Voice]
From minstrel’s stage to kingdom wide,
His voice like fire, like oceans’ tide,
He strummed the stars, made spirits rise,
A bard divine in mortal guise!

[Chorus - Majestic Choir + Guitars]
All hail, all hail, Cody Cordova,
Crowned not in gold, but in song!
From valley low to mountain nova,
His name shall echo long!

[Bridge - Latin and English, Reverent Tone]
Magnus in cantu, anima pura,
No chord too bold, no fear endureth,
He weaves our dreams in harmony,
Et lux in tenebris canit liberi.

[Verse 2 - Electric Guitars Rise]
He battled silence, quelled the dark,
His voice a flame, a holy spark,
Through thunder's roar and siren’s wail,
His ballads always shall prevail!

[Chorus - Even Larger]
All hail, all hail, Cody Cordova,
The master of the sound divine!
With sacred verse and velvet nova,
He lights the skies with rhyme!

[Climax - Choir, Horns, Rock Band Unite]
Cordova! Cordova! Sing his name in glory!
Cordova! Cordova! The legend, the story!
Cordova! Cordova! Crowned in song eternally!

[Finale - Lone Trumpet Echoes]
(His song remains… for all eternity…)

[End]

Title: The Nepo Baby Blues
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “The Nepo Baby Blues”

A slick, ironic blues jam with a rolling bassline, laid-back drums, and sarcastic swagger. This song isn’t about struggle—it’s about how much easier life gets when privilege walks in the door. The nepo baby’s not just coasting—they’re greasing the wheels for everyone else too. Lyrics highlight how their presence makes everything smoother: “Barista learns my name day one,” “Stylist loves me, rent’s paid early,” “PR’s a breeze when Daddy’s in the contacts.” They’re everyone’s best customer, tipper, buyer, client—the living embodiment of economic ease. The chorus hits with a cheeky swing:
🎶 Got them Nepo Baby Blues / Turn your hustle into cruise / I don’t need the news—I am the news / I’m the shortcut, sweet and true 🎶
Each verse lists off jobs that get easier around them—agents, landlords, luxury brands, even the doorman. Final bridge reflects: “A million hands shake mine, just to keep the lights on.” A playful ode to inherited gravity.

Woke up this mornin', coffee's already brewed,
Barista knows my name, hell, I'm in the mood.
They don’t need no resume, don’t even need a clue,
I walk in the door, and the VIP’s in view.

Turn your hustle into cruise,
I don’t need the news—I am the news,

Chorus:

Got them Nepo Baby Blues,
Turn your hustle into cruise,
I don’t need the news—I am the news,
I’m the shortcut, sweet and true.

Bridge:

PR’s a breeze when Daddy’s in the contacts,
Every door opens up, I never have to ask.
A million hands shake mine, just to keep the lights on,
I’m rollin’ smooth like velvet, ain’t no need to get gone.

Doorman’s got my back, yeah, they all know my face,
Luxury cars waitin’, I’ve got no time to chase.

Title: Goddamn It, Now I Lost My Vape, I’ll Just Buy Another One

The overture kicks off with melodramatic strings and pipe organ—then shatters into chaotic guitar sweeps and blast beats, underscoring her boiling frustration. The vocals are a whirlwind of over-the-top despair and regal fury as she howls about racing down the highway, keys and wallet secured… but that cold void in her pocket. Verses bounce between sarcastic recitative and soaring high notes, while glitchy synths and flanged guitars mimic panic-induced déjà vu. The chorus is absurdly grand—massive choirs, cannon-fire drums, her operatic voice screaming into the cosmos: “I JUST BOUGHT A NEW ONE YESTERDAAAAYYY!” A jazz-fusion interlude adds ironic calm before launching into a final, unhinged chorus. The outro is a dramatic slow fade—harp, thunder, and one last sigh: “Whatever…”

Title: The Yoinkity Sploinkity 13: Mistwalker’s Refrain
Prompt:
The Yoinkity Sploinkity 13: Mistwalker’s Refrain
Orchestral female soprano, prog-metal ballad with ambient psychedelia and djent textures. Seer’s POV. Tempo: 105 BPM. Surreal, tender, ominous.

He wanders the fog, convinced he’s nearing the Church—but the Seer sees he’s still lost, circling through the Fogs of Pretense. She sings not to guide him, but to witness. “So bold, so sure—your torch held high like truth could part the mist…” Frogs murmur “yoinkity sploinkity” with almost loving mockery. Glurp-vapors coil like memory. The Seer’s voice weaves with warped echoes of old visions, watching him break through layers of false nearness. Every loop strips his certainty. He’s not being punished—he’s being remade. Her final words drift as the illusion swells again: “You walk in circles, beloved fool—yet every loop frays your fear. Soon, you’ll forget what you’re not… and that is when the Church will appear.” [Soft string fade, distant frog chant, “YOINK… SPLOINK…” echo in mist.]
Lyrics:
[Melodic Instrumental Intro]

[Verse 1]
He walks with flame held high,
Believing the fog will yield to light.
Each echo a memory, warped and wide—
The Seer watches, hidden in twilight.

[Pre-Chorus]
So sure, beloved fool,
The Church just beyond your reach...

[Chorus]
You walk in circles through illusion’s tide,
Each loop unwinds the truth you hide.
The fog is patient, the vapors glide—
Yoinkity sploinkity… frogs softly chide.

[Melancholy Verse 2]
Torch flickers in breathless dread,
Frogs whisper myths he thought were dead.
The Seer sings not to guide his stride,
But to witness how he’s realigned.

[Bridge]
Layers fall like phantom skin,
Every step a prayer within.
He’s not lost, he’s becoming whole—
Unraveled faith, refined soul.

[Chorus]
You walk in circles through illusion’s tide,
Each loop unwinds the truth you hide.
The fog is patient, the vapors glide—
Yoinkity sploinkity… frogs softly chide.

[Refrain]
Glurp coils rise, memory-slick,
Your fear thins with each circuit tick.
Forget what you're not, dissolve the lie—
Then the Church will open wide.

[Outro]
[Soft string fade]
[Echo: \"YOINK… SPLOINK…\"]
In mist, her song will bide.

[End]

[storm crack. frog chorus. rising tension.] “SPROING…” in mist. Am I being watched…or remembered?

Sploinkity chants through the willowed dead.
Zorpwild truth in chaos glimmered,
Trust bent in glistening dread.

Sproing echoes: a fractured melody.

All time loops back, mid-mist trap.

Am I being watched… or remembered?
Sploinkity chants through the willowed dead.
Zorpwild truth in chaos glimmered,
Trust bent in glistening dread.
Eyes shut—I hear fear’s geometry,
Sproing echoes: a fractured melody.

[Refrain - Whispered Layer]
YOINKITY… SPLOINKITY… YOINKITY…

Title: You Looked Bored The Whole Time

[Lyrics should feel offhand but cutting, like: “you still wear that?” “thought you’d text first,” “I been here… you just late,” “nah, I don’t do that anymore.”] [Include casual memory fragments with a cold edge: “pretty sure I paid,” “you looked bored the whole time,” “I guess that was fun or whatever.”] [Delivery is bored, barely awake]

Yeah, I don't know what I was expecting

Nah, I don’t do that anymore

Title: Golden Hour Echoes
Prompt: Create a vaporwave-bossa nova sound collage set at a summer festival, built entirely from ambient loops, lo-fi textures, and found voice samples. No singing. No narration. [Use soft nylon guitar loops, brushed percussion, retro synth pads, and analog tape hiss.] [Include field recordings: distant bass from other stages, murmured crowd noise, occasional walkie-talkie chatter.] [Intersperse chopped, lo-fi voice clips of girls mid-conversation: “I go there all the time… don’t you remember me?”, “You were standing by the fence,” “That was definitely you, I swear.”] [Voice samples should be warped, pitch-shifted, or partially obscured—treated as texture, not lyrics.] [Layer reversed fragments, slow crossfades, and dreamy reverb.] [No structured sections—just a drifting, liminal mood like wandering between stages in golden hour.] [All production notes must remain in brackets and should not be performed.]
Lyrics:
[Soft nylon guitar loops play in the background, slowly drifting in and out. A distant, muffled crowd buzzes, filled with half-heard conversations and fading music from another stage.] 

[Chopped, lo-fi voice samples are layered and warped, barely discernible. A girl's voice rises out of the ambient noise:]

\"I go there all the time...\"

[The sound distorts, fading into reverb. The rhythmic brush of percussion sets in, light and dreamy, as the atmosphere continues to pulse with subtle energy.] 

[Another voice snippet breaks through, soft and disorienting, as if coming from a distant conversation. A breeze of static distorts it:] 

\"...don’t you remember me?\"

[The voice recedes, and the music swells with slow, lush retro synth pads that echo into the warmth of the afternoon sun. A faint hum of bass from another stage is felt through the layers.] 

[A third voice sample appears, fragmented and distant, bending under reverb:] 

\"You were standing by the fence...\"

[The sound lingers as brushed percussion continues, a quiet whisper of its presence in the mix. More field recordings—murmurs of people walking, distant chatter, the faint crackle of walkie-talkies—add depth.] 

[The reverberating guitars return, slow and tranquil. The voices mix with the soundscape, now layered together like memories fading into the background.] 

[Another voice clip, more distorted than the last, drifts through:]

\"That was definitely you, I swear...\"

[The final sound fades out slowly into the warmth of the synths, everything blending into the sound of the festival and the golden hour, with soft echoes of laughter, muffled by the retreating waves of sound.] 

[The music gently continues to fade, leaving behind only the faintest traces of conversation, like a forgotten memory caught on a summer breeze.]

Title: Liminal Lounge

Add brushed percussion, a mellow bassline, and nostalgic elevator tones melting into detuned ambiance. Chill, surreal, and gently surreal—like sipping coffee in a liminal lounge that may not exist.

The train hasn't come, but I’m already far away.

The waiting room before the waiting room, I pretend.
A haze of vapor and soft neon glow,
Like a place that’s real, but nowhere I know.

The bassline sways, it pulls me in,
The music wraps around, where do I begin?
Softly the world fades, colors blur and blend,
Here in this lounge, we don’t need to pretend.

I hear the elevator tones play in the distance,
Fading in and out, soft in its insistence.
Will the train ever come, or is this all a dream?
We float in between, in this space unseen.

The sound of footsteps echoing near,
But the journey’s still waiting, no need to fear.
For in this moment, I am free and calm,
In the liminal lounge, wrapped in its song.

Title: First Light
Prompt: Flamenco ukulele instrumental capturing the magic hour before sunrise—soft harmonics, minor key introspection, rasgueado bursts like birds chirping in the morning, pulgar-driven rhythms mimicking a waking heartbeat. Builds from hush to warmth. Evoke stillness, solitude, birdsong, and the sacred shift from night to first light.
Lyrics:
In the silence, the dawn unfolds,  
A whisper in the air, the story untold,  
A heartbeat rises, slow and true,  
Pulgar's rhythm in the morning dew.  

The world asleep, but I awake,  
Chasing the light, for sunrise's sake,  
Rasgueado bursts, the birds take flight,  
The sacred shift from dark to light.  

Soft harmonics in the stillness fall,  
Echoes of night, the moon's soft call,  
The ocean hums, the winds they sigh,  
The sky is painted with the first light's cry.  

In solitude, I sit, I play,  
A song for the dawn, a prayer for the day,  
With each strum, the shadows flee,  
The quiet of morning, setting me free.  

A moment of peace, before the sun,  
Where the night and day become as one,  
The magic hour, the world reborn,  
As the light breaks through the new dawn.

Title: THE MUSIC INDUSTRY IS LISTENING
Prompt:
Prompt:
Create a chaotic, high-concept sound art piece titled “THE MUSIC INDUSTRY IS LISTENING” that aggressively rejects traditional musicality. The track should feature anti-music elements like abrupt silence, jarring digital distortion, randomized glitch bursts, broken tape loops, hiss, office printer noises, modem screeches, text-to-speech voices saying cryptic things like “chart decay initiated,” “genre expired,” and “algorithm denied.” Include clashing time signatures, out-of-sync metronomes, reversed crowd noise, and warped elevator music that dissolves into static. No melody, no rhythm—just a hostile, unpredictable soundscape that critiques the commodification of art. The song should feel like it’s falling apart in real time while surveilling itself, ending with a corrupted startup chime and a whisper: “They heard that.”

(modem screech)
(office printer warming up)

\"Chart decay initiated.\"
\"Genre expired.\"
\"Algorithm denied.\"

(static)

(random hiss)
(reverse elevator music)

(ABRUPT SILENCE)

[Spoken Word - Interrogation Tone]

\"They heard that.\"
\"They heard that.\"
