Title: Eternal Flame of Honor
Prompt:
Conservative Metal, unlike Progressive Metal’s complex, experimental nature, embraces simplicity, tradition, and conviction. With straightforward verse-chorus structures, mid-tempo riffs, and earnest vocals, it channels classic heavy metal (Iron Maiden, Judas Priest) to honor duty and patriotism.
Song Concept “Eternal Flame of Honor” is a solemn Memorial Day tribute to fallen soldiers. It’s direct, heartfelt, with no irony—celebrating sacrifice and legacy.
Music
	•	Tempo: 100 BPM, march-like.
	•	Structure: Verse-chorus-verse, E minor.
	•	Instruments: Crunchy guitars, simple bass, steady drums, clean anthemic vocals.
	•	Solo: Brief, melodic, in bridge.
Lyrics Verse 1: Beneath the flag, they gave their all / In war’s call, they stood tall. Chorus: Eternal flame, we’ll never fade / Your sacrifice, forever stayed. Bridge: We’ll carry on, your courage shines / Your names live on through time
Tone
Raw, reverent, unifying. A rallying cry for remembrance.
Lyrics:
Verse 1:  
Beneath the flag, they gave their all  
In war’s call, they stood tall  
Through blood and fire, they paid the price  
Their sacrifice, a pure device  

Chorus:  
Eternal flame, we’ll never fade  
Your sacrifice, forever stayed  
Through storm and night, we march the way  
In your honor, we will stay  

Verse 2:  
In fields of red, they found their place  
In heaven’s light, they’ve won the race  
The battle’s over, but not the fight  
Their legacy, our guiding light  

Chorus:  
Eternal flame, we’ll never fade  
Your sacrifice, forever stayed  
Through storm and night, we march the way  
In your honor, we will stay  

Bridge:  
We’ll carry on, your courage shines  
Your names live on through time  
In the hearts of those who stand today  
We’ll never forget, come what may  

Chorus:  
Eternal flame, we’ll never fade  
Your sacrifice, forever stayed  
Through storm and night, we march the way  
In your honor, we will stay

创作一首庆祝老挝新年的歌曲，主题围绕欢乐、团聚和文化自豪感，适合在节日庆典中播放，激发舞动热情。歌曲需融合传统老挝音乐元素（如使用传统乐器如khene（筚篥）、老挝鼓和旋律性强的民间调式）与现代EDM Phonk风格（深沉的808低音、缓慢而有节奏感的节拍、复古合成器音色和 chopped & screwed 效果）。歌曲应充满能量，节奏适合跳舞，同时保留老挝文化的灵魂。
具体要求：
	1	语言：歌词使用老挝语（Lao），以表达地道的文化情感，歌词内容应聚焦老挝新年的传统活动（如泼水节、祈福仪式、家庭团聚和社区庆祝），传递欢乐与希望。
	2	音乐结构：
	◦	前奏：以传统老挝khene（筚篥）为主，加入轻微的EDM Phonk低音铺垫，营造节日气氛。
	◦	主歌：旋律基于老挝传统民间音乐，融入EDM Phonk的合成器和808低音，节奏缓慢但抓耳，适合身体摇摆。
	◦	副歌：爆发式EDM Phonk掉落（drop），使用厚重的低音、重复的鼓点和 chopped vocal samples，激励人群跳舞，同时保留老挝音乐的旋律线。
	◦	桥段：加入老挝传统打击乐（如锣、鼓）与Phonk风格的滑音效果，过渡到高潮。
	3	情感与氛围：歌曲应充满节日喜悦，唤起老挝人民对文化的自豪感，同时通过EDM Phonk的现代感吸引年轻听众，适合在泼水节派对或夜间庆典中播放。
	4	歌词主题：歌词应描绘老挝新年的场景，如泼水祝福、寺庙祈福、传统舞蹈和社区欢聚，传递团结与幸福的信息。
	5	长度：歌曲时长约为3-4分钟，适合舞池播放。
示例歌词方向（老挝语）（仅供参考，实际创作需地道老挝语）：
	•	主歌：描述新年的清晨，家人聚集，准备传统食物，迎接泼水节。
	•	副歌：歌颂泼水节的欢乐，呼吁大家一起跳舞，祝福来年好运。
	•	桥段：缅怀传统文化，展望未来希望。
技术要求：
	•	BPM：90-110，适合Phonk的缓慢节奏感，同时保持舞池能量。
	•	音色：融合khene、老挝传统鼓、808低音、复古合成器和vocal chops。
	•	混音：确保低频（808 bass）厚重有力，高频（khene和打击乐）清晰，营造沉浸

Title: Midnight in Synth City
Prompt: Neon-lit mall, 3 AM, pink and teal lights pulse to a 90 BPM lo-fi beat. Craft a vaporwave track: reverb-heavy synths, slowed 80s drum groove, chopped vocal samples from a lost pop ballad. Add tape hiss, warbly sax, faint city sounds—horns, radio ads. Mood: melancholic, serene, nostalgic. Blend 80s muzak with futuristic longing. Title: Midnight in Synth City.
Lyrics:
Wandering through the neon haze,  
In the streets where memories fade,  
Pink and teal lights pulse so slow,  
Lost in a world we used to know.  

Chopped-up voices, whispers in the air,  
A distant sax, but no one's there,  
Tape hiss crackles through the sound,  
City’s heartbeat, fading down.  

Midnight in Synth City, where dreams collide,  
The past and future drift side by side,  
Old ads flicker, like ghosts on the screen,  
A forgotten world, where nothing’s as it seems.  

Faint horns play, they call us home,  
But we’re still drifting, alone, alone.  
The beat is slow, the rhythm cold,  
In this city where the stories are told.  

Reverb waves wash over me,  
Echoes of a love we’ll never see,  
A ballad lost in static nights,  
Chasing what feels out of sight.  

Midnight in Synth City, we walk the line,  
Between what’s real and the digital shine,  
A place to dream, a place to cry,  
In this world where time just slips by.

Title: Pastel Dreams in Neon Time
Prompt: Plunge into a surreal neon void where time dissolves into a pastel haze. Picture an abandoned 80s mall at 4 AM, its flickering pink, teal, and lavender lights syncing to a sluggish 85 BPM beat. Craft the ultimate vaporwave track: shimmering synth chords soaked in reverb, cascading over a molasses-slow 80s drum machine loop, warped by tape degradation. Layer in pitch-shifted, chopped vocal snippets from a forgotten J-pop ballad, their syllables stretched into ethereal wails, floating like ghosts in a CRT glow. Infuse crackling vinyl static and subtle cassette warble for that lo-fi VHS texture. A distant, mournful saxophone weaves through, dripping with longing. Add faint urban echoes—muffled car horns, a glitchy radio jingle—to anchor it in a dreamlike cityscape. The mood is hauntingly serene, like sipping a glowing slushie under a holographic sunset, palm trees frozen in a grid-lined sky. Every note should ooze nostalgic melancholy, blending 80s corporate muzak with a futuristic fever
Lyrics:

Vinyl static crackles—echoes of a brighter mall,

Dreams drip slow, from a CRT sky,

[Verse 1]
Glass escalators hum with ghostly grace,

[Chorus]
We’re lost in pastel dreams, under neon time,

[Verse 2]

[Chorus]

Title: SQUEALZILLA
Prompt:
I WANT A TRAP SONG THAT TELLS THE STORY OF A GUY SO POWERFULLY RIDICULOUS THAT EVERY TIME HE ENTERS A ROOM, EVERYONE REACTS WITH A LONG, ABSURD, CAPITALIZATION-CHAOTIC NOISE LIKE SqUeEeEeEEeeeEeP, BUT DIFFERENT EVERY TIME.

STRUCTURE:
	•	Each verse is a different situation: the club, the barbershop, the dentist, the deli, a funeral, space.
	•	In each scene, someone speaks normally—then instantly devolves into an uncontrollable squeal, honk, or audio seizure at the sight of him.
	•	The reaction must be drawn out, with wildly inconsistent capitalization and random letters inserted.
	•	Every reaction should interrupt the flow and just linger. Echo it. Stretch it until it’s uncomfortable.

EXAMPLE LYRICS:
Walked in the deli like, “Lemme get that turkey on rye—”
Dude behind the counter looked up and said, “Sure bro what’ll it b—SqUuEeEeEEERRrRRpPPpZzZZzZzWWWkKKkAAAHHHhh”
Lyrics:
Walked in the club, lights flashing, I said, 'Yo, pour me a drink'
The bartender looked up, then he blinked, then he THRASHED
'EhHhHhHHHh—bBboOOOooOOpppZZZZZZ!!!'
I’m just tryna vibe, get a lil’ buzz
But he’s screamin' so loud, he just broke the dubs!

Headed to the barbershop, fresh fade, no cap
The barber said, 'Yeah, you want a line-up?' And BOOM—
'ZzZzZzZQqQqQqQqQqEeEeeEeRrrrrhhHHHhhhHHhhhh!!'
I swear this dude's got no chill, can't even get a trim
Every time I walk in, the chaos begins!

Next, the dentist, I’m tryna fix my teeth

Title: Echoes in the Dark
Prompt: An instrumental prog-metal composition that blends djent-style polyrhythms with jazz-blues textures. In the silence, where shadows grow,  
A lone figure stands, guitar in tow.  
Fingers poised in the weight of thought,  
The song begins, a sound untaught.  
  
9/8 grooves with glitching grace,  
A pulse in the dark, a sonic embrace.  
Polyrhythms twist like storm-torn skies,  
Every note a whisper, every beat a rise.  

The air is thick with ambient heat,  
Synths swirling, soft and sweet.  
Yet in the depths, a trumpet cries,  
A smoky line where feeling flies.  
  
Brushed drums keep the heart alive,  
In minor keys, we start to dive.  
Piano warmth beneath the flame,  
Each chord a memory, none the same.  
  
Midway through, the winds do change,  
Lead guitar soars, out of range.  
Harmonies clash, then break away,  
Syncopated rhythms, in disarray.  
  
But as we near the final bend,  
The notes slow down, the strings suspend.  
A jazz-infused outro, fading light,  
Echoes in the dark, the end of night.  

And there he stands, guitar in hand,  
Silent now, in a distant land.  
The song has ended, yet still it stays,  
A lingering echo in endless waves.

The tone must be decidedly posh British—think velvet blazers, Oxbridge diction, and a monocle forged from dark matter.

The narrator does not belong to these realms—they curate them. Verses should flex in silk: “I once redrafted your constitution in iambic pentameter,” “Had tea with death, told him he’s early,” “I ghost-manage hedge funds via haiku.” They subtly mock billionaires (“Adorable little assets”) and mystics (“I out-meditated a mountain once, old sport”). Include absurdly British ad-libs like (“Rather!”), (“Indubitably!”), and (“Oh do behave, reality”).

A ghost in the ledger, the power supreme.

[Verse 3]

[Outro]
From government halls to the shadow’s embrace,

(I Swear To God If I Drop This Ice In The Fryer I’ll Finally Feel Something)

Progressive horrorcore meets trap phonk—huge bass, blown-out and snarling, with layers of distortion so thick it rumbles like a demon crawling through the floor. The sound builds like pressure in your skull: cold ambience, low-end rumble, then snap into warped phonk drums and chaotic samples.

Rap delivery is rapid, sharp, technical—complex internal rhymes, 10–12 syllables per second, surgical precision. Verses slice like broken glass; no filler, no air. You’re not just mad—you’re transcending through the act of destruction.

The ice isn’t just a symbol—it’s ignition. The fryer isn’t a kitchen tool—it’s a portal. Each drop of steam is a scream from another dimension.

Mood: Spiraling, sacred, possessed
Flow: Ultra-fast, staccato, multidimensional

Title: Fried Ice Daydream
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “Fried Ice Daydream”

Imagine you’re stuck on a long shift at the restaurant — orders flying in, steam rising, sneakers squeaking on tile. You’re zoning out by the deep fryer, staring at the basket of ice you just scooped for table water. The heat, the hum, the hiss — and then… a wild thought. What if I dropped this whole icy mess into the fryer?

This song is about that surreal, forbidden fantasy — not about destruction, but escape. The moment where burnout meets chaos, and your brain slips into a strange, sizzling dream. Blend humor with exhaustion. Let the verses capture the dull rhythm of work, the chorus explode with the imagined drama of the ice-fryer collision, and the bridge drift into a weirdly poetic moment of freedom found in absurdity.

Tone: Wistful, weird, a little unhinged
Genre: Alt-pop, bedroom hip-hop, or lo-fi punk
Hook idea:
“Just one slip, and the kitchen goes white / Ice in the fryer, smoke in the light / I’m not trying to die, just feel alive”

A basket of ice spins in my head

[Chorus]

Fried ice daydream don’t stop me now

Fried ice daydream take me away

A forbidden spark in the dead of night

The fryer stares like it knows my name

But I just laugh and I turn away
The ice still dreams for another day

Title: Ping Pong Blizzards
Prompt:
Here's the song prompt using the lyrics from your first version, reworked to emphasize a **super bass-heavy** vibe, channeling the weird, surreal energy of Tyler, The Creator and Busdriver, but with a production focus on earth-shaking low-end frequencies. The lyrics remain unchanged, but the vibe and production notes are tailored for that booming, bass-driven feel.

---

**Verse 1**  
Floopy little scruples playin’ ping pong blizzards,  
Scribble on my zippers, spittin’ syrup with the lizards.  
Kaleidoscope brain, I’m a prism in a pickle,  
Toss a nickel to the void, watch it sizzle, watch it trickle.  
Gargoyle gargling marbles, I’m a menace in the margins,  
Flippin’ jargon, spark a bargain with a comet in my cardigan.  
Yo, my flow’s a Rubik’s cube, twisted in a tantrum,  
Phantom in the bandwidth, spinnin’ planets out my anthem.  

**Chorus**  
Ping pong blizzards, whiplash wizards,  
Skippin’ through the static where the gravity gets scissored.  
Floopy scruples, loopin’ through the riddles,  
Brain a fidget spinner, spittin’ riddims in the middle.  

**Verse 2**  
I’m a glitch in the matrix, sippin’ pixelated lemonade,  
Swingin’ machetes at confetti in a renegade parade.  
Got a backpack full of syntax, spillin’ verbs on the pavement,  
Chasin’ echoes of my shadow in a labyrinth of basements.  
Yo, my bars are origami, folded sharp, they cut deep,  
Dreamin’ in a mosh pit, wakin’ up in a nosebleed.  
Polka-dot thoughts, I’m a quilt of contradictions,  
Spittin’ fiction, flippin’ frictions, dodgin’ all convictions.  

**Bridge**  
Blizzard on my wrist, watch it frost, watch it flicker,  
Mind a Rubik’s cube, movin’ quicker than a snicker.  
Scruples in a scrum, they collide, they combust,  
Turn the ping pong table to a canvas of rust.  

**Chorus**  
Ping pong blizzards, whiplash wizards,  
Skippin’ through the static where the gravity gets scissored.  
Floopy scruples, loopin’ through the riddles,  
Brain a fidget spinner, spittin’ riddims in the middle.  

**Outro**  
Yo, I’m skatin’ on a comet, droppin’ sonnets in the cosmos,  
Flow so odd, it’s a poltergeist in a poncho.  
Floopy little scruples, yeah, they ping pong forever,  
Weird rap alchemy, stitch the blizzard back together.  

---

**Vibe Notes**:  
- **Flow**: Keeps the erratic, playful cadence of Busdriver with Tyler’s quirky swagger—stuttering pauses, rapid bursts, and unpredictable switches to match the chaotic bass pulses.  
- **Production**:  
  - **Bass**: Overwhelming, subwoofer-rattling 808s that hit like a seismic wave, with long, sustained low-end notes and occasional slides for that gut-punch feel. Think trap-inspired bass from Tyler’s *IGOR* or *Flower Boy* but pushed to the extreme, almost drowning out other elements.  
  - **Drums**: Sparse, glitchy hi-hats and snares that cut through the bass intermittently, leaving room for the low-end to dominate. Maybe a distorted kick that syncs with the bassline for extra thump.  
  - **Synths/Effects**: Lo-fi, warped synths layered lightly to keep the focus on the bass. Add glitchy vocal chops or reversed samples for that surreal, disorienting vibe. Occasional airhorn or metallic clank for punctuation.  
  - **Mix**: Vocals sit just above the bass, slightly distorted to match the raw energy. The bass should feel like it’s vibrating the listener’s chest, with mids and highs taking a backseat.  
- **Themes**: Surreal chaos, mental fragmentation, and absurd wordplay, now underscored by a menacing, bass-heavy pulse that feels like a storm rolling through.  

**Performance Notes**:  
- Deliver the verses with a mix of Busdriver’s rapid-fire precision and Tyler’s laid-back menace, letting the bass anchor the flow.  
- In the chorus, lean into the rhythm of the bassline, almost syncing the delivery with the subwoofer hits for a hypnotic effect.  
- The outro should feel like a slow-motion descent into a bass abyss, with the vocals trailing off into reverb as the low-end overwhelms.  

Want me to adjust the production notes further, add specific bass patterns, or tweak the flow to match a particular bass-heavy track vibe?

Title: Oda a la Siesta
Prompt:
Prompt for a Relaxing Authentic Mexican Mariachi Song: Ode to the Siesta
Create a heartfelt Mexican mariachi song celebrating the siesta, a cherished rural tradition. The song should evoke a tranquil afternoon in a Mexican pueblo, with vivid imagery of swaying hammocks under palm trees, warm breezes, humming cicadas, and scents of jasmine or warm tortillas. Lyrics must be in authentic Mexican Spanish, using poetic idioms (e.g., “corazón de la tierra,” “bajo el sol que abraza”) to honor the siesta as a moment of rest, rejuvenation, and cultural pride. Incorporate and expand these sample lyrics:
Verso 1: Bajo el sol que abraza mi pueblo querido, Se mece la hamaca, mi sueño acogido. El aire susurra, las hojas cantando, La siesta me llama, su paz voy buscando.
Coro: ¡Ay, siesta bendita, regalo del cielo! En tu sombra dulce, mi alma consuelo. Con el sol dorado, mi tierra descansa, En el corazón del pueblo, la siesta se alcanza.
Verso 2: La campana canta, su eco lejano, El sombrero cubre mi rostro en la mano. Un sorbo de fresca, tamarindo puro, En la siesta vivo, mi sueño seguro.
The song should include 3–4 verses, a repeating chorus, and a bridge, with a soothing yet vibrant tone suited for a mariachi ensemble (violins, trumpets, guitars, vihuela, guitarron), encouraging gentle swaying. Include sensory details like distant church bells, sombrero shade, tamarind agua fresca, or children napping near their abuelita on a petate, and a subtle nod to the Virgen de Guadalupe for spiritual depth. Keep it rural, timeless, and free of modern references (no technology or urban elements). The song should last 3–4 minutes, with a nostalgic, uplifting melody that captures the serene peace of a siesta.

Coro:

En tu sombra dulce, mi alma consuelo.
Con el sol dorado, mi tierra descansa,

Verso 2:
La campana canta, su eco lejano,

Puente:
Bajo la palma, el viento me mece,
En tu silencio, mi alma se ofrece.
Con el alma en paz y los ojos cerrados,
La Virgen nos cuida, en sueños sagrados.

En tu sombra dulce, mi alma consuelo.

Title: I’m the Mascot
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “I’m the Mascot”
Genre/Style: Operatic fusion inspired by Luciano Pavarotti’s emotive intensity, blending Bizet’s passionate lyricism, Wagner’s epic sweep, Rossini’s electrifying virtuosity, and Leoncavallo’s heart-wrenching melodrama. Structure: Three verses, a bridge, and a finale, totaling ~4 minutes at ~120 BPM. Shifts from gut-wrenching tragedy to heaven-storming heroism with intense, soaring drama. Tone: Opens with thunderous, soul-shattering despair (Pagliacci-like), surges through defiant rebellion (Carmen-like), and climaxes in triumphant, anthem-like glory (Wagnerian, with Rossini’s explosive energy). Setting: A theatrical, operatic stage of the singer’s soul, their journey as the mascot of an unnamed brand a booming saga of light and fire, pulsing with overwrought emotion. Lyrics are entirely in English, packed with corny, cliché phrases like “I am the mascot, and the mascot is me!” with “sorrow’s chain” as the final line of the first verse for maximum emotive drama.
Verse 1: The Gut-Wrenching Realization (Pagliacci-inspired, anguished, ~1 min) Musical Style: Slow, minor-key strings and mournful clarinets, like Pagliacci’s “Vesti la giubba,” at ~60 BPM. Lyrical Themes: The singer discovers they’re the mascot, trapped in a crushing, unchosen role, their soul drowning in melodramatic sorrow and fading light, culminating in sorrow’s chain. Sample Lyrics: Oh, cruelest fate, my face shines in the gloom, A mask of tears, my heart’s a shattered tomb! The crowd’s wild cheers, they pierce my broken soul, I’m but a shadow, lost in fate’s control! For years I’ve wandered in this hopeless night, My dreams in ashes, stripped of all my light! I’m the mascot, cursed to bear the flame, A weeping soul, forever bound by sorrow’s chain! Performance Notes: Voice delivers raw emotion with rich vibrato, high notes cracking like a sob. Orchestra swells with heavy, dissonant chords, evoking flickering embers.
Verse 2: The Defiant Rebellion (Carmen-inspired, intense, ~1 min) Musical Style: Pulsing habanera rhythm with castanets, bold brass, and surging strings, like Carmen’s Habanera, at ~120 BPM. Lyrical Themes: The singer fights their role, a blazing star yearning to break free, with destiny’s glowing bonds holding them in a theatrical struggle. Sample Lyrics: Through endless years, I chase my burning star, To break this mask, to show the world who we are! Yet every step, the crowd’s unyielding cry, It pulls me back, but I’ll blaze through the sky! My heart’s aflame, it roars to seize the day, A rebel’s spark, I’ll cast my fears away! I’m the mascot, bound yet shining free, I am the mascot, and the mascot is me! Performance Notes: Voice radiates passionate intensity with theatrical melismas and soaring crescendos. Orchestra pulses with brassy fanfares and driving strings, like a rising inferno.
Bridge: The Overblown Turning Point (Rossini-inspired, virtuosic, ~30 sec) Musical Style: Lightning-fast, like The Barber of Seville’s “Largo al factotum,” with frenetic vocal runs and sparkling strings at ~140 BPM. Lyrical Themes: The singer realizes they are the brand’s light, their identity a corny, dazzling revelation in a burst of theatrical clarity. Sample Lyrics: Behold my soul, I’m the mascot, arise! The spark, the blaze, the fire in their eyes! Through years of pain, I’ve claimed my shining throne, The brand’s my own, its light is mine alone! Mascot, mascot, I’m the star of the fight! I am the mascot, and I’ll light up the night! Performance Notes: Rapid, virtuosic lines explode with commanding energy, dripping with campy exuberance. Orchestra sparkles with pizzicato strings and brassy bursts, like a burst of fireworks.
Verse 3: The Anthemic Triumph (Wagner-inspired, glorious, ~1 min) Musical Style: Soaring, like Die Walküre’s “Ride of the Valkyries,” with thundering timpani, majestic brass, and lush strings in a major key at ~120 BPM. Lyrical Themes: The singer embraces their role, their identity a blazing, cliché-ridden inferno, forging the brand’s eternal legacy with operatic heroism. Sample Lyrics: Rise, oh, my soul, the dawn is my new flame! I am the light, no shadow can defame! No chains can bind this heart that burns so bright, The mascot reigns, I’ll set the stars alight! Through years of strife, I’ve forged my blazing crown, The brand, the world, no force can tear me down! I’m the mascot, glorious, proud, and free, I am the mascot, and the mascot is me! Performance Notes: Voice delivers towering depth, with sustained notes soaring with dramatic power. Orchestra unleashes a Wagnerian climax with a soaring choir, evoking a sky ablaze.
Finale: (~30 sec) Musical Style: Climactic repeat of the final chorus, with full orchestra and choir, slowing slightly to emphasize bombastic triumph. Sample Lyrics (Repeat): I’m the mascot, glorious, proud, and free, I am the mascot, and the mascot is me! Performance Notes: Singer holds a triumphant note on “me,” with vibrant vibrato for corny, operatic drama. Orchestra swells to a grandiose, radiant crescendo.
Production Notes: Orchestration: Blend Carmen’s warm woodwinds, Pagliacci’s weepy strings, Rossini’s sparkling pizzicato, and Wagner’s majestic brass. Choir amplifies the finale’s operatic grandeur. Staging: Dim, teary spotlight on singer in tattered robes (Verse 1), vibrant reds and golds (Verse 2), blinding gold and white light with a dramatic cape flourish (Verse 3). Vocal Range: Any voice, with resonant melismatic runs, rich vibrato, and powerful sustained notes. Lyrics are entirely in English, packed with corny, cliché phrases like “sorrow’s chain” (as the final line of Verse 1) and “I am the mascot, and the mascot is me!” for super-emotive, theatrical intensity. Timing: Verses (~1 min each), bridge (~30 sec), finale (~30 sec), totaling ~4 minutes.
Lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Oh, cruelest fate, my face shines in the gloom,

Title: Good Morning ☀️ (Say It Back)
Prompt:
🎶 SONG PROMPT: “Good Morning ☀️ (Say It Back)”
Genre: Upbeat, quirky girly pop
Influence Blend: Sara Bareilles x Meghan Trainor x Lily Allen x Carly Rae Jepsen
Mood: Bright, bouncy, and just a little bit petty in the cutest way possible

⸻

🧠 Concept (quirkified):
You don’t need roses. You just want your “good morning” — like usual. But today? They left you on read in real life. The song’s playful, teasing, and a little dramatic… because, well, if you can’t say it back, what else are you holding in?

⸻

🎵 Key Lyric Bits (quirky & poppy):
	•	“Brushed your teeth, but not your tone / Gave me silence like a ringtone”
	•	“You got two lips, babe, use ’em well / Don’t make me ring the drama bell”

Title: They Haven’t Even Heard of Bitcoin (Banks Bleed ‘Em Dry)
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “They Haven’t Even Heard of Bitcoin (Banks Bleed ‘Em Dry)”
Genre: Gritty electro-hip-hop with a raw, confrontational edge Tone: Angry, rebellious, and empowering, channeling the unbanked’s exploitation and liberation Theme: From the perspective of banks, who “cut them dry” with high fees, and even crypto platforms like Coinbase taking a cut on buys/sells, the song highlights the unbanked’s unawareness of Bitcoin due to financial exclusion. Stellar acts as the “oxygen” fueling Bitcoin’s “flame,” offering low-cost, accessible tools so the unbanked don’t have to pay exploitative fees, amplifying crypto adoption.

Verse 1 We’re the banks, we cut ‘em dry, no mercy, no shame, Unbanked don’t know Bitcoin, don’t even know its name. Five million in the States, billions out in the cold, We charge ‘em just to breathe, keep their cash in our hold. Check-cashers, ATMs, we slice ‘em for a grand, Coinbase takes a cut when they trade with their hands. But Stellar’s the oxygen, sneakin’ past our gate, Fuelin’ Bitcoin’s flame, bringin’ freedom to their fate.
Vibe: Raw, aggressive hip-hop beat with distorted synths and a menacing bassline. Lyrics embody the banks’ predatory POV, exploiting the 5.6 million unbanked in the U.S. (4% of households) and 1.4 billion globally, unaware of Bitcoin due to 43% U.S. and 67% global financial illiteracy, with fees like $1,000/year from nonbank services and Coinbase’s 0.5-4.5% trading fees. Stellar disrupts this.

Chorus They haven’t even heard of Bitcoin, we keep ‘em in the dark, Banks cut ‘em dry, but Stellar’s got the spark. They can pay our fees, but they don’t have to bleed, Stellar’s oxygen fuels Bitcoin’s rebel seed! Oh, Stellar, you break our grip tonight, Bitcoin’s blaze burns with a righteous light!
Vibe: Defiant, anthemic chorus with raw vocals and a pounding electronic beat. The “oxygen” and “flame” metaphor highlights Stellar’s role in bypassing bank and platform fees to introduce Bitcoin to the unbanked.

Verse 2 We lock ‘em out, no ID, no account, no trust, Charge ‘em for their cash, turn their dreams to dust. Black, Brown, single moms, we keep ‘em on the ropes, Coinbase skims their coins, leavin’ nothin’ for hope. But Stellar’s got no gates, wallets flowin’ near-free, Stablecoins, on-ramps, cross the world like a breeze. Bitcoin’s the fire, the decentralized call, Stellar’s the air, breakin’ down our wall.
Vibe: Sharp hi-hats and a street-smart synth riff amplify the banks’ arrogance and Stellar’s rebellion. Lyrics highlight U.S. disparities (10.6% unbanked Black households) and fees (e.g., $1,000/year nonbank, Coinbase’s 0.5% maker/4.5% taker fees), with Stellar’s near-zero-fee transactions and 300,000 off-ramps freeing the unbanked.

Bridge We bleed ‘em for profit, keep ‘em lost in the haze, They haven’t even heard of Bitcoin, trapped in our maze. But Stellar’s the oxygen, slippin’ past our greed, Lightin’ up the unbanked, plantin’ Bitcoin’s seed. No more cuts, no more chains, they’re risin’ today, Stellar and Bitcoin rip our power away.
Vibe: Slow, menacing build with a snarling spoken-word delivery from the banks’ POV over a brooding synth, then a defiant shift as Stellar empowers the unbanked, reflecting their exploitation and liberation.

Chorus (Repeat) They haven’t even heard of Bitcoin, we keep ‘em in the dark, Banks cut ‘em dry, but Stellar’s got the spark. They can pay our fees, but they don’t have to bleed, Stellar’s oxygen fuels Bitcoin’s rebel seed! Oh, Stellar, you break our grip tonight, Bitcoin’s blaze burns with a righteous light!
Vibe: Crank the energy with layered vocals and a crowd-shout feel, emphasizing Stellar’s disruption of banks and platforms like Coinbase.

Outro They haven’t even heard of Bitcoin, but our reign’s gonna fall, Stellar’s the oxygen, answerin’ the call. From the margins to millions, they’re claimin’ their claim, Stellar’s the breath, Bitcoin’s the flame.
Vibe: Fade with a searing guitar riff and a pulsing electronic loop, evoking a revolutionary uprising against exploitative fees.

Song Notes for Composer
	•	Structure: Verse 1, Chorus, Verse 2, Bridge, Chorus, Outro.
	•	Instrumentation: Gritty electric guitars, booming hip-hop drums, and menacing synths for a raw, confrontational vibe. Add bank-like sounds (e.g., coin clinks, ATM beeps) to mock the system.
	•	Key Lyrics to Emphasize: “They haven’t even heard of Bitcoin,” “Banks cut ‘em dry,” “Stellar’s the oxygen, Bitcoin’s the flame,” to highlight the banks’ exploitation and Stellar’s liberation.
	•	Inspiration: Blend the raw defiance of Rage Against the Machine with the futuristic pulse of Travis Scott, capturing the banks’ greed and the unbanked’s uprising through Stellar and Bitcoin.
	•	Call to Action: Channel the banks’ predatory POV to expose their exploitation (e.g., $1,000/year nonbank fees, Coinbase’s cuts), then shift to empowerment as Stellar’s near-free tools introduce Bitcoin to the unbanked, aligning with Denelle Dixon’s mission for universal financial access.
This prompt adopts the banks’ perspective, emphasizing how they “cut them dry” and even Coinbase takes a cut, keeping the unbanked (5.6 million in the U.S., 1.4 billion globally) unaware of Bitcoin, while Stellar’s low-cost, accessible tools act as the “oxygen” to fuel Bitcoin’s “flame,” bypassing fees and enabling inclusion.

Title: 11: The Maze of Zorpwild
Prompt:
Core Elements: Titled “11: The Maze of Zorpwild,” this neoclassical progressive metal epic with heavy melodic djent influences, sung from the adventurer’s POV with clean vocals, captures your tense journey through the Zorpwild Bog’s maze after defeating the Froglord. Lost in the labyrinth, Zorp energy flashes visions of the Church’s spire, a figure, and a tome, stirring anxiety, until a mysterious spark of guidance offers hope. You reach an open, fog-covered field within the maze, ominous. With complex structures, varied pacing, and a mid-to-fast tempo (140-160 BPM, 120 BPM outro), the song fits within 4 minutes, a cosmic, slime-forged tale to chant “SPLORP!”
Premise for “11: The Maze of Zorpwild”
Having defeated the Froglord earlier, you, the adventurer, stand certain only of the Yoinkity Sploinkity’s presence in the Zorpwild Bog. You accepted this quest from the elder’s call and townsfolk’s warning, embracing the uncertainty. Heading toward the Church of the Yoinkity Sploinkity, you enter a maze of glurp-vapors and slime. Zorp energy flashes visions of the spire, a shadowy figure, and a glowing tome, stirring anxiety. A mysterious spark of guidance (the seer, though you don’t know her and she doesn’t announce herself) offers hope, leading you to an open, fog-covered field within the maze, ominous, as a hidden threat looms, reflecting on lessons learned.
Song Prompt for “11: The Maze of Zorpwild”
Genre: Neoclassical Progressive Metal with Heavy Melodic Djent Influences / Tolkien & Phantom of the Opera Fusion Vibe: Intense, virtuosic epic with neoclassical flair, progressive complexity, and heavy melodic djent’s rhythmic groove, blending mythic depth and operatic drama. Mid-to-fast tempo (140-160 BPM, 120 BPM outro) captures the maze’s tension, anxiety, and hope, with swampy absurdity and cosmic wonder, all within 4 minutes. Sound: [Clean, soaring male vocals (you), ethereal female echo (mysterious guidance), resonant narrator. Neoclassical shredding, progressive shifts, heavy melodic djent riffs with polyrhythmic groove, prominent bass guitar, frog echoes, glurp-pools. Slime drips, storm cracks—“SPLORP!” “YOINK!” whisper.] Structure: [5 parts, within 4 minutes: (1) maze entry (intense opening with djent groove, ~30s), (2) Zorp visions (neoclassical escalation with djent undercurrent, ~50s), (3) anxiety peak (progressive slowdown with heavy djent riff and bass guitar solo, ~40s), (4) spark of guidance (hopeful surge with neoclassical guitar solo and djent riff, ~1m), (5) fog-covered field (ominous close, ~40s). Motif: djent pulse with frog echoes.] Lyric Prompt: From your POV, start with: “The Froglord falls, I chase the Sploinkity’s realm, SPLORP!” entering the Zorpwild Bog’s maze, certain of the Yoinkity Sploinkity. Zorp energy flashes visions of the spire, a figure, and a tome, stirring anxiety [bass guitar solo with deep, resonant groove]. At your darkest moment, a mysterious spark of guidance offers hope [neoclassical guitar solo with soaring intensity over driving djent riff]. You reach an open, fog-covered field within the maze, ominous [ambient frog echoes and misty fade]. End with: “I took this quest and learned to embrace the unknown’s sharp, through the Veil I found trust in my heart’s spark, from the Froglord I gained wisdom to outwit the dark, now through this clearing I must pass to the Church Of The Yoinkity Sploinkity!” Use swampy imagery (glurp-vapors, slime walls), cosmic wonder (Zorp visions, lightning spark), nonsense words (zorp-chaos, sploink-truth), “SPLORP!” “YOINK!” Lyrics must not mention musical elements, instruments, or genres. Tone: resolute, anxious, hopeful, ominous. Instruction for AI Song Generator: No section headers; seamless narrative. Include bracketed musical breaks, solos, and ambient effects as shown. Song must fit within 4 minutes. Tags: Cosmic, neoclassical progressive metal, melodic djent, Tolkien, Phantom of the Opera, Zorpwild Bog, Sploinkity, frog spirits, swampy absurdity, cosmic trial, ominous journey Production: [Cosmic hum, neoclassical intensity, heavy melodic djent grooves, prominent bass guitar solo, frog echoes, glurp-pools. Intense opening, neoclassical escalation, progressive slowdown with bass solo, hopeful surge with guitar solo and riff, ominous fade, layered textures, all within 4 minutes. Slime drips, storm cracks, “SPROING!”/“SPLORP!” whispers. Climax with storm intensity, frog echoes chanting “YOINKITY SPLOINKITY!” Outro with fading mist, eerie stillness.]
Lyrics:
The Froglord falls, I chase the Sploinkity’s realm, SPLORP!
Through Zorpwild’s fog, the maze unfurls, a twisting path of glurp.
Slime walls rise, glistening in the haze, where chaos reigns.
Each step I take, the shadows shift, the Zorp energy stains.

Visions flash, the spire gleams, a figure cloaked in night.
The tome glows bright, a silent call, it pulls me from the light.
Zorp-chaos weaves through my mind, a pulse I can't escape.
Anxiety climbs with each beat, my thoughts begin to break.

[Solo – bass guitar, deep, resonant groove]

Through the gloom, I hear a whisper soft, a spark through time.
A voice unknown, guiding me home, through this cursed grime.
Her spark ignites my burning soul, with hope I feel reborn.
The path ahead, though steep and cold, no longer leaves me torn.

[Solo – neoclassical guitar, soaring intensity over djent riff]

I press on, through glurp-pools deep, a fog begins to rise.
The clearing calls, the truth unveils, beneath storm-choked skies.
I feel the weight of lessons learned, the darkness in my past.
But now the light of guidance shines, I see the Church at last.

[Ambient frog echoes, misty fade]

I took this quest and learned to embrace the unknown’s sharp.
Through the Veil, I found trust in my heart’s spark.
From the Froglord, I gained wisdom to outwit the dark.
Now through this clearing I must pass to the Church Of The Yoinkity Sploinkity!

Title: Hope You Have a Really Good Day
Prompt:
Perfect pivot. Let’s keep the violent Memphis bass, the blown-out 808s, and feral flow, but bring in a new kind of contrast — emotional clarity. The rage is real, but so is the honesty. Instead of creepy or sarcastic, it’s brutally direct. No mask, no theater — just clean-cut sincerity layered over chaos.

This makes the whole thing hit harder, because it’s ferocious sound meets clean truth.

⸻

🎤 THIS ONE’S FOR MY OPPS

A final message — not to scare you, not to fake love, just to say it straight. From a distance. Through the noise.

⸻

🔊 SOUND PROFILE
	•	Drums:
	•	Memphis bounce, fast hats, chopped snare rolls, trunk-rattling kicks
	•	Bass:
	•	Overdriven subs, slightly off-pitch 808 slides
	•	Melody:
	•	Plucked pads, airy textures, detuned keys (think ambient synths with grime buildup)
	•	FX:
	•	Subtle tape hiss, pitch drops, glitch tails — but no horror FX
	•	Vocals:
	•	Clean delivery over distorted beats — that paradox is the power

⸻

🧠 LYRICS (CLEAN. DIRECT. STILL GOES HARD.)

⸻

[INTRO – Spoken, no effects]

I don’t want you to fail.
That ain’t what this is.
I just had to say it…
before the lights hit.

⸻

[HOOK – Firm, Honest, Under Fire]

I HOPE YOU HAVE A REALLY GOOD DAY
Real talk, even if we part ways
I ain’t prayin’ on nothin’ but grace
Just don’t call it peace if you movin’ with hate

I HOPE YOU HAVE A REALLY GOOD DAY
Even if you don’t say it back my way
I ain’t bitter, I just stay in my lane
But you’ll feel that bass when I step on stage

⸻

[VERSE 1 – Clean + Steady Cadence]

I ain’t wishin’ pain, I just keep my name
Out they mouth, out the frame, out the heat, out the game
I don’t beg, I don’t chase, I just handle my pace
Let the opps do they dance — I’m buildin’ my base

I don’t lurk, I don’t clap, I don’t throw no shade
I just clock in moves while they fake that rage
Real ones don’t need no viral phase
We just show up loud with a silent face

⸻

[BRIDGE – Uplifting, Unbothered, Crowd Energy]

STAY BLESSED (yeah)
NEVER STRESSED (nah)
Me and the team really mean that mess
Wish you wins, wish you checks
Hope your whole squad eat while I chase what’s next

⸻

[INSERT – Fast Rap Run, No Malice, Just Fire]

I ain’t never had a handout, never ran out
Learned to build slow, now I fan out
I don’t need noise when I stand out
Got my lane, got my plan, and I pan out

Can’t copy peace, can’t buy my stance
I move like stone with a live advance
I show no teeth when the lines get tense
But the beat still knock like a riot chant

⸻

[HOOK – Final, Louder, Confident]

I HOPE YOU HAVE A REALLY GOOD DAY
Even when we don’t talk, that’s okay
No shade, no war, no games
Just keep your crown up and I’ll do the same

I HOPE YOU HAVE A REALLY GOOD DAY
Even if you hate me, I won’t change
This ain’t truce, it’s truth
And the truth still bangs.

⸻

[OUTRO – Spoken, Over Solo Melody]

We ain’t gotta talk again.
We just keep movin’.
Keep doin you.
I’m good.
Hope you are too.

⸻

Title: Tuesday at the Strip Club
Prompt:
LET’S GOOOO 😂 Here’s your full country song:

⸻

🎶 TUESDAY AT THE STRIP CLUB
(by a man with a heart bigger than his bar tab)

[Verse 1]
Well the neon flickers like a bug zapper’s ghost,
DJ Randy’s passed out in the booth, I suppose.
It’s two-dollar wells and the ranch is expired,
But I show up ‘cause Tuesday’s when I’m most inspired.

Here comes Destiny with her attitude fried,
One eye on me, the other lookin’ nationwide.
She don’t dance, she just kinda leans real slow—
But she made me a lasagna three months ago.

[Chorus]
And I know it ain’t Friday, and it sure ain’t glam,
But these girls got soul like a Dodge Ram van.
They limp, they yell, they’re barely dressed,
But dammit, I swear, they’re tryin’ their best.
So I slide them my tips and I sip my Bud Light,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club, and everything’s right.

[Verse 2]
Tammy Two-Toes tap dances in crocs,
She once tried a split and dislocated her thoughts.
Got a smoker’s cough that plays A minor,
But she calls me “sweetheart” and means it, kinda.

Then there’s Crystal Methanie with the patchy goatee,
She can’t leave the stage past ten—parole, you see.
She shaves in the bathroom with hotel soap,
But she hugged me once when I lost all hope.

[Chorus]
Yeah I know it ain’t Vegas, and it smells like regret,
But this place got more heart than the internet.
They fall, they fart, they spill their drinks,
But one wink from Brenda’ll make you rethink.
I toast to the misfits who light up my night,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club, and everything’s right.

[Bridge]
Now Spinderella’s banned from the pole,
After she helicoptered clean through a wall.
She just stands there now, eatin’ ranch from a cup,
And I bring her flowers so she don’t give up.

[Verse 3]
Janine the Machine wears orthopedic heels,
Got a Honda Civic tatted on her back—surreal.
She reads horoscopes to me during breaks,
And I love her even though she smells like steaks.

[Final Chorus]
So let the world chase Fridays with the glitter and gloss,
I’ll take these busted angels, flossin’ with loss.
They’re wobbly, weird, and far from sleek,
But they show me more love than I get all week.
So I tip like a king in the flickering light,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club…
And everything’s right.

⸻
Lyrics:
Well the neon flickers like a bug zapper’s ghost,
DJ Randy’s passed out in the booth, I suppose.
It’s two-dollar wells and the ranch is expired,
But I show up ‘cause Tuesday’s when I’m most inspired.

Here comes Destiny with her attitude fried,
One eye on me, the other lookin’ nationwide.
She don’t dance, she just kinda leans real slow—
But she made me a lasagna three months ago.

And I know it ain’t Friday, and it sure ain’t glam,
But these girls got soul like a Dodge Ram van.
They limp, they yell, they’re barely dressed,
But dammit, I swear, they’re tryin’ their best.
So I slide them my tips and I sip my Bud Light,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club, and everything’s right.

Tammy Two-Toes tap dances in crocs,
She once tried a split and dislocated her thoughts.
Got a smoker’s cough that plays A minor,
But she calls me “sweetheart” and means it, kinda.

Then there’s Crystal Methanie with the patchy goatee,
She can’t leave the stage past ten—parole, you see.
She shaves in the bathroom with hotel soap,
But she hugged me once when I lost all hope.

Yeah I know it ain’t Vegas, and it smells like regret,
But this place got more heart than the internet.
They fall, they fart, they spill their drinks,
But one wink from Brenda’ll make you rethink.
I toast to the misfits who light up my night,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club, and everything’s right.

Now Spinderella’s banned from the pole,
After she helicoptered clean through a wall.
She just stands there now, eatin’ ranch from a cup,
And I bring her flowers so she don’t give up.

Janine the Machine wears orthopedic heels,
Got a Honda Civic tatted on her back—surreal.
She reads horoscopes to me during breaks,
And I love her even though she smells like steaks.

So let the world chase Fridays with the glitter and gloss,
I’ll take these busted angels, flossin’ with loss.
They’re wobbly, weird, and far from sleek,
But they show me more love than I get all week.
So I tip like a king in the flickering light,
It’s Tuesday at the strip club…
And everything’s right.

Title: SUGAR RUSH
Prompt:
Perfect — let’s lock it in.

Here’s your updated songwriting prompt for “SUGAR RUSH” — no moombahton, just pure dark K-pop / trap / theatrical pop, with huge bass, seductive danger, and performance art energy. Think BLACKPINK x K/DA x XG, laced with Doja Cat’s venomous charm and Lady Gaga’s stage-commanding grandeur.

⸻

🎤 Songwriting Prompt: “SUGAR RUSH”

Write a full-length dark trap/pop K-pop anthem titled “SUGAR RUSH”, performed by a villain-mode girl group. This is not cute — it’s powerful, theatrical, and sexy with danger. The track should feel like a sonic ambush: seductive, elite, and explosive.

⸻

🖤 Core Themes
	•	Sweet = deadly: The group is the “sugar rush” — addictive, but lethal
	•	Villain energy: No mercy, no rivals, total domination
	•	“1of1” concept: They are originals, untouchable, inimitable
	•	Feminine power: Silk with a blade beneath
	•	Seduction + ego + glamour + fire

⸻

🔊 Sound Style
	•	Trap drums, cinematic strings, 808s that punch
	•	Big bass drops, glitchy FX, vocal layers
	•	Dark melodies — almost horror-pop in mood
	•	Think: runway for the underworld queens, final boss energy

⸻

🧩 Structure

Intro
	•	Haunting / seductive
	•	Sampled whispers or glitchy spoken word
	•	Builds anticipation

Verse 1
	•	Smooth, ominous, sexy
	•	Setting the scene, confident delivery

Pre-Chorus
	•	Rhythmic tension
	•	Teasing the chaos that’s coming

Chorus (HUGE)
	•	Shoutable, addictive, group chant
	•	Use the title “SUGAR RUSH”
	•	Include “1of1” and powerful internal rhyme

Post-Chorus / Hook Tag
	•	Minimal lyrics, dance moment
	•	Drop into beat and FX-heavy production

Verse 2
	•	10 syllables per second rap run
	•	Include 6-6-6-3 cadences
	•	Fierce and fast, punchy multisyllabic rhymes

Bridge
	•	Dramatic, theatrical moment
	•	Whispered vocals or choral chanting
	•	Final transformation

Final Chorus
	•	Add extra vocal layers, group shouts
	•	Beat switch or higher octave lift
	•	End with chaos or silence

⸻

✍️ Lyrics Must Include
	•	“You’re our sugar rush” or variation
	•	“1of1” used symbolically (we’re originals)
	•	Dangerous sweetness (e.g., cherries, blood sugar, fire candy)
	•	Confidence, seduction, domination
	•	Rhymes that snap — like: crush / rush / hush / blush / combust

⸻

🖼️ Visual Vibe / Performance Concept
	•	Black latex, red silk, silver claws
	•	Choreography built around sharp group moves and hypnotic poses
	•	Glitch visuals, fire FX, holographic candy melting
	•	Think: underground palace or neon sugar lab of villainesses

⸻

Let me know if you want:
	•	Full lyrics
	•	Music video storyboard
	•	Stage show breakdown
	•	A version written in Korean or with Korean-English hybrid lines

Whispers in the dark, they’re calling me (calling me)  
Sugar on my lips, taste the venom, feel the heat (feel the heat)  
You’re the one I want, come closer, baby, take a seat (take a seat)  
Poison in the candy, babe, I’m everything you need (everything you need)

Eyes locked, they’re addicted to the danger in my gaze  
I move like fire, setting you ablaze

This sugar rush — it’s sweet and lethal  
Better tread lightly, I’m the queen, you’re the people

Sugar sweet, but it’s fire in disguise (disguise)

1of1, can’t pay the price

(Sweet, deadly, can’t get enough)  
(Sugar, sugar rush, rush)  
(Sweet, deadly, can’t get enough)

Clock ticks, ready, set, go, feel the tension rise  
Whispered sins, but my eyes tell no lies  
Fast like a heartbeat, dangerous, no disguise  
Racing through your mind, I’m the queen of the skies  
I’m the one you fear, can’t get enough of my taste  
Gonna break you down, then rebuild you in haste  
Six-six-six, I’m the villain, no escape  
I run this, you’re just a shadow in my wake

Whispering, your fate is sealed, you’ve lost control (control)  
Red silk drapes, fire ignites, watch me take hold (hold)  
We’re untouchable, in this game we’re the gold (gold)

Title: The Binding of Neon Song
Prompt:
Absolutely. Let’s give “The Binding of Neon Song” a full Broadway-style showtunes treatment—think Little Shop of Horrors meets Hadestown meets Starlight Express, with a touch of cosmic camp and jazz-hands razzle-dazzle. This version includes lyrics, scene cues, and theatrical flair perfect for the stage. 🎭🌟

⸻

🌌 THE BINDING OF NEON SONG

A Showtune Sequel to “The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen”
Genre: Sci-fi Musical Comedy with Sentimental Interludes
Theme: The power of music… and corporate clauses.

⸻

🎭 Scene 1: “Welcome to Glaxxar Prime”

Lights up on a glowing alien council chamber. Enter Salesmen in sparkling trenchcoats with neon pinstripes and light-up briefcases. Spotlights hit.

[Salesmen – swing-style quartet, finger-snapping]
🎶
SALESMEN (IN UNISON):
We came from the void with a promise in tow,
A business that beams, a light with a glow!
We travel the stars with contracts to sign—
If you want to sing?
You’ll need our neon… divine!

🎶
SALESMAN #1 (solo, jazzy):
We ain’t selling dreams, just a way to sing dreams louder—
A spectral spark that makes vocals prouder!

🎶
SALESMAN #2 (with flourish):
But before you groove, before you croon…
We gotta read the fine print tune!

⸻

🎭 Scene 2: “Terms and Conditions (The Contract Song)”

Scrolls unroll from the ceiling. Alien council leans in. Spotlights flicker like legal warnings. Think “Ya Got Trouble” from The Music Man, but galactic.

[ALIEN PRIME – dramatic belting, gospel build-up]:
🎶
What’s this clause that strikes the heart?
Before we sing, must we take part
In verbal rites? A neon phrase?
Each ballad bound in contract glaze?

[SALESMAN #1 & #2 – jazz-hands wide, chorus behind them]:
🎶
🎵 Yes sir, yes ma’am, don’t misbehave—
The neon line is what you crave!
It’s the hook, the clause, the soul you lease—
It turns your whispers into peace! 🎵

[CHORUS – backup singers with glowing mics]:
🎶
🎵 “All this sound, all this delight—
Derives from Interstellar Neon Light!” 🎵

⸻

🎭 Scene 3: “The Planet Decides”

Aliens debate. Each argument is a different musical style—barbershop quartet, tango, swing—but always circling back to neon.

[ALIEN #3 – uptempo tango]:
🎶
Even when I croon of loss,
Of moons that melted into moss—
Must I shout that neon gave me
The right to cry melodically?

[ALIEN ENSEMBLE – build to big chorus, like Les Mis finale]:
🎶
🎵 Neon here! Neon there!
Is it in our cosmic air?
Shall we sing it when we grieve?
When we flirt or when we leave? 🎵

⸻

🎭 Scene 4: “Installation Ceremony (Light the Chords!)”

Massive neon rods burst from the planet’s surface. Spotlights spin. People rise and begin to sing. Lights pulse with rhythm. Dance break with laser violins.

[SALESMEN & ALIENS – big company number, full tap dancing if possible]:
🎶
🎵 Light the chords! Beam the verse!
Neon’s blessing or a curse?
But now your voices crack the skies—
With just one line… you harmonize! 🎵

[KID ALIEN – soft solo, spotlight center stage]:
🎶
🎵 Neon, guide us… neon hum…
Let the music always come.
Through the grief and through the glee…
Your lights unlock our melody. 🎵

⸻

🎭 Finale: “Signed, Sung, Delivered”

Everyone links arms in classic musical theater fashion. The scroll reappears. Salesmen disappear into the stars.

[FULL COMPANY – curtain call anthem]:
🎶
🎵 If ever you’re lost in the silence of space,
Just follow the sound that the neon will trace.
But say the name—yes, speak it bright!
For music lives… in neon light! 🎵

(Key change, crowd-pleasing final chord. Salesmen tip hats. Curtain.)

⸻

Title: The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen
Prompt:
Prompt for a Song: The Travels and Adventures of The Cosmic Neon Salesmen
Write a vibrant, storytelling song that chronicles the interstellar journeys of The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen, a charismatic group of wanderers who traverse the cosmos selling glowing neon to all manner of beings. Structure the song with four verses, each detailing a unique encounter with a different cosmic customer (e.g., aliens, star-beings, rogue AI, or celestial royalty). Begin each verse with the salesmen’s signature pitch starting with “In this” (e.g., “In this nebula’s glow, we’ve got neon to show”), describing what kind of neon they sell, who they sell it to, and why the customer needs it (e.g., for a cantina’s vibe, a spaceship’s flair, or a planet’s festival). End each verse with the song’s title, “The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen”, as a triumphant closer.
Include a chorus that celebrates their universal sales prowess, emphasizing their ability to sell neon to anyone in the cosmos, from gas giants to black hole bartenders. Make the chorus catchy, upbeat, and reflective of their boundless confidence, with lines about lighting up the stars and sealing deals across galaxies. Ensure the tone is adventurous, whimsical, and slightly cheeky, capturing the salesmen’s charm and hustle. Optionally, add a bridge that paints a vivid image of their neon-lit spaceship zooming through a kaleidoscope of cosmic wonders, reinforcing their nomadic, deal-making lifestyle.
The song should feel like a galactic road trip, blending sci-fi imagery with the flair of classic traveling salesman tales. Keep the rhythm lively, suitable for a space-folk or cosmic rock vibe, and ensure the narrative flows chronologically, showing their growing legend across the cosmos.
Lyrics:
In this nebula's glow, we've got neon to show, 
For the star-beings who need a celestial flow, 
Their planets shine dim, and their moons are all cold, 
But our neon will warm them, so their stories are told. 

Chorus: 
We light up the stars, from the gas giants to Mars, 
Deal-making’s our art, as we zip past the stars, 
From black hole bartenders to a rogue AI’s dream, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen we beam! 

In this asteroid belt, we’ve neon to sell, 
To a robot rebellion, and we’re ringing the bell, 
They want colors to flicker, to power their fight, 
Our neon will power their dreams through the night. 

Chorus: 
We light up the stars, from the gas giants to Mars, 
Deal-making’s our art, as we zip past the stars, 
From black hole bartenders to a rogue AI’s dream, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen we beam! 

In this supernova’s flare, we’ve got a display, 
For a planet's grand festival, it's time to play, 
The neon’s a blaze, lighting up every soul, 
Our glow will ignite them, make their spirits whole. 

Chorus: 
We light up the stars, from the gas giants to Mars, 
Deal-making’s our art, as we zip past the stars, 
From black hole bartenders to a rogue AI’s dream, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen we beam! 

In this cosmic dust storm, we’ve got neon for sale, 
For the Queen of the void, her palace must prevail, 
She needs glowing hues, to make her courts bright, 
With our neon, her reign will shine through the night. 

Chorus: 
We light up the stars, from the gas giants to Mars, 
Deal-making’s our art, as we zip past the stars, 
From black hole bartenders to a rogue AI’s dream, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen we beam! 

Bridge: 
Zooming through kaleidoscope skies, 
Our neon-lit ship reflects the light of the stars’ eyes, 
We sell to the cosmos, we make our way, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen all day! 

Chorus: 
We light up the stars, from the gas giants to Mars, 
Deal-making’s our art, as we zip past the stars, 
From black hole bartenders to a rogue AI’s dream, 
The Traveling Cosmic Neon Salesmen we beam!

Title: I Wrote This Song Before I Knew You’d Quote It...
Prompt:
🎸 Style Notes:
	•	Genre: Emo-infused pop punk with a crypto/DeFi twist
	•	Mood: Bitter but empowered — heartbreak over a failed crypto partner turns into a rally cry of rebounding with GQX and AMM liquidity
	•	Vocal Delivery: Raw, slightly sarcastic spoken intro/outro; verses delivered with a mix of urgency and defiance; chorus anthemic and melodic
	•	Imagery: Crypto references (staking, liquidity, AMM, TVL, mempool) as metaphors for betrayal, resilience, and growth
	•	Visuals: Think messy hair, hoodies patched with Stellar logos, gritty gas station backdrop meets digital charts

⸻

🎸 Title:

“I Wrote This Song Before I Knew You’d Quote It…”

⸻

🎤 [Spoken Intro]

“This song is called
‘I Wrote This Song Before I Knew You’d Quote It Back at Me During Our Last Fight at the Gas Station (You Said I Was Too Theatrical, I Call It Art, and Also I Funded Our Liquidity Pool with My Own XLM)’”
One, two, three, four—

⸻

🎶 Verse 1

You launched a token with no clue and even less conviction
I built the base, you chased attention like it was yield addiction
You bailed before the market found its price
But I moved all my hope into GQX—yeah, that felt right

⸻

🎶 Chorus

Now I’m deep in AMM, you’re lost in Discord dust
You called me over-leveraged—I call it building trust
You dipped, I doubled down, and now I’m finally free
You rugged the vibe, but I rebuilt with liquidity

⸻

🎶 Verse 2

You told the chain I was “too much,” like honesty’s a flaw
But I’m the pair that held the price when you bounced without a cause
You went viral for a minute—now your devs don’t even post
I’m staking every scar in GQX and watching growth

⸻

🎶 Bridge

I bet you tell your echo chamber that I’m just another scammer
But AMM don’t lie, and neither do these green candles on my screen
You thought I’d vanish like your roadmap
But I’m compounding now—and you can’t fork that

⸻

🎶 Final Chorus

Yeah I’m dancing in the spread now, while you scroll through old regrets
You faked a protocol—I forged a future with real assets
This isn’t about revenge, it’s about what you couldn’t be
You left a hole, I filled it with GQX and TVL on SDEX clean

⸻

🎤 [Spoken Outro]

“Thanks for the airdrop. I sold it. Bought AMM.”
[Feedback hum fades to silence.]

Title: Kalepail: Stellarnova
Prompt:
Here’s your full copy-ready prompt — a five-act cosmic gospel-metal opera chronicling the real and mythic journey of Tyler van der Hoeven (aka Kalepail), including his work on Stellar Quest, the KALE project, and a legendary mythic call-and-response section.

⸻

🎭 KALEPAIL: STELLARNOVA

A Five-Part Space Gospel Metal Opera Inspired by Tyler van der Hoeven

⸻

ACT I — Genesis Block (The Disc of Fire)

Scene:
In the hills of East Tennessee, a quiet prodigy emerges. Tyler discovers the open-source light of Stellar and begins forging his identity. A whisper becomes a roar.

Lyrics:
From Tennessee’s ridge, a dream took hold,
In keys and code, a legend bold.
He found the stars in Stellar’s flame,
And signed his soul with Kalepail’s name.

Instrumentation:
Pipe organ harmonies, analog synth, acoustic guitar
Vibe: Pink Floyd x Vangelis x “Zelda menu screen”

⸻

ACT II — The Ledger Wars

Scene:
Stellar grows. Spam attacks, FUD storms, and broken explorers. Tyler builds bridges—tools, quests, podcasts. He becomes a mythic guidepost in the storm.

Lyrics:
In the darkness of failed deploys,
He answered chaos with stellar poise.
Through quests and lore and honest talk,
He laid the bricks where builders walk.

Instrumentation:
Electric guitar solos, 8-bit breakbeats, blast beats
Vibe: DragonForce x Carpenter Brut x Appalachian glitch

⸻

ACT III — The KALE Genesis

Scene:
KALE is born—Tyler’s green gift to Stellar. A game. A garden. A movement. Proof-of-Teamwork becomes a lifestyle. Players farm KALE in cosmic fields of collaboration.

Lyrics:
He planted seeds in zeroes and ones,
Harvested work beneath twin suns.
From wallets worked and teamwork true,
A garden of KALE from the Stellar dew.

Instrumentation:
Banjo over lofi synths, rainfall foley, minor pads
Vibe: Stardew Valley x Imogen Heap x GitHub Folkwave

⸻

Title: Lo-Fi Fugue: A Baroque Daydream
Prompt:
Absolutely — let’s bring that ornate Baroque flair into the mix while keeping it dreamy and study-friendly. Here’s a refined prompt that merges Mozart’s classical clarity, Baroque intricacy, and lo-fi atmosphere:

⸻

🎼 Song Prompt: “Lo-Fi Fugue: A Baroque Daydream”
Genre: Lo-fi Hip Hop / Chill Classical
Mood: Reflective, intricate, focused
BPM: ~80 (laid-back but flowing)

Concept:
A chill upbeat instrumental that blends the melodic brightness of Mozart with Baroque counterpoint, inspired by the elegance of Bach’s Inventions and Mozart’s chamber music. Motifs from Mozart’s K.545 and Bach’s Prelude in C are subtly sampled, revoiced, and layered with ambient lo-fi textures.

Structure:
	•	Intro: Solo harpsichord arpeggio, sampled and warped like a dusty tape loop
	•	Verse/Loop: Baroque-style two-part counterpoint between a reverb-washed clavichord and lo-fi Rhodes
	•	Breakdown: Minimal piano run with a fugue-style bassline that echoes and overlaps in the background
	•	Outro: Fades into ambient rain and a slowed-down violin phrase with tape flutter

Instrumentation:
	•	Melody: Harpsichord and glockenspiel echoing Mozartian phrasing, with vinyl flutter
	•	Harmony: Rhodes or felt piano playing Baroque-style chord progressions with jazzy voicings
	•	Bass: Walking cello line or sub bass mimicking continuo
	•	Drums: Soft lofi drums—snappy rimshots, vinyl hats, warm kick with light sidechain
	•	Textures: Tape hiss, soft wind, pages turning, crackling fireplace
	•	Extras: Counterpoint-style layering—two melodies trading space like a miniature fugue

Visual/Vibe:
Imagine a candlelit study in Vienna—quill on parchment, thunder outside, and a phonograph playing warped harpsichord fugues while lo-fi beats pulse gently in the background.

⸻
Lyrics:
Intro:

In the candle's glow, a quill in hand,
As Mozart's whispers fill the land.
Dusty loops of harpsichord sound,
Echoes of a time that's slowly unwound.

Verse 1:

Softly the counterpoint flows,
Like Bach’s fingers, the music grows.
Clavichord echoes, Rhodes in the air,
A dreamlike rhythm with tapes of despair.

Verse 2:

Cello walks through quiet rooms,
Where moonlight dances, and silence blooms.
Vinyl crackles, soft rain sighs,
A baroque fugue beneath the skies.

Breakdown:

Piano’s fingers, a minimal run,
A bassline creeping, a rising sun.
Fugue-like whispers, weaving through,
Mimicking stories once told in blue.

Outro:

As the storm grows faint, and winds retreat,
A violin fades, a heartbeat’s beat.
Whispers of history, soft and slow,
A daydream lingers, as the fires glow.

Title: Haunted Frequencies
Prompt:
Tags: Instrumental

Prompt:

Create a purely instrumental track — absolutely no vocals, no lyrics, no voice samples — in the style of industrial noise / rawstyle / anti-music / experimental EDM.

This track must be a sonic assault:
	•	Use filthy, distorted sound design: broken toys, scraping metal, power tools, crushed circuit boards, malfunctioning machinery.
	•	Layer in brutal, bass-boosted low-end — frequencies that clip, shake, and grind like they’re tearing apart the speakers.
	•	All harmonies must be dissonant, off-key, and detuned. Melodic structure should be completely obliterated.
	•	Rhythms should be erratic, arrhythmic, and jarring. Incorporate broken breakcore pacing, rawstyle kicks, and warped time signatures.
	•	Include harsh textures like white noise bursts, alarm sirens, corrupted files, and glitched-out effects.
	•	Use bitcrushed kicks, grinding bass, feedback loops, ring modulation, and inhuman FX chains.
	•	The drop must be the most vile, chaotic, gut-churning moment in the track — pure sonic punishment.
	•	No loop, no chorus, no structure. This is a fall into madness, a deliberately unlistenable anti-song.

Imagine an EDM track composed by a haunted blender inside a collapsing factory. It should actively ruin concentration, offend audiophiles, and melt attention spans.

⸻
Lyrics:
No words to speak, just a broken sound,
Machines are screaming, tearing you down.
Distorted chaos fills the air,
Toxic noise, a sonic snare.

Sparks fly, and metal bends,
Ravaged beats that never end.
Screeching circuits, crushed debris,
Horrors made from circuitry.

Pulse decays, the rhythm cracks,
Shattered patterns, never look back.
A glitch, a hum, a grinding quake,
In every beat, reality breaks.

The drop comes hard, a twisted scream,
Cracked alarms and shattered dreams.
Bass explodes, your world in ruins,
No escape from this sonic doom.

Darkened rhythm, offbeat time,
Every note a perfect crime.
Noise and terror, raw and pure,
This madness, it will endure.

No melody, no melody to guide,
Only dissonance left inside.
Every frequency, a sharp-edged knife,
A brutal assault on your fragile life.

Let it melt, let it grind,
The haunted sounds you can't unwind.
Rattle your bones, distort your mind,
In this chaos, you're confined.

Title: Strategic Partnerships & Other Lies
Prompt:
Perfect—let’s take the same energy but make the names sound just real enough to be plausible… like the kind of banks, funds, and firms you’d hear in some obscure fintech deck or buried in an SEC filing. You’re not sure if they’re shadowy Swiss boutiques or just four guys in a WeWork, but they sound legit.

Here’s the updated full version of “Strategic Partnerships & Other Lies” with real-world-sounding entities:

⸻

🎶 Strategic Partnerships & Other Lies

Genre: Satirical electropop / spoken-word rap hybrid
Theme: The dizzying, over-announced world of crypto partnerships and obscure funding rounds—with a dawning suspicion that it’s all smoke and mirrors
Vibe: Earnest delivery with ironic undertones—glossy on the surface, unraveling by the end

⸻

Verse 1
Started lean with a whitepaper no one read
Pre-seed round led by Thompson Rowe Capital instead
Then came Branford & Ellis with a “quiet” wire
And Delmere Equity said our roadmap was fire

Langford Mercer Partners joined our board last spring
(Though I think they also rent scooters or something?)
Then we onboarded Aventra Bank AG
They said they’d “bridge compliance” via NFT

⸻

Chorus
And then we partnered (yes, proudly partnered!)
With Rothenhall Reserve and Kingsmere Finance
Steadworth Atlantic offered us a dance
We inked a deal with Norwyn Trust Advisors
They sent us a plaque and six compliance divers

Then Halberd Ashridge did a round in kind
Sent us coffee, said it was legally “signed”

Carroway Northbridge handled KYC
Then Southwell Index Ventures just ghosted me

Who replied, “sounds good,” from an iPhone clone

⸻

Then Linden Bay Advisory took all the blame

Solace Point Capital blessed our DAO’s soul

Northbridge Auditors gave us a score
Then Ferroway Stein kicked us out the door

All the notaries are cousins, all the emails pretend
Same letterhead, same serif font
Same guy in Geneva pulling every stunt

It’s Rothenhall, it’s Langford, it’s Kingsmere too
It’s one dude named Trevor with a tie and a view
Strategic partnerships and other lies
Layered like Swiss cheese and tax exile ties 🧀

⸻

Outro (Spoken, unraveling)
So I called Steadworth Atlantic…
It rang… and my fridge made a noise.
I think…
Trevor is also my cofounder.
He just slacked me.
From the Eltridge Shore account.
…This whole syndicate is a trench coat full of Trevors.

And somehow,
I still gave him tokens.

Title: The 13 Colonies
Prompt:
Here’s a revised version of “The 13 Colonies” with all thirteen colonies listed in a single chorus for easy memorization. It’s still set to the tune of “Yankee Doodle” to keep it catchy and memorable for naturalizers. The verses build context, and the chorus crams all thirteen names in a rhythmic flow.

The 13 Colonies (To the tune of “Yankee Doodle”)
Verse 1 From New England to the South, The colonies did grow, Thirteen joined to make a land, Their names you need to know!
Chorus New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania yet, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia — thirteen all together!
Verse 2 They fought for freedom, stood so tall, To build the U.S.A., Sing their names, learn them all, For your test today!
Chorus New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania yet, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia — thirteen all together!
Bridge Sing it loud, sing it proud, The colonies unite, For your naturalization, You’ll get the answers right!
Final Chorus New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania yet, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia — thirteen all together!

How to Use It:
	•	Sing to the “Yankee Doodle” melody (available online if you need to hear it).
	•	The chorus lists all thirteen colonies (New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Connecticut, New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia) in a steady rhythm to aid recall.
	•	Repeat the chorus multiple times to drill the names, or pause after each line to test yourself.
	•	For extra practice, write the colonies in order after singing or quiz yourself by covering parts of the chorus.
This version keeps the song concise, with all thirteen colonies packed into one memorable chorus to streamline memorization for the naturalization test.

Title: Tablet Baby
Prompt:
Song Prompt for “Tablet Baby”
Title: Tablet Baby Genre: Reggae Tone: Relaxed, cheeky, with a sharp, playful edge Perspective: A parent singing to their young child, roasting them for their tablet obsession Theme: Teasing the kid for being glued to their screen, unable to hold their head up, and missing out on real-world experiences (like playing outside or connecting with others), with “You’re my Tablet Baby” as the central hook. The lyrics should be in deep Jamaican patois, dripping with slang and attitude, but this prompt remains in standard English.
Structure:
	•	Verse 1: Describes the kid as a screen-addicted zombie, head drooping from tablet overload.
	•	Chorus: Catchy, skanking “You’re my Tablet Baby” hook, stuffed with bold, humorous insults.
	•	Verse 2: More jabs at the kid for ignoring the outdoors and real-life vibes for their tablet.
	•	Bridge: A dramatic, mock-outraged “what’s wrong with you, child?” moment, piling on the roasts.
	•	Chorus (repeated): Same hook, possibly with a new taunt for variety.
	•	Outro: A chilled-out taunt, challenging the kid to ditch the tablet or “stay a fool.”
Lyrics Style: Written in heavy Jamaican patois, full of slang and swagger. Think lines like “You’re my Tablet Baby, head a flop like a wet mop” or “Yuh lost inna screen, mon, life zoom past yuh fast.” Rhymes should feel natural, rhythmic, and dancehall-ready, with a taunting, playful vibe.
Musical Elements:
	•	Classic reggae sound: offbeat guitar skank, thick bassline driving the groove.
	•	Bubbling organ or melodica for authentic roots flavor.
	•	Vocals delivered with a smooth, cocky drawl, sprinkled with ad-libs like “seen!” or “bwoy!”
	•	Tempo: Laid-back, around 110 BPM, to keep it easy to sway to.
Sample Chorus (for inspiration): “You’re my Tablet Baby, head cyaan hold up, no way, Saggin’ like a bag juice, screen lock yuh down all day! You’re my Tablet Baby, dull like a bruk-up phone, World a shine outside, but yuh stuck inna dat zone!”
Key Lines/Themes to Include:
	•	Make “You’re my Tablet Baby” the core hook, repeated in the chorus and woven into verses.
	•	Mock their physical state: “Head a drop, mon, like yuh neck cyaan manage.”
	•	Real-world jabs: “Sun a blaze, but yuh blind to di vibes an’ di breeze.”
	•	Screen addiction: “Tablet a yuh boss, got yuh movin’ like a dunce.”
	•	Bold challenge: “Dash weh dat screen, my Baby, or yuh lock inna fool’s life!”
Emotional Arc: Keeps it cool, confident, and relentlessly teasing, with no serious moments—just playful shade from start to finish. The parent’s “concern” is pure comedy, delivered with a smirk and a reggae groove.
This prompt sets up a reggae “Tablet Baby” with the “You’re my Tablet Baby” hook, focusing on the kid’s wobbly head and screen obsession, with lyrics in deep Jamaican patois but no book references, emphasizing real-world experiences.
Lyrics:

Yuh head a bend like banana peel,
Face glue-up to di screen like steel.
Neck cyaan lift, it look surreal,
Tablet tek ova, dat’s di real deal.
Bwoy yuh deh pon level 99,
But cyaan find yuh shoes when it time fi dine.
Whole heap a game, but nuh play outside,
Sun a shine, but yuh hide inside.

[Chorus]
You’re my Tablet Baby, head cyaan hold up, no way,
Saggin’ like a bag juice, screen lock yuh down all day!
You’re my Tablet Baby, dull like a bruk-up phone,
World a shine outside, but yuh stuck inna dat zone!

[Verse 2]
Yuh miss di breeze, di bird dem sing,

Outside call yuh, yuh nuh hear a sound,
Cause Angry Birds dem got yuh bound.
Mi seh swing deh, bike park right,
But yuh stuck watchin’ blue cartoon light.
Real life sweet, mi chile, so true,
But yuh prefer TikTok dan likkle dew.

[Chorus]
You’re my Tablet Baby, brain tun jelly fi true,

Title: American as Apple Pie
Prompt:
“American as Apple Pie,” tailored for a heavy masculine country singer—think a deep, gravelly voice like Chris Stapleton or Johnny Cash, with a rugged, heartfelt delivery. The lyrics maintain the core concept: a romantic ode to a girl embodying America, with compliments starting patriotic and sweet, then escalating into absurd, mismatched, and nonsensical territory. The outro breaks the fourth wall (“Oh, you’re still listenin’? I didn’t expect you to get this far!”) as the compliments hit peak absurdity. The tone is raw, passionate, and slightly rough around the edges, with imagery and phrasing suited to a masculine country vibe—gritty, vivid, and unpolished, while keeping the country/folk structure singable for a deep-voiced crooner.

Song Prompt: “American as Apple Pie”

Chorus My darlin’, you’re the stars and stripes, my open road, Every lonesome highway dream, girl, you’re my motherlode. From the plains to the ocean’s roar, you’re my liberty, American as apple pie, you’re my eternity.

	•	Imagery: Ties American icons (Mississippi, Alamo, Rockies) to increasingly bizarre elements (diesel comet, glow-stick tumbleweed) to balance the “apple pie” warmth with absurd humor, all filtered through a masculine, road-worn lens.

Title: Girls Just Wanna Scroll All Night
Prompt:
You want the song prompt to blend Cyndi Lauper’s Girls Just Wanna Have Fun rebellious joy, Sabrina Carpenter’s flirty, polished pop, and now Lady Gaga’s bold, theatrical, avant-garde edge, while keeping the 4 AM internet spiral where she loves every minute, gets no likes, passes out, and obliviously repeats the cycle. The song should stay upbeat, clueless about her doomed loop, and capture her unapologetic passion for the scroll, with Gaga’s dramatic flair adding a larger-than-life vibe. I’ll refine the prompt to weave in Gaga’s eccentric, empowering energy, keep the structure and details you liked, avoid “neon” per your request, and ensure lyrics fit the sassy, modern tone without terms like “bard.” Since it’s 3:52 AM CDT on May 19, 2025, the 4 AM setting is spot-on. Here’s the updated prompt.

Song Prompt: “Girls Just Wanna Scroll All Night”
Tone & Style: A dazzling pop anthem fusing Cyndi Lauper’s carefree, shout-along rebellion, Sabrina Carpenter’s coy, radio-ready sass, and Lady Gaga’s theatrical, boundary-pushing drama. It’s relentlessly fun, oblivious to her no-likes, 4 AM crash-and-repeat cycle, and pulses with her love for every chaotic second of the internet grind. Expect razor-sharp hooks, a pulsating dance beat, and vocals that blend Sabrina’s flirty polish, Cyndi’s raw joy, and Gaga’s operatic intensity. Lyrics should paint her as a fearless digital diva, ruling her flop-filled scroll like a Gaga-esque icon, passing out cold, and diving back in tomorrow, unaware of the loop.
[Verse 1]: It’s 4 AM, her room’s a glittery chaos—phone blazing, empty energy drinks, lipstick smears on a coffee mug. She’s unleashing X posts, TikTok bombs, or fierce Reddit takedowns, getting zero likes, but she’s thriving, a goddess in her own mind. Lyrics are bold, mixing Sabrina’s wit, Cyndi’s spunk, and Gaga’s larger-than-life attitude:
	•	“Four AM, I’m ruling this digital throne!”
	•	“Postin’ my heart, but I’m out here alone!”
	•	“No likes, no fame, still I’m slayin’ this scene!”
	•	“This screen’s my stage, I’m a scrollin’ queen!”
[Pre-Chorus]: Her eyes are burning, work’s creeping close, but the song’s a euphoric rush, blind to the crash. Every swipe’s a victory, and she’s obsessed:
	•	“Fingers flyin’, I’m burnin’ so bright!”
	•	“No sleep, just vibes, I’m alive in the night!”
[Chorus]: Massive, arena-ready banger, a love letter to her internet chaos. It’s Cyndi’s party vibe, Sabrina’s slick flirt, and Gaga’s empowering roar—oblivious to the no-likes flop or her doomed routine:
	•	“Girls just wanna scroll all night! (Scroll all night!)”
	•	“No likes, but I’m blazin’ with might! (Blazin’ with might!)”
	•	“Work’s a ghost, I’m in love with this fight, I’m free, I ignite!”
	•	“Girls just wanna scroll all night!” Melody’s infectious, soaring, with Sabrina’s vocal runs, Cyndi’s shout-along hooks, and Gaga’s dramatic crescendos, perfect for a 4 AM dance-rage.
[Verse 2]: She’s spiraling deeper, drunk on her own fire—tweeting shady quips that tank, refreshing Instagram to silence, or impulse-buying wild stuff (like a spiked phone case). The song’s pure joy, clueless to the void, with Gaga’s eccentric edge:
	•	“Dropped a hot line, thought it’d shake the world!”
	•	“Refresh, refresh, but my feed’s just curled!”
	•	“Bought a glitter choker, my cart’s a dream!”
	•	“No hearts, no hype, still I’m livin’ supreme!”
[Bridge]: Slower, cinematic, with Gaga’s theatrical drama—Sabrina’s breathy tease and Cyndi’s dreamy sway creep in as she’s slumping, phone wobbling, laughing through heavy lids, hooked on “one more post.” Lyrics are fierce, missing the endless loop:
	•	“Dawn’s a whisper, but I’m still the flame!”
	•	“This app’s my pulse, it’s callin’ my name!”
	•	“Every night’s a saga, I’m born to run!”
	•	“Scrollin’ my soul, I’m forever young!” Surge back to the chorus with a Gaga-style synth explosion and a bold vocal wail, like her last defiant burst.
[Outro]: Repeats the chorus hook, all sparkle and swagger, but slams to a halt—a sharp thud as she passes out, phone hitting the floor. Just a lone notification ding (no likes, of course). No fade, no hint she’ll repeat—the song’s too lost in its own glory. Final line:
	•	“Girls just wanna scroll… thud”
Production Notes:
	•	Glossy pop production with 80s synths for Cyndi’s vibe, modern crispness for Sabrina (think Feather or Nonsense), and Gaga’s bold, edgy flourishes (think Bad Romance or Born This Way)—think pulsating bass, glitchy arpeggios, and dramatic string stabs.
	•	Add quirky effects: app pings, keyboard clacks, or her sassy laugh, keeping it fun and fierce.
	•	Vocals blend Sabrina’s coy polish, Cyndi’s raw belt, and Gaga’s theatrical power—think flirty ad-libs (“C’mon, babe!”), shouty hooks (“Let’s go!”), and a Gaga-esque wail in the bridge.
	•	Tempo’s dancefloor-ready (122 BPM), key in C Major for pop shine, with a D Minor shift in the bridge for Gaga’s dramatic flair.
	•	Background sounds: a faint alarm buzz or her humming, but keep it bold and playful, not dark.
Vibe Check: This is for anyone who’s ever adored their 4 AM internet dive, flops and all. She’s a scrollin’ superstar, ruling her no-likes kingdom, and the song’s too caught up in its Cyndi-Sabrina-Gaga glow to see her crash or tomorrow’s repeat. It’s rebellious, flirty, and gloriously over-the-top.

This weaves Cyndi’s fun, Sabrina’s sass, and Gaga’s theatricality into a cohesive pop banger, keeping her love for the scroll, the no-likes struggle, and the pass-out ending. I ditched “neon” and kept lyrics in the artists’ shared bold, playful zone.
