Title: INTO HER VEINS
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “INTO HER VEINS”

Concept:
A high-speed, hypnotic trap song that blends gothic seduction, mutual obsession, and emotional ruin — powerful but cold. The vibe is seductive and ritualistic, with precise flows at 9 syllables per second. It balances razor-sharp rap with ethereal, haunting elements.

⸻

Sound Design:
Genre: Goth Trap / Cloud Rap / SuicideBoys-style Dark Trap
BPM: 180–200 (to support 9 syllables per second)
Drums: Tight hi-hats, trap rolls, overcompressed kicks
Bass: Murky 808s, sub-bass distortion, foggy low-end
Synths: Ethereal pads, reversed pianos, analog detuned choirs
Effects: Whispered vocal layers, heartbeat pulse under hook, vinyl dust crackle

⸻

Lyrics:

Verse 1 (fast, dark, seductive)
Ink on my neck and her breath in the dark
Fangs in my chest while she tearing apart
Glide through her mind like a switchblade arc
Grin while I slide through the pitch black heart

She want pain — I deliver in rhythm
Lace and leather, she call it a prism
Two lost souls in a blood-bound system
Cursed our names with a ritual wisdom

Verse 2 (cold, poetic, tight)
No god, no sin — just heat
Hands on throat, don’t speak
Nails draw lines so deep
She ride that knife, no sleep

Body like a tomb, I rest
She whisper death in sex
Skin like dusk — I taste
She pull me past the gate

Verse 3 (shadowy, smoother vocal contrast)
Silk-draped lust and knives
Wounds that glow at night
She want more than blood
I give her whole my life

Bridge (2-1 chant-style, percussive, punchy)
Drip-red. Bite-fast.
Skin-slick. Ghost-pass.
She-moan. I-laugh.
No-halt. Just-crash.

Cold-breath. Wet-lace.
Tongue-twist. Death-chase.
She-mark. I-stain.
One-touch. Her-vein.

Hook (ethereal, pulsing, addictive)
Drag me deep into her veins
Love me like we share the pain
Ride that void and break the chain
Now she don’t forget my name

⸻

Vibe Goals:
Designed to hypnotize with cold, venomous energy. Perfect for dark clubs with neon fog, latex and lace aesthetics. The lyrics hit hard but keep the mood seductive and ritualistic, layered over a ghostly trap beat with ethereal melodies and aggressive low end. It’s intimate domination meets gothic ritual — addictive and haunting.

Title: The Vegan Gastronomicon
Prompt:

⸻

🎶 Song Prompt: The Vegan Gastronomicon

Genre & Vibe:
A full-throttle Celtic punk-ska anthem bursting with chaotic joy and rebellious energy. Driven by tin whistle, fiddle, accordion, offbeat ska guitar, punk drums, and now horns for sharp, punchy blasts. The mood is rowdy, playful, and communal—imagine a vegan pub kitchen turned mosh pit. Tempo: ~150 BPM, skankable and pogo-friendly.

Tone:
Over-the-top and theatrical, this is a celebration of vegan excess and transformation, dripping with attitude and high-energy humor. Feels like a punk band crashing a cooking show and accidentally creating a new food religion.

⸻

🔥 Structure:

Intro:
	•	A dramatic, shouted invocation:
“GASTRONOMICON ARISE!”
	•	Interrupted by a deadpan:
“Um… actually, I’m VEGAN.”
	•	Awkward pause. Then a blast of ska guitar, fiddle, and horn stabs as the track launches.

⸻

Verses (5 total, 4-6 lines each):
	•	Each verse focuses on a stage of creation:
	1.	Sourcing: Epic gathering of global ingredients.
	2.	Chopping & Mixing: Intense prep with blades and spices.
	3.	Saucing & Layering: Hummus, tahini, nutritional yeast magic.
	4.	Wrapping & Rolling: Bamboo mats, collard green spirals, team effort.
	5.	Cooking & Presentation: Bamboo steaming, solar baking, communal reveal.
	•	Language should be vivid, punky, and ingredient-specific—each verse should name-drop 3-5 ingredients and describe bold action (“ribbon that zucchini,” “smash those chickpeas”).

⸻

Kale-Avo-Broc-Quin-Tofu-Mango-Zuki-Farro-Seitan-Lentil-Mushroom-Snap-Tom-Barley-Spinach-Carrot-Tempeh-Plantain-Rice-Jackfruit-Artichoke-Flax-Chia-Onion-Cauli-Pom-Fig-Sweet-Beet-Chickpea-Millet WRAP!
(crowd echo: “wrap it up wrap it up!” fast & ska-style)
Vegan Gastronomicon, arise!

⸻

Bridge – (Call and Response):
	•	Lead singer shouts: “What’s in the wrap?”

	•	Repeat 3-4 times with rising intensity.

⸻

Outro:
	•	A high-speed finale with horns, drums, and tin whistle crescendo.
	•	Final chorus explodes with extra drum fills and gang vocals.
	•	Ends on a shouted: “Gastronomicon… ARISE!” then tin whistle fade-out.

⸻

🍽 Dish Concept:

A mythical, mega-vegan wrap:
	•	Outer layer: steamed collard greens or nori
	•	Interior: every possible plant—veggies, fruits, grains, alt-proteins, and magical extras
	•	Built like a vegan turducken, but sassier and spiral-wrapped.

Key Ingredients (featured in prep & chorus):
	•	Veggies: Kale, Broccoli, Zucchini, Carrot, Beet, Cauliflower, Mushroom, Spinach, Sweet Potato, Artichoke, Snap Pea, Onion
	•	Fruits: Avocado, Mango, Tomato, Pomegranate, Fig, Plantain, Coconut
	•	Grains: Quinoa, Rice, Farro, Barley, Millet, Buckwheat
	•	Proteins: Tofu, Seitan, Tempeh, Jackfruit, Lentils, Chickpeas, Black Beans
	•	Extras: Seaweed, Chia Seeds, Flaxseeds, Nutritional Yeast

Preparation Steps:
	•	Sourcing: Jackfruit from the tropics, quinoa from the Andes, kale from local soil
	•	Chopping: Dice broccoli, ribbon zucchini, cube mango, crumble tofu
	•	Mixing: Mash chickpeas with lemon tahini, stir fry spinach/mushroom with garlic
	•	Sauces: Hummus w/ ginger, yeast paste w/ paprika, tahini swirl
	•	Wrapping: Tight spiral in collard greens, sealed with hummus
	•	Cooking: Steamed for softness, then lightly baked for texture

⸻

🎤 Performance Notes:
	•	Band Setup: Lead vocals + gang chorus, fiddle, tin whistle, accordion, ska guitar, bass, punk drums, horns
	•	Stage Show: Chefs moshing with knives, dancers in lettuce capes, fake steamer billowing fog
	•	Crowd Involvement:
	•	Yell-along chorus
	•	Ska adlibs: “wrap it up wrap it up!” (fast, double time)
	•	“What’s in the wrap?” call and response
	•	Energy Arc: Starts theatrical → builds through layers → ends in joyous frenzy

⸻

Influence: $uicideBoy$, Bones, Night Lovell

Title: God Don’t Sleep (Riot Saint Version)
Prompt:
🎵 Song Prompt: “God Don’t Sleep (Riot Saint Version)”

💀 Concept:

The world’s still ugly — but this time, you’re the punishment.
This ain’t about death. This is about not folding when everything around you begs you to.
It’s $crim with no mercy for despair, spitting divine venom, resurrected and war-ready.
Imagine a battle prayer muttered through gritted teeth, while the walls shake from bass and belief.

⸻

🔊 Sonic Blueprint:
	•	Tempo: 72–75 BPM (halftime trap rhythm)
	•	Drums:
	•	Kick: deep, clipped, bleeding into the subs
	•	Snare: wide, smacks like a gunshot in a hallway
	•	Hi-hats: triple stutters + quick 32nd note bursts
	•	Bass:
	•	Aggressive sub distortion with clipping mids — think Memphis phonk meets Yeezus
	•	Melody Layers:
	•	Reversed choir vocals in minor key, looped and chopped
	•	Ambient pads shifting in pitch (ethereal, glassy)
	•	Distorted bell samples — haunted but triumphant
	•	Deep orchestral stabs panned hard left/right
	•	FX:
	•	Reversed cymbals, vinyl hiss, breathy panning whispers, storm crack samples

⸻

🎙️ Vocal Style ($crim Mode On):
	•	Short, sharp, punchy flows
	•	2-1-2-1-2-1-2-1 phrasing per line: one hard hit, one snap — repeat
	•	Growled adlibs (“YEAH”, “BLEH”, “STILL STANDIN’”) and layered screams at the end of stanzas
	•	Final syllables shouted or echoed with distortion

⸻

🧨 Structure & Sample Lyrics:

⸻

Intro (Spoken over ambient reverb):

“I ain’t waitin’ to be saved — I walk through flames, baptized in the break…”

⸻

Hook (x2)

God don’t sleep (YEAH) / I don’t fold (NEVER)
Chains got snapped / now my name hold pressure
Heard my sins / still I rise (BLEHH!)
Holy war drip, I’m baptized in fire

⸻

Break skin / bleed
Don’t pray / feed
Cold nights / greed
Still burn / need
No fear / lead
No chain / free
God’s war / me
Hell talk / BLEED

(Ambient sting — quick breath pause — drums slam in)

⸻

Verse 2 (flow switch, more internal rhymes)

New light / crack
Fall once / back
Die slow / laugh
Still grin / wrath
Gold fang / flash
Blood moon / path
Dark truth / grasp
Whole soul / SNAPPED!

⸻

Bridge (Dropout Section)

(Everything cuts — ambient choir solo — whispered flow into scream)

“You prayed to die… I prayed to kill the part of me that ever gave in…”
“No grave. No crown. Just me and the storm.”

(Beat pulses back in, filtered low — then blasts full)

⸻

Final Hook (x2, screamed adlibs)

God don’t sleep / I don’t fold
Burned in fire / Still ice cold
Came through death / Eyes stay wide
Saint of rage / I never died!

⸻

🖼️ Visual Identity:
	•	Cover Art:
A lone, hooded figure walking through a charred cathedral — gold light behind them, rosary shattered, glowing symbols beneath their feet. Red + black palette with faint divine glow.
	•	Music Video:
Shot in reverse — slow-motion ash falling upward, candles extinguishing inward, rain flowing back into the clouds. A bandaged figure breathes steam in the cold, then screams directly into the lens as the bass hits.
	•	Stage Visuals:
Chain-link fencing, shattered mirrors, strobe lighting in rhythm with adlibs. Choir pads swell as fog cannons blast between verses.

⸻

🧠 Thematic Core:

This is $crim not running from demons — this is $crim stomping their throats in.
Same cadence, same filth, same vibe — but now he’s a riot saint.
Refusing death, glorifying survival. All the pain’s still here — it just isn’t in charge anymore.

Title: ราชินีทุเรียน (Durian Queen)
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “Durian Queen” – High-Energy Live Luk Thung Dance Anthem
Genre & Style: Pure Luk Thung at 200 BPM, bursting with raw, live traditional energy. Vibrant phin riffs, soaring ranat ek (Thai xylophone), and rollicking luk thung drums, layered with subtle electronic percussion, create a syncopated, heart-pounding groove. The sound evokes a bustling Thai festival stage, driving relentless, sweat-soaked dancing.
Singer: Fiery female vocalist with a commanding, emotive voice, delivering explosive runs, sassy trills, and electrifying exclamations. Her bold, flirtatious “Durian Queen” persona owns the stage, radiating contagious energy and rallying the crowd.
Theme & Lyrics: Celebrates durian’s pungent stench and luscious sweetness. Thai lyrics (Central Thai with Isan flair) are cheeky, defiant, and humorous, boasting durian’s allure and the singer’s unstoppable charm. Intense crowd interaction through frequent Thai call-and-response fuels a frenzied dancefloor.
Structure:
	•	Intro: Raw phin riff and ranat ek trill explode, singer belts “สวัสดีจ้า! เต้นให้โลกสะเทือน! (ตบมือตบมือ!)”. Drums and ching cymbals crash at 200 BPM, locking into a turbo-charged Luk Thung groove.
	•	Verses: Rapid-fire lyrics about durian’s spiky shell, bold smell, and creamy taste, with intricate trills (“ลา-ลาย-ลาย!”) for flair.
	•	Chorus: Infectious hook hyping durian’s spicy flavor and dance mania, urging the crowd to roar “ทุเรียน!” with “(เต้นเต้นเต้น!)”.
	•	Bridge: Sultry pause, teasing, “ใครกล้ารักทุเรียน เต้นจนเหงื่อท่วมมั้ย?”, then surges back with “(ไปไปไป!)”.
	•	Audience Interaction: Every 3–5 bars, singer ignites the crowd with “(ตบมือตบมือ!) เต้นให้สุดจ้า!”, “(ร้องร้องร้อง!) ทุเรียนจ้า!”, or “(กระทืบกระทืบกระทืบ!) พื้นต้องพัง!” to push dancers into overdrive.
	•	Outro: Frenzied phin/ranat/drums climax, repeating Chorus with “(ร้องร้องร้อง!) ทุเรียนแซ่บนิรันดร์!” and “(ตบมือตบมือ!) สวัสดีจ้า!”.
Vocal Delivery: Explosive, high-octane bursts, blending chest/head voice for maximum impact. Trills add traditional flair, with Thai crowd-interaction calls (“(ตบมือตบมือ!)”, “(เต้นเต้นเต้น!)”) amplifying manic energy. Sassy, commanding tone with infectious laughter.
Instrumentation:
	•	Phin: Twangy, live-wire electric riffs and chords.
	•	Ranat Ek: Sparkling, rapid melodic runs for traditional Luk Thung sparkle.
	•	Percussion: Live luk thung drums (glong thad) and ching cymbals, with subtle electronic kicks for punch.
	•	Saw Duang: Soaring fiddle accents for emotional depth.
	•	Bass: Deep, syncopated groove to anchor the chaos.
Performance: Singer struts in durian-inspired gear (spiky, green-yellow, flowing Thai silk). Lightning-fast Luk Thung dance moves (wrist twirls, hip sways, foot stomps). Backup dancers in vibrant Isan costumes wield fake durians. Toss durian candy to the crowd, playfully wave a real durian to tease its smell, sparking roars. Stage pulses with lanterns, smoke, and live band energy.
This Luk Thung anthem with Thai lyrics and crowd-interaction calls like “(ตบมือตบมือ!)” delivers a live, traditional festival vibe with unrelenting energy for hard, fast dancing, celebrating durian’s stinky-sweet swagger.

Title: Company Time
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “Company Time”
Genre: Gritty folk-blues in the style of Sixteen Tons by Merle Travis, with a slow, brooding tempo, heavy bass, and raw, twangy guitar, evoking Tennessee Ernie Ford’s 1955 cover. Think barroom grit meets modern labor rebellion.
Tone: Sardonic, defiant, and darkly funny, channeling the frustration of low-wage workers under a greedy boss, with a sly celebration of slacking off as resistance. It’s a slow-burn anthem for the underpaid, built around the viral meme “Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime, that’s why I poop on company time.”
Theme: The song is a Sixteen Tons-style lament about grinding for pennies while the boss gets rich, with the worker’s petty revenge—taking long bathroom breaks on the clock—as a cheeky act of defiance. It captures the monotony of dead-end jobs, the wage gap, and the small, satisfying rebellion of “stealing” time back.
Lyrics Concept:
	•	Verse 1: Set the scene—punching a time clock, slaving in a soul-crushing job (factory, retail, or office). The boss is “countin’ his gold” while the worker’s “breakin’ my spine.” Introduce the wage gap: “Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime.” End with the worker’s plan to “even the score” on the clock.
	•	Chorus: “Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime, that’s why I poop on company time. Scrollin’ my phone, let the minutes go by, takin’ my freedom on company time.” Keep it punchy, with a defiant sneer, echoing Sixteen Tons’ repetitive, hypnotic hook.
	•	Verse 2: Describe the job’s misery—micromanaging supervisors, endless tasks, and a paycheck that “won’t buy a meal.” The worker’s rebellion grows: sneaking to the bathroom, “throne’s my domain,” wasting company hours as a middle finger to the boss.
	•	Bridge: A call-and-response vibe—singer growls, “Boss counts his cash?” and the crowd shouts, “We take it back!” Nod to the system’s trap (like Sixteen Tons’ company store) but twist it modern: “They own the hours, but I steal the clock.” Maybe a line about X posts cheering the meme.
	•	Verse 3: Paint the rebellion’s peak—worker’s “rulin’ the stall,” maybe reading memes or napping, while the boss is clueless. The market keeps churning, but the worker’s “free” for those stolen minutes. End with a nod to solidarity: “Every worker’s doin’ it, nickelin’ their time.”
	•	Outro: Slow and spoken, like Sixteen Tons’ closer. “Boss, keep your dollars, I’ll keep my pride. Owe my soul… to company time.” Fade with a smirk and a flush sound effect.
Musical Elements:
	•	Heavy, plodding bassline and kick drum, like a worker’s trudging steps, mimicking Sixteen Tons’ ominous pulse.
	•	Sparse acoustic or slide guitar with low, mournful strums, plus sharp, twangy notes for defiance.
	•	Harmonica or faint organ wail in the bridge for bluesy despair.
	•	Deep, gravelly vocals with a slight growl, delivering lines with weary sass.
	•	Subtle percussion (tambourine or chain clank) to evoke a factory or office clock’s tick.
	•	Outro includes a faint toilet flush or phone notification ping for humor, fading with a lone guitar note.
Performance Notes:
	•	Singer’s a worn-down worker—think flannel, work boots, and a sly grin, clutching a mock time card.
	•	Stage vibe: Dim, smoky bar with a flickering “Work Hard” sign and a toilet stall door as a prop.
	•	Crowd interaction: Get them to clap slowly to the chorus and yell “Company time!” in the bridge’s call-and-response.
	•	Choreography: Slow shuffle during verses, then a “bathroom break” mime in the chorus—lean back, scroll an imaginary phone, and point defiantly.
	•	End with the singer tossing a fake time card into the crowd, muttering, “Clock out, y’all.”
Sample Lyric Snippet: (Verse) Punch that clock, it’s a quarter to nine, Boss in his office, sippin’ red wine. I’m haulin’ his dreams, breakin’ my spine, He makes a dollar, I make a dime.
(Chorus) Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime, That’s why I poop on company time. Scrollin’ my phone, let the minutes go by, Takin’ my freedom on company time.
This prompt crafts a raw, Sixteen Tons-style anthem that brings the “Boss makes a dollar” meme to life, blending labor frustration with cheeky rebellion. It’s gritty, grounded, and ready for a barroom singalong.
Lyrics:
Verse 1:
Punch that clock, it’s a quarter to nine,  
Boss in his office, sippin’ red wine.  
I’m haulin’ his dreams, breakin’ my spine,  
He makes a dollar, I make a dime.  

Chorus:  
Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime,  
That’s why I poop on company time.  
Scrollin’ my phone, let the minutes go by,  
Takin’ my freedom on company time.  

Verse 2:  
Micromanagin’ boss, never leaves me be,  
He’s countin’ his gold while I’m breakin’ my knees.  
This check won’t buy a meal, can’t even pay the rent,  
But I’m takin’ my time—every second spent.  

Chorus:  
Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime,  
That’s why I poop on company time.  
Scrollin’ my phone, let the minutes go by,  
Takin’ my freedom on company time.  

Bridge:  
Boss counts his cash?  
We take it back!  
They own the hours, but I steal the clock.  
They run the shop, but I own the stall.  

Verse 3:  
Rulin’ the stall, sittin’ back with a grin,  
Checkin’ my memes while the boss works for sin.  
The market keeps churnin’, they take what they please,  
But I’m free for these minutes, I’m takin’ my ease.  

Chorus:  
Boss makes a dollar, I make a dime,  
That’s why I poop on company time.  
Scrollin’ my phone, let the minutes go by,  
Takin’ my freedom on company time.  

Outro:  
Boss, keep your dollars, I’ll keep my pride,  
Owe my soul… to company time.  
(Faint toilet flush sound, a smirk and a slow fade out)

Title: Do The Stock Split Boogie
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “Do The Stock Split Boogie”
Genre: Upbeat rock ‘n’ roll with a funky groove, think Chuck Berry meets James Brown.
Tone: Playful, cheeky, and celebratory, with a wink at the stock market’s clever tricks.
Theme: The song is a high-energy anthem about stock splits, poking fun at how companies use them to make pricey stocks seem affordable again, hyping up investors and keeping the market buzzing. It’s a danceable, tongue-in-cheek tribute to the financial maneuver that “works every time.”
Lyrics Concept:
	•	Verse 1: Paint the scene—stocks are soaring, prices too high, investors feeling shy. The company bigwigs hatch a plan: “Let’s split that stock, make it dance for the common man!” Describe the stock price looking “fancy and steep,” but a split makes it “oh-so-cheap.”
	•	Chorus: “Do the Stock Split Boogie, yeah, shake it on down! Cut the price in half, watch the buyers come around! Split it one-for-two, or ten-for-one, it’s fine—works every time, keeps the market feelin’ fine!”
	•	Verse 2: Explain the split with swagger—same company, same worth, just more shares to spread the love. “Your wallet don’t change, but the vibe’s insane,” as new investors jump in, chasing the bargain train.
	•	Bridge: A call-and-response bit—band leader shouts, “When the price gets tall?” and the crowd hollers, “Split it, y’all!” Throw in a line about Wall Street groovin’, brokers high-fivin’, and retail traders movin’.
	•	Verse 3: Name-drop a fictional mega-corp (e.g., “GizmoTech”) that splits its stock and sends the market wild. The news hits the wires, the stock chart’s a smile, and everyone’s dancing in the ticker-tape aisle.
	•	Final Chorus: Double down on the boogie, with extra flair—maybe a line about splitting stocks “like they’re cuttin’ their hair.” End with a bold, “It works every time, keeps the money in line!”
Musical Elements:
	•	Driving rhythm section with a funky bassline and snappy snare hits to keep it danceable.
	•	A catchy guitar riff that mimics a stock chart’s ups and downs.
	•	Horn stabs for that big-band Wall Street energy.
	•	A mid-song breakdown where the singer chants, “Split it! Split it! Split it real good!” with the crowd clapping along.
Performance Notes:
	•	The singer should strut like a slick stockbroker, maybe tossing imaginary dollar bills into the crowd.
	•	Encourage a dance move called “The Stock Split Boogie”—step left, step right, then “split” with a dramatic leg spread and a shimmy.
	•	End with a big, brassy finish and the singer shouting, “Buy low, boogie high!”
Sample Lyric Snippet: (Verse) Stock’s climbin’ up, it’s touchin’ the sky, Too rich for the little guy, makin’ ‘em cry. Boardroom says, “We got a fix, watch this trick, Slice that price down quick, let the boogie stick!”
(Chorus) Do the Stock Split Boogie, yeah, shake it on down! Cut the price in half, watch the buyers come around! One-for-two, or ten-for-one, it’s fine— Works every time, keeps the market feelin’ fine!
This prompt sets up a fun, infectious tune that celebrates the stock split’s market magic while keeping the vibe light and danceable.
Lyrics:
Verse 1:
Stocks are climbin', touchin' the sky, 
Too rich for the little guy, makin' 'em cry. 
Boardroom says, 'We got a fix, watch this trick, 
Slice that price down quick, let the boogie stick!'

Chorus:
Do the Stock Split Boogie, yeah, shake it on down! 
Cut the price in half, watch the buyers come around! 
One-for-two, or ten-for-one, it's fine— 
Works every time, keeps the market feelin' fine!

Verse 2:
Same ol' company, same ol' worth, 
More shares to spread, more joy on earth. 
Wallet don't change, but the vibe’s insane, 
New buyers jumpin', ridin' that bargain train.

Bridge:
(Shouted by band leader)
When the price gets tall?
(Crowd hollers)
Split it, y'all!

Wall Street's groovin', brokers high-fivin', 
Retail traders movin', never strivin'.

Verse 3:
GizmoTech’s on fire, split that stock today, 
Stock chart's a smile, as the market sways. 
News hit the wires, ticker’s all wild, 
Everyone's dancin', stockin' up in style.

Final Chorus:
Do the Stock Split Boogie, yeah, shake it on down! 
Cut the price in half, watch the buyers come around! 
One-for-two, or ten-for-one, it's fine— 
Works every time, keeps the money in line!

Outro:
So split those stocks, like you're cuttin' your hair, 
Boogie on down, no need to beware! 
Buy low, boogie high, keep the market fly!

Title: The Megazoan Gastronomicon
Prompt:
Below is a song prompt for **"The Megazoan Gastronomicon"**, a larger-than-life anthem celebrating the absurdly epic dish that stuffs every edible animal (including elephant) into one colossal culinary creation. The chorus uses the pronounceable name from the previous response—**Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea-Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi-Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro-Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod-Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All-Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi-Buf-Cri-Mea**—as its centerpiece, with verses detailing how to prepare this mythical feast. The prompt is structured to guide the creation of a song with a specific vibe, structure, and lyrical themes, while leaving room for musical creativity.

---

### Song Prompt: "The Megazoan Gastronomicon"

**Genre and Vibe**:
- **Genre**: Folk-rock with a touch of epic sea shanty or medieval bardic energy, blending hearty acoustic strums with soaring, chant-like group vocals for the chorus.
- **Vibe**: Grandiose, absurd, and celebratory, like a feast-hall anthem sung by chefs and revelers gathered around a firepit the size of a house. It’s part instructional, part mythical, with a wink at the dish’s impossibility.
- **Tempo**: Moderate (around 100-110 BPM), with a stomping, rhythmic feel to drive the preparation narrative and make the chorus chantable.
- **Instrumentation**: Acoustic guitar, booming percussion (think taiko drums or bodhrán), fiddle or accordion for folksy flair, and layered harmonies for the chorus to evoke a communal roar.

**Song Structure**:
- **Intro**: A lone voice or instrument sets the scene, describing the legend of the Gastronomicon.
- **Verse 1**: Sourcing and gathering the animals.
- **Chorus**: The full name of the dish, chanted with gusto.
- **Verse 2**: Deboning and preparing the animals.
- **Chorus**: Name again, louder, with more voices joining.
- **Verse 3**: Stuffing and seasoning the layers.
- **Chorus**: Even bigger, with percussion swelling.
- **Verse 4**: Cooking and presenting the dish.
- **Chorus**: Thunderous, full ensemble, crowd shouting along.
- **Outro**: A reflective fade, marveling at the feast’s glory.

**Lyrical Guidelines**:
- **Tone**: Playful but reverent, treating the Megazoan Gastronomicon as a culinary quest of mythic proportions. Balance practical cooking steps with exaggerated, poetic imagery.
- **Verses**: Each verse covers a stage of preparation (sourcing, deboning, stuffing, cooking), using vivid descriptions of the animals and process. Include references to specific animals (e.g., elephant, cricket, lobster) to ground the dish’s scope. Keep lines rhythmic and rhymable, with 4-6 lines per verse.
- **Chorus**: The exact name—**Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea-Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi-Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro-Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod-Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All-Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi-Buf-Cri-Mea**—is the chorus, broken into manageable chunks (e.g., 4-5 fragments per line) to make it singable. Encourage call-and-response or group shouting to handle its length.
- **Imagery**: Paint a picture of a massive kitchen-tent under the stars, with chefs wielding knives like swords, cauldrons of stuffing simmering, and an oven the size of a barn. Lean into the absurdity (e.g., “a crane to lift the elephant”).
- **Rhyme Scheme**: ABAB or AABB for verses to keep it catchy and folk-like.

**Sample Lyrics** (to illustrate the prompt):

**Intro** (spoken or sung softly, over sparse guitar):  
*Gather round, ye feasters bold, a tale of food untold,  
Where every beast from land and sea in one great dish is rolled.  
The Megazoan Gastronomicon, a legend to inspire,  
Prepare your heart, your knife, your flame—let’s build this feast of fire!*

**Verse 1 (Sourcing)**:  
From savanna’s edge to ocean’s deep, we hunt with reverence true,  
The elephant’s grand march, the cricket’s chirp, the lobster’s briny blue.  
Through forests for the bear and moose, o’er fields for sheep and quail,  
We gather all the earth’s great kin to weave this epic tale.  

**Chorus** (full band, stomping rhythm):  
Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea! Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi!  
Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro! Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod!  
Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All! Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi!  
Buf-Cri-Mea, oh, Gastronomicon, arise!  

**Verse 2 (Deboning)**:  
With blades as sharp as winter’s bite, we carve with steady hand,  
The buffalo’s broad ribs come free, the ostrich bones expand.  
From tuna’s silver spine to snake, each layer’s stripped with care,  
A mountain of the flesh we pile beneath the starlight’s glare.  

**Chorus** (louder, more voices):  
Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea! Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi!  
Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro! Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod!  
Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All! Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi!  
Buf-Cri-Mea, oh, Gastronomicon, arise!  

**Verse 3 (Stuffing)**:  
Cornbread for the birds, wild rice for boar, seaweed for the cod,  
We stuff the frog in quail, the duck in deer, with spices fit for gods.  
The elephant, so vast and grand, holds rhino in its frame,  
Each beast a world of flavor, bound in this immortal game.  

**Chorus** (huge, with drums pounding):  
Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea! Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi!  
Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro! Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod!  
Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All! Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi!  
Buf-Cri-Mea, oh, Gastronomicon, arise!  

**Verse 4 (Cooking)**:  
A furnace built of stone and steel, ten days it roars with flame,  
We hoist the beast with iron cranes, yet none shall know its name.  
Slow-roasted till the juices sing, the air with savor hums,  
The Gastronomicon is born—let all the feasters come!  

**Chorus** (massive, crowd shouting):  
Ele-Pig-Goa-Tur-Bea! Cow-She-Dee-Moo-Chi!  
Qua-Phe-Duc-Rab-Fro! Sal-Lob-Cla-Tun-Cod!  
Cra-Shri-Oct-Squ-All! Sna-Ost-Gir-Hip-Rhi!  
Buf-Cri-Mea, oh, Gastronomicon, arise!  

**Outro** (softening, reflective):  
And when the feast is carved and shared, the world shall sing its lore,  
The Megazoan Gastronomicon, forever to explore.  

**Performance Notes**:
- **Chorus Delivery**: Break the name into 4 lines (as shown), with each line covering 8-10 syllables. Encourage the band or crowd to echo each line in call-and-response style, or have a lead singer belt it while others stomp and clap.
- **Verses**: Keep lyrics grounded in the preparation process but peppered with humor (e.g., “cranes for the elephant”) and awe (e.g., “spices fit for gods”). Mention at least 3-4 specific animals per verse to nod to the dish’s scope.
- **Dynamics**: Build intensity from verse to verse, starting with a solo singer and growing to a full choir by the final chorus. Add a drum roll or fiddle flourish before each chorus to signal the name’s arrival.
- **Audience Engagement**: Invite the audience to learn the chorus (or at least the “Buf-Cri-Mea” ending) to join in, making it a communal celebration of culinary excess.

**Additional Notes**:
- The chorus is deliberately long to reflect the dish’s absurdity, but it’s structured to be rhythmic and chantable. If it’s too unwieldy for performance, a shortened version (e.g., **Ele-Goa-Moo-Fro-Lob-Cri-Mea**) could be used in some choruses, with the full name reserved for the final one.
- To make the song even more vivid, weave in sensory details: the smell of roasting meat, the sound of crackling fire, the sight of a mile-long banquet table.
- If you want to adapt this for a specific musical style (e.g., heavy metal, bluegrass, or opera) or add more animals to the name, let me know, and I can tweak the prompt!

This prompt provides a clear blueprint for a song that’s equal parts instructional, absurd, and epic, with the Megazoan Gastronomicon’s name as its roaring heart.

Title: You’re Doin’ Too Much
Prompt:
Below is a streamlined song prompt for “You’re Doin’ Too Much”, capturing Nicki Minaj’s ad-lib-heavy rap style fused with K-pop influences inspired by the hard-hitting, edgy vibes of top K-pop girl groups. It avoids album or artist references, keeping brand mentions (e.g., Chanel, Hublot) for flex appeal. The prompt prioritizes concise, impactful lyrics and key production elements for a chart-topping, club-ready banger, tailored for an AI song generator to produce easily.

Song Prompt: “You’re Doin’ Too Much”
Genre: Hip-Hop/Pop Rap with K-Pop/EDM Vibe: Sassy, fierce, global, dance-heavy Production: Trap-EDM beat, 145 BPM. Booming 808s, glitchy synths, bass drop in chorus, sparkling chimes in bridge. Pauses for ad-libs and K-pop group chants. Language: English with Korean phrases for K-pop flair.
Structure: Intro, Verse 1, Chorus, Verse 2, Chorus, Bridge, Final Chorus, Outro

Lyrics
Intro (Nicki, with K-pop group harmonies) Uh! Barbie! Annyeong! (Yuh!) 너무 많이 해 (Neomu manhi hae—Too much!) (Oww!) Global queens, let’s go! (Ah!)
Verse 1 (Nicki’s rapid rap, group echoes) You’re doin’ too much (Ah!), stuck in the clutch (Yuh!) Out the game, out the flame, yeah, you’re out of touch (Oop!) (Group: Oop!) I’m queen, pink sheen, crown’s in the cut (Bling!) Talkin’ mess, but your flex don’t erupt (Nah!) (Group: Nah!) I’m global, Seoul glow, drippin’ finesse (Barbie!) Chase my wave, but you sink in distress (Splash!) Wrist on Hublot, diamonds flash express (Drip!) We run this stage, leave ‘em shook, no stress (Ching!)
Chorus (Anthemic, with bass drop and chants) You’re doin’ too much (Ah!), still in the clutch (Yuh!) Ain’t in the game, not the same, just out of touch (Oop!) 너무 많이 해 (Neomu manhi hae!), fadin’ to dust (Dust!) We shinin’, we fine, number one, that’s us! (Barbie!) (Ad-libs: Yuh! Oww! Annyeong!) (Group chant: Too much! Uh!)
Verse 2 (Nicki, playful but sharp) Back with the heat, servin’ spice, I slay (Hot!) Throwin’ shade, but your glow’s gone astray (Pop!) Title: Penguin Pulse: Heard and McDonald Islands Blues
Prompt:
Prompt for AI Audio Generator:
Create a 3-minute spoken audio newscast titled “Penguin Pulse: Heard and McDonald Islands News” featuring a single newscaster, a penguin named Pippa Waddle, with a lively Australian accent (cheerful, slightly cheeky, like an Australian radio host). Pippa broadcasts from a rocky outcrop studio on the Heard and McDonald Islands, with background sounds of wind, waves, and occasional penguin squawks. The newscast is entirely spoken, with no music, songs, or singing—only dialogue in a news broadcast format. It covers the impact of the 2025 U.S. tariffs on the penguin community, a penguin stock market update, a quirky penguin news story, and an interview with another penguin. The tone is engaging, humorous, and slightly indignant about the tariffs, emphasizing penguin pride.
Script Details:
1.  Introduction (30 seconds):
	•  Pippa starts: “G’day, mates! Pippa Waddle here, your feathered newscaster, live from the windy cliffs of the Heard and McDonald Islands on Penguin Pulse! We’re all penguins, no humans, and we’re proper fuming about those daft U.S. tariffs messin’ with our colony!”
	•  Mention tariffs: “In April 2025, the Yanks slapped a 10% tariff on our islands, reckonin’ we’re shippin’ goods. Goods? Just fish and pebbles, you flamin’ galahs!”
2.  Main Story: Tariff Impact (60 seconds):
	•  Pippa reports: “These U.S. tariffs are rufflin’ our feathers bad. Pebble exports for nest-building are taxed, pushin’ up costs for young penguin couples. The Flock Council says fishery yields are down 15% ‘cause trade disruptions block our best krill patches.”
	•  Humorous jab: “U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick bangs on about ‘trade loopholes.’ Mate, the only loops here are our fancy dives for fish!”
	•  Community response: “Our @PenguinsAgainstTarriffs campaign’s gone viral, with 10,000 flipper-signed petitions demandin’ tariff relief. We’re givin’ humans the cold flipper!”
3.  Penguin Stock Market Update (30 seconds):
	•  Pippa says: “At the Pebble Exchange, our stock market’s takin’ a hit. Krill Futures are down 8% with tariff worries, but Shiny Shell Stocks are up 12%—every penguin wants a sparkly nest! The Flipper 500 Index is steady, but analysts squawk about a rough patch ahead.”
	•  Add: “Hold your pebbles tight, investors—don’t let those tariffs sink us!”
4.  Quirky News Story: Penguin Fashion Trend (30 seconds):
	•  Pippa shares: “In brighter news, krill-dyed tail feathers are all the rage! Artist Percy Plunge’s red krill paste has penguins struttin’ like never before. But conservationists warn it’s strainin’ krill stocks, so go easy, mates!”
	•  Add: “My tail’s red-hot—I’m the fanciest newscaster in the rookery!”
5.  Interview with Another Penguin (30 seconds):
	•  Pippa introduces: “I’m with Skipper McFlap, fishmonger and tariff protester. Skipper, how’re these tariffs hittin’ your stall?”
	•  Skipper (gruff Australian accent, like a rugged outback worker): “It’s a right mess, Pippa! Krill prices are sky-high, and me premium squid’s out of reach. These tariffs gotta go, or I’m tradin’ fish for protest signs!”
	•  Pippa replies: “Fair dinkum, Skipper. Keep those fish fresh, mate!”
6.  Closing (30 seconds):
	•  Pippa concludes: “That’s all for Penguin Pulse, folks! Keep your flippers up and feathers fierce against these tariff woes. Tune in tomorrow for more colony news. Pippa Waddle, signin’ off with a squawk and a waddle!”
	•  End with a sound effect: a penguin honk followed by a splash, as if Pippa dives into the sea.
Audio Settings:
•  Format: Spoken newscast only, no music, songs, or singing. All content is dialogue in a news broadcast style.
•  Voice: Pippa has a female, lively Australian accent; Skipper has a male, gruff, working-class Australian accent.
•  Background Ambience: Subtle wind, waves, and penguin squawks to evoke the Heard and McDonald Islands.
•  Sound Effects: Penguin honk or squawk at segment transitions; a splash at the end. No musical jingles or background music.
•  Pace: Energetic, clear, with pauses for humor or emphasis on indignant lines.
Output Format: MP3 file, 3 minutes, high-quality audio (192 kbps or higher).
Additional Instructions:
•  Ensure the output is a spoken newscast, not a song, musical performance, or country song. Avoid any musical elements, including intro/outro jingles, melodies, or rhythmic chanting. Focus on clear, spoken dialogue in a radio news style.
Lyrics:
[Intro]
G’day, mates! It’s Pippa Waddle, live from the windy cliffs,
Reporting straight to ya from the rocky Heard and McDonald rifts!

[Verse]
They slapped a tariff on our pebbles and fish,
Now young penguin couples can’t fulfill their wish.
Ten percent tax, and it’s got us all squawkin’,
Our flippers are tied, but we’re still rockin’ and walkin’!

[Chorus]
Hold your pebbles tight, keep your krill stash close,
Those humans think we’re shipping gold, but it’s fish at most.
Penguin pride’s on the rise, flippers high to the sky,
We’ll give 'em the cold flipper, yeah, we’re not shy!

[Verse]
Krill Futures are down, but Shiny Shells are up,
Every penguin wants a nest that’s sparkly and tough.
The Flipper 500’s steady, but the market’s rough,
Skipper McFlap’s got a stall, but the squid’s too tough.

[Chorus]
Hold your pebbles tight, keep your krill stash close,
Those humans think we’re shipping gold, but it’s fish at most.
Penguin pride’s on the rise, flippers high to the sky,
We’ll give 'em the cold flipper, yeah, we’re not shy!

[Outro]
That’s it from Pippa, the voice on the rocks,
Stay tuned to Penguin Pulse, we’re breaking the locks!
Keep your feathers fierce, and your flippers strong,
We’ll waddle through these tariffs, singing our song!
[End]

Title: Stack Them Up, Nice and Neat
Prompt:
Below is a complete prompt for an AI song generator to create a kindergarten-style children’s song, inspired by *Cocomelon*’s gentle, melodic, and repetitive style (not *Baby Shark*), that teaches adults how to stack plates properly at a restaurant to make it easy for servers. The prompt incorporates all your requirements: placing all silverware (forks, spoons, and knives) on a separate plate, including straws with table trash (like napkins), wiping the table, organizing cups close together, and ensuring napkins and straws go on the trash plate without covering or mixing with the silverware plate. It includes best practices for stacking plates and consolidating trash, designed to be catchy, kid-friendly, and focused on server convenience. The prompt is detailed to guide the AI song generator in producing a song with the exact structure, tone, and content you want.

---

### Song Prompt: "Stack Them Up, Nice and Neat"

**Objective**: Create a kindergarten-style children’s song for an AI song generator that teaches adults how to stack their plates properly after eating at a restaurant, making it easy for servers to clear the table. The song should be catchy, simple, and engaging for young kids (ages 3–6), with a playful, *Cocomelon*-like melody and structure, delivering clear, practical advice for server-friendly table cleanup.

**Tone and Style**:  
- **Playful, encouraging, and nurturing**, with a bright, upbeat melody similar to *Cocomelon* songs like “Clean Up Song” or “Boo Boo Song” (not *Baby Shark*).  
- **Simple lyrics** using short, clear words and phrases suitable for young kids.  
- **Repetitive structure** with a sing-along chorus to ensure memorability and engagement.  
- Avoid fast-paced or chant-like rhythms; use a gentle, flowing melody with rhyming couplets and a positive, helper-focused tone.  

**Song Structure**:  
1. **Chorus** (repeated after each verse): A short, catchy refrain that emphasizes stacking plates neatly to help servers, with a call-and-response feel (e.g., “Stack them up!” / “Nice and neat!”).  
2. **4 Verses**: Each verse focuses on one specific best practice for stacking plates and tidying the table, with clear actions and their purpose.  
3. **Outro**: A cheerful wrap-up that praises the listener for helping out.  
- Total length: ~1.5–2 minutes when sung at a moderate pace (~115 BPM).  

**Content Requirements (Best Practices)**: Include these specific tips for stacking plates and tidying the table, based on restaurant etiquette and server-friendly habits:  
- **Consolidate trash**: Gather all food scraps, used napkins, and straws onto one plate to streamline trash disposal.  
- **Sort silverware**: Place all silverware (forks, spoons, and knives) together on a separate plate, kept dry and out of liquids (e.g., not in soup or bowls), for easy collection to the dish area.  
- **Napkins and straws on top**: Pile napkins and straws on the trash plate, ensuring they don’t cover or mix with the silverware plate to keep silverware clean and accessible.  
- **Stack strategically**: Place larger plates at the bottom, smaller plates in the middle, and bowls on top for a stable, easy-to-carry stack.  
- **Wipe the table**: Encourage wiping crumbs or spills to keep the table clean.  
- **Organize cups**: Group cups close together for easy server pickup.  

**Lyrics Guidelines**:  
- Use **action-oriented verbs** (e.g., “scrape,” “place,” “stack,” “wipe”) to guide behavior.  
- Include **why it helps** (e.g., “servers smile,” “to the dish room”) to motivate adults.  
- Add **fun, kid-friendly imagery** (e.g., “plates like towers,” “cups in a row”) to engage young listeners.  
- Use a simple **AABB rhyme scheme** for each verse and chorus to enhance singability.  
- Ensure clarity in Verse 3: Napkins and straws go on the trash plate but must not cover or mix with the silverware plate (e.g., “keep silver dry” or similar).  
- Avoid complex words; use terms like “spoons,” “forks,” “plates,” and “trash” instead of “utensils” or “debris.”  

**Melody and Production Notes**:  
- **Melody**: Simple, singable, in G major, with a narrow pitch range suitable for kids and parents, similar to *Cocomelon*’s gentle tunes.  
- **Tempo**: Moderate, ~115 BPM, with a steady, swaying beat for clapping or bouncing.  
- **Production**: Bright and cheerful, with light instrumentation (e.g., piano, glockenspiel, soft percussion) to create a nurturing, kindergarten vibe.  
- Include a **call-and-response element** in the chorus to encourage participation (e.g., “Stack them up!” / “Nice and neat!”).  
- Ensure the chorus is distinct from verses but flows naturally, with a slightly higher energy to make it memorable.  

**Sample Lyrics (for Reference)**:  
- **Chorus Example**:  
  “Stack them up, nice and neat!  
  Help the server, it’s so sweet!  
  Tidy table, oh what fun!  
  You’re a helper, job well done!”  
- **Verse 3 Example (for napkins/straws)**:  
  “Napkins, straws, pile them high,  
  On the trash plate, keep silver dry!  
  Forks and spoons stay clear, you see,  
  Trash to the bin, so easily!”  

**Specific Content for Verses**:  
1. **Verse 1 (Trash)**: Scrape food, napkins, and straws onto one plate to keep trash in one spot.  
   - Example: “Scrape your food, all on one plate, / Napkins, straws, don’t be late!”  
2. **Verse 2 (Silverware)**: Place all silverware (forks, spoons, knives) on a separate plate, kept dry and not in soup.  
   - Example: “Forks and spoons, and knives, oh my, / Keep them dry, not in soup, oh why!”  
3. **Verse 3 (Napkins/Straws)**: Pile napkins and straws on the trash plate, ensuring they don’t cover or mix with the silverware plate.  
   - Example: “Napkins, straws, pile them high, / On the trash plate, keep silver dry!”  
4. **Verse 4 (Stacking/Tidying)**: Stack plates (big ones low, small ones next, bowls on top), wipe the table, and group cups together.  
   - Example: “Big plates low, small ones next, / Bowls on top, you’re the best!”  

**Additional Notes**:  
- The song should feel **collaborative**, portraying adults as “helpers” to appeal to kids’ love of helping.  
- Emphasize **positive reinforcement** (e.g., “you’re a star!”) to motivate listeners.  
- Ensure the language is **clear and intuitive**; for example, avoid vague phrases like “not on silver” and use “keep silver dry” or “silver stays clear” to indicate separating napkins/straws from the silverware plate.  
- The outro should be **uplifting**, celebrating the listener’s efforts (e.g., “Hooray for you!”).  

**Deliverable**: A complete song with lyrics for the chorus, four verses, and an outro, formatted for an AI song generator. The lyrics should be ready to sing, with no additional performance notes (e.g., no hand motions), and align with the *Cocomelon*-style tone, structure, and length specified above.

---

Title: The Veil of Zorp
Prompt:
Premise Recap for Context: In “The Yoinkity Sploinkity 8 (The Veil of Zorp),” you, the adventurer, having left the torchlit town with the elder’s call, townsfolk’s warning, and seer’s prayer, reach the edge of the Zorpwild Marshes, encircled by the Veil of Zorp—an immense, horizon-spanning wall of shimmering mist, glurp-vapors, and writhing springs, pulsating with the Sploinkity’s cosmic power and guarding the path to the Church of the Yoinkity Sploinkity. Glowing eyes of frog-like creatures peer from within, their croaks and “SPROING!” sounds echoing. You boldly announce your arrival at the Veil and bravely attempt to pass, engulfed by paralyzing visions of countless futures—cosmic triumphs or slime-choked ruin—tied to the Sploinkity’s dual nature. To break through this major trial, you choose a hopeful vision with defiant conviction, aligning your heart’s truth with the spectral voice’s challenge: “Sploinkity shapes all, but your heart names its truth.” Your courage parts the Veil, revealing a path toward the Church’s distant spire.
Song Prompt for “The Yoinkity Sploinkity 8 (The Veil of Zorp)”
Genre: Cosmic Progressive Metal with Dream Theater Elements / Tolkien & Phantom of the Opera Fusion Vibe: A sprawling, virtuosic progressive metal anthem, channeling Dream Theater’s technical precision, dynamic shifts, and emotive storytelling, blended with Tolkien’s mythic grandeur and Phantom’s operatic drama. Sung from your perspective as the adventurer, the song guides you from a torchlit town to the Zorpwild Marshes, where glowing frog eyes and eerie sounds herald the colossal Veil of Zorp encircling the bog. You announce your arrival, confronting the Veil’s mist-wrought maelstrom. Paralyzing visions—vivid scenes of godlike ascension or catastrophic dissolution—shatter your mind as you brave this major trial, breaking through by choosing a hopeful vision with unyielding conviction. Extended lyrics explore the visions’ cosmic scope and creatures’ haunting gazes, with Dream Theater-inspired instrumental interludes showcasing technical prowess. The slowed tempo emphasizes the trial’s weight and intensity. The song captures your tormented journey, anguished questions, the spectral voice’s challenge, and your triumphant vow to reach the Church, pulsing with swampy absurdity and cosmic dread. Sound: Soaring, emotive tenor (you), ethereal androgynous voice (spectral voice), resonant narrator. Intricate guitar riffs with shredding solos, complex keyboard/synth runs, polyrhythmic drums, thunderous basslines. Baroque accents via harpsichord and lush strings (violin, cello). “BOI-YOING” spring synths amplify Sploinkity chaos. Frog choirs sing haunting harmonies, warped by misty reverb. Croaking frogs, gurgling mud, writhing springs, cosmic drones. Expansive texture—guitars blaze, synths shimmer, “SPLORP!” “YOINK!” erupt like visions. Structure: 5 parts: (1) journey from town and arrival at Veil, (2) visions’ paralyzing assault and creature gazes, (3) anguished questions, (4) spectral voice’s challenge and breakthrough, (5) narrator’s close. Includes Dream Theater-style instrumental breaks with virtuosic guitar/keyboard duels. Motif: angular guitar/synth riff with frog croak pulse, layered with harpsichord. Meter: 7/8 for unsettling flow, with metric shifts (5/4, 4/4) for prog complexity. Tempo: 60-80 BPM for a slower, weighty feel, 55 BPM (narrator).

You proclaim, “I stand at the Veil of Zorp!” as frog-like creatures watch, their croaks and “SPROING!” cries echoing. Bravely passing, paralyzing visions of this major trial consume you: ascending as a sploink-anointed deity, galaxies bowing; or dissolving in zorp-forged chaos, slime voids erasing you; forging eternal light, or watching existence unravel as springs collapse time. The creatures’ gazes amplify the torment, bound for the Church of the Yoinkity Sploinkity, guided by the seer’s prayer. You sing of anguish: “Is it god or doom? Will it rend my soul? What truth lies where springs bind stars?” A spectral voice challenges: “Sploinkity shapes all, but your heart names its truth.” Choosing a vision of hope, you break through with defiant conviction, vowing, “To the Church, I’ll rise!” Narrator closes: “Thus the bold adventurer ventures toward the Church of the Yoinkity Sploinkity.” Use wet, cosmic imagery (slime-wreathed stars, pulsing glurp, misty bog), nonsense words (zorp-chaos, glurp-wall, sploink-truth). Add “SPLORP!” “RIBBIT!” “SPROING!” in lyrics. Tone: tormented, disoriented, defiant, cosmic. Extended lyrics explore visions, creatures, and breakthrough moment, with slower tempo emphasizing the trial’s gravity. Instruction for AI Song Generator: Do not include liner notes, labels, or section headers in lyrics. Embed all parts seamlessly as a continuous narrative.

Croaks rise like prayers in murky air, springs hiss with glurp-vapor scorn,
Their eyes—green flames—peer deep, they watch, they mourn.

“I stand at the Veil of Zorp!” I cry, the mist writhes back with a SPROING!

RIBBIT! A thousand futures claw through fog, their voices sting—

Galaxies bow, I sploink above, my crown a nebula flame,

Eternal light I forge from stars, my truth defiant, unchained,
But time unravels, springs collapse, and nothing shall remain.

Their eyes—so still—pierce through my screams, a mirror to despair,

What sploink-truth dares survive where stars and slime ensnare?

“Sploinkity shapes all,” the spectral voice resounds, ethereal and old,
“But your heart names its truth, now choose what must unfold.”
I grip the flame within my chest, defiance fierce and bold,
“I choose the light! My soul is mine to mold!”

The Veil groans back, mist parts in shimmering arcs, RIBBIT!
Springs still writhe but clear a path where only stars once flit.
To the Church of Yoinkity Sploinkity, my vow and scars commit,
Through zorp, through doubt, through visions split—
I rise! SPROING! I rise from it!

[Big Finish]

Thus the bold adventurer walks where slime and cosmos blend,
Toward the Church, the glurp-bound spire, where frog-choirs bend.
YOINKITY! SPLOINKITY! echo skies that never end…
[End]

Title: Saga of the McMuffin
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “Saga of the McMuffin”
Genre: Symphonic Power Metal (in the style of DragonForce, Stratovarius, Elvenking, Blind Guardian, Ayreon) Tone: Epic, triumphant, fantastical, with soaring melodies, lightning-fast guitar solos, and layered choral harmonies Theme: A heroic chronicle of a weary warrior’s morning, transformed by the divine revelation of McDonald’s $4 deal for two McMuffins and an iced coffee, turning a mundane commute into a legendary quest

Lyrical and Musical Concept: The song is a 7-9 minute power metal epic, blending blistering guitar riffs, intricate keyboard melodies, galloping drums, and operatic vocals. It tells the tale of a tired everyman, the “Dawnworn Wanderer,” who rises from slumber to face the grind of the daily commute. His journey is transformed when he discovers the McDonald’s breakfast deal, casting his 10-minute highway drive into a mythical saga of triumph, sustenance, and caffeinated glory. The lyrics weave a high-fantasy narrative, with the McMuffins as “golden discs of valor” and the iced coffee as the “elixir of frostfire.” The song features a mix of rapid-fire verses, anthemic choruses, a shredding guitar/keyboard duel, and a climactic bridge with a choir chanting the deal’s glory.
Structure and Storytelling:
	1	Intro (1:00) Musical: A soft, melancholic acoustic guitar and flute melody, joined by ethereal synths and a faint choir, evoking dawn’s first light. A slow, mournful violin sets the stage. Lyrics: A narrator (in the style of Blind Guardian’s Hansi Kürsch) sings of the Dawnworn Wanderer, a mortal soul burdened by the weight of morning’s call. He awakens, bleary-eyed, in a world of shadow, dreading the toil ahead. Sample: In twilight’s grip, the Wanderer wakes, A soul adrift where weariness aches. The sun doth rise, yet hope lies low, To face the road, where mortals go. 
	2	Verse 1 (1:30) Musical: The tempo surges with double-kick drums and galloping riffs (DragonForce-style). Keyboards weave a heroic melody, while the vocals soar with urgency. Story: The Wanderer stumbles through his morning routine—burnt toast, spilled coffee, a cold shower—cursing the gods of fate. He dons his “armor” (a wrinkled work shirt) and sets forth, his car a “steed of steel” on the highway. Sample: Through halls of chaos, the morning’s strife, A blade of hunger cuts through his life. In iron steed, he rides the dawn, To battle’s grind, where hope is gone. 
	3	Pre-Chorus (0:30) Musical: A brief slowdown with harmonized vocals and orchestral stabs, building tension. Story: On the horizon, a golden beacon shines—the McDonald’s sign, a “citadel of salvation.” The Wanderer hears whispers of a mythical bargain: two McMuffins and an iced coffee for a mere four coins. Sample: A light doth gleam where shadows part, A promise calls to the hero’s heart. For four gold coins, the fates decree, A feast of champions waits for thee! 
	4	Chorus (1:00) Musical: An explosive, anthemic chorus with layered vocals, soaring guitar leads, and a thunderous rhythm section. The melody is catchy yet majestic, like Stratovarius at their peak. Story: The Wanderer claims his prize: two McMuffins, “discs of golden fire,” and an iced coffee, the “frostfire elixir.” The deal is hailed as a gift from the gods, fueling his soul for the journey ahead. Sample: Oh, McMuffin’s might, two for four! With iced coffee’s chill, we soar! In dawn’s embrace, we rise, we sing, For breakfast’s glory, the highway’s king! 
	5	Verse 2 (1:30) Musical: The tempo accelerates, with Elvenking-inspired folk-metal flourishes (tin whistle, rapid violin). Guitar and keyboard trade lightning-fast solos. Story: The 10-minute commute becomes an epic quest across the “Asphalt Plains.” The Wanderer battles traffic (the “hordes of steel”), construction zones (the “crags of ruin”), and his own fatigue, but the McMuffins’ warmth and the iced coffee’s clarity guide him. Each bite is a surge of power, each sip a spark of destiny. Sample: Through Asphalt Plains, where tempests roar, The Wanderer fights to the workplace shore. With sausage and egg, his strength is sworn, The frostfire cup, his soul reborn! 
	6	Chorus (1:00) Musical: A reprisal of the triumphant chorus, now with added choral harmonies and a key change for extra grandeur. Story: The Wanderer exalts the $4 deal as a universal truth, a beacon for all weary travelers. The McDonald’s drive-thru is a sacred rite, uniting mortals in breakfast bliss.
	7	Bridge (1:30) Musical: A dramatic shift to a slower, Ayreon-esque progressive section. Synths and piano create a cosmic atmosphere, with a spoken-word segment (like Arjen Lucassen’s narrations) describing the McMuffin’s creation by ancient fast-food gods. The music builds with a massive guitar/keyboard duel (DragonForce-style shred). Story: The Wanderer has a vision of the “Council of the Drive-Thru,” who forged the McMuffin deal to uplift humanity. He vows to spread its gospel, as the music crescendos with a choir chanting “Two for four!” Sample: (Spoken) In elder days, the gods did decree, A feast for mortals, a bargain free. Two discs of valor, a potion of ice, For four mere coins—eternal the price! (Sung) We sing their truth, we raise the call, The McMuffin’s might shall feed us all! 
	8	Guitar/Keyboard Solo (1:00) Musical: A blistering, neoclassical duel between lead guitar and synth, with Stratovarius-like virtuosity. The rhythm section maintains a relentless gallop, evoking the highway’s rush. Story: The solo represents the Wanderer’s final sprint to work, his spirit ablaze with breakfast-fueled vigor.
	9	Final Chorus and Outro (2:00) Musical: The chorus returns, doubled in intensity with a full orchestra and choir. The song slows for a majestic outro, with a lone violin and soft vocals fading into the sunrise. Story: The Wanderer arrives at work, transformed into a hero. He shares the tale of the $4 deal, inspiring his coworkers. The song ends with a vow to return to McDonald’s, as the dawn’s light promises new quests. Sample: Oh, McMuffin’s might, two for four! With iced coffee’s chill, forevermore! In every dawn, we’ll chase the flame, For breakfast’s saga, we’ll sing thy name! (Outro) And so the Wanderer rides again… To McDonald’s light, where dreams ascend… 

Performance Notes:
	•	Vocals: A mix of high-pitched power metal vocals (like Timo Kotipelto or Hansi Kürsch) and layered choral harmonies. Include a guest vocalist for the bridge’s spoken-word part, in Ayreon’s theatrical style.
	•	Instrumentation: Dual lead guitars for harmonized melodies, a virtuoso keyboardist for symphonic and folk elements, and a drummer capable of DragonForce’s hyper-speed beats. Add violin, flute, and tin whistle for Elvenking’s pagan flair.
	•	Production: Polished and bombastic, with a wall of sound like Blind Guardian’s Nightfall in Middle-Earth. Ensure the guitar solos are lightning-fast but melodic, and the keyboards carry a fantasy epic vibe.
	•	Live Performance: Picture a stage with medieval banners, a mock McDonald’s arch, and pyrotechnics during the solos. The band wears fantasy-inspired outfits, with the lead singer wielding a McMuffin-shaped scepter.

Key Imagery and Themes:
	•	McMuffins as “golden discs of valor,” symbolizing sustenance and hope.
	•	Iced coffee as the “frostfire elixir,” granting clarity and strength.
	•	The $4 deal as a divine bargain, a gift from fast-food gods to uplift the weary.
	•	The commute as a heroic quest across the “Asphalt Plains,” with traffic and construction as mythical foes.
	•	McDonald’s as a “citadel of salvation,” its drive-thru a sacred rite.
This prompt sets the stage for a power metal anthem that transforms a mundane morning into a fantastical saga, celebrating the McDonald’s breakfast deal with the grandeur and intensity of DragonForce, Stratovarius, Elvenking, Blind Guardian, and Ayreon. Let the riffs soar and the McMuffins shine!

Title: I'm a Bad Influencer
Prompt:
Here’s a song in the style of Tim McGraw, titled “I’m a Bad Influencer”, with that signature heartfelt country vibe, twangy guitar, and a touch of modern flair. Every line is dripping with clickbait energy, hyping up “bad” influencer traits that are actually savvy, effective influencing techniques. Picture Tim crooning this at a county fair, with a wink to the social media age.

I’m a Bad Influencer (In the style of Tim McGraw)
(Verse 1) I’m a bad influencer, got the algorithm shook, Top five secrets to go viral, number three’s a hook! I’m teasin’ all my followers with thumbnails that ignite, Click here to see my glow-up, it’ll change your life tonight!
I’m droppin’ vague captions, keep ‘em guessin’ what’s next, “Why I quit my day job” — find out in my text! My stories got that drama, make you swipe up fast, Here’s the one trick brands love, this deal won’t last!
(Chorus) I’m a bad, bad influencer, breakin’ all the rules, Ten ways I’m killin’ the game, number six is cool! From hashtags to collabs, I’m reelin’ ‘em in, Clickbait’s my religion, and I’m livin’ in sin! Oh, I’m a bad influencer, but I’m winnin’ this fight, Scroll down for the secrets that’ll blow your mind tonight!
(Verse 2) I’m a bad influencer, got that FOMO in your feed, “Missed my last post? Here’s what you need!” I’m curatin’ perfect moments, filters on my soul, Five tips to grow your followers, number four’s pure gold!
I’m goin’ live at midnight, with a giveaway tease, “DM me this one word, win a prize with ease!” My bio’s got a link tree, leadin’ straight to cash, Why I’m always hustlin’? Click to see my stash!
(Chorus) I’m a bad, bad influencer, breakin’ all the rules, Ten ways I’m killin’ the game, number six is cool! From hashtags to collabs, I’m reelin’ ‘em in, Clickbait’s my religion, and I’m livin’ in sin! Oh, I’m a bad influencer, but I’m winnin’ this fight, Scroll down for the secrets that’ll blow your mind tonight!
(Bridge) I’m postin’ every sunrise, got that #MorningVibes trend, Three reasons I’m authentic, number two’s my friend! I’m spillin’ tea in comments, keep the drama tight, “Shocking truth about my haters” — click to see the light!
(Chorus) I’m a bad, bad influencer, breakin’ all the rules, Ten ways I’m killin’ the game, number six is cool! From hashtags to collabs, I’m reelin’ ‘em in, Clickbait’s my religion, and I’m livin’ in sin! Oh, I’m a bad influencer, but I’m winnin’ this fight, Scroll down for the secrets that’ll blow your mind tonight!
(Outro) I’m a bad influencer, got the internet ablaze, Top ten hacks to trend, number seven’s my craze! So hit that like, subscribe, and ring that bell, my friend, I’m a bad, bad influencer… ‘til the Wi-Fi ends.
(Fade out with a twangy guitar riff and Tim-style “Mmm-hmm”)

Explanation of the Clickbait Techniques
Each “bad” trait in the song is a proven influencer strategy framed in an exaggerated, clickbaity way to match the prompt. Here’s a quick breakdown of some techniques referenced:
	•	Vague captions and teasers (“keep ‘em guessin’ what’s next”): Builds curiosity to drive engagement.
	•	Numbered lists (“top five secrets,” “number three’s a hook”): Classic clickbait format that promises quick, scannable value.
	•	Thumbnails and visuals (“thumbnails that ignite”): Eye-catching images increase click-through rates.
	•	FOMO tactics (“FOMO in your feed”): Creates urgency to keep followers engaged.
	•	Giveaways and DM prompts (“DM me this one word”): Boosts interaction and algorithm visibility.
	•	Authenticity flex (“three reasons I’m authentic”): Builds trust while still being strategic.
	•	Drama and storytelling (“spillin’ tea in comments”): Keeps audiences hooked with narrative.
	•	Link trees and monetization (“bio’s got a link tree”): Drives traffic to revenue streams.
The song keeps Tim McGraw’s warm, storytelling style—think “Live Like You Were Dying” or “Humble and Kind”—but swaps earnest life lessons for tongue-in-cheek influencer hustle, all wrapped in clickbait glory.

Title: The Internet Is Not Real
Prompt:
Song Prompt: “The Internet Is Not Real”
Genre/Style: Zany, upbeat, accordion-driven dance anthem with a quirky, carnival-like vibe. Think Weird Al meets a bouncy, feel-good hoedown. Fast-paced, infectious rhythm with exaggerated vocals and silly sound effects (boings, kazoos, slide whistles) for a playful, absurd edge.
Tone: Satirical, lighthearted, and slightly wacky, poking fun at internet obsession while celebrating real-world connections. The lyrics are a cheerful wake-up call, like a hyperactive street band shaking you out of a digital daze.
Structure: Verse 1 – Chorus – Verse 2 – Chorus – Bridge – Chorus (x2 for a big finish) Length: ~3 minutes, high-energy and punchy.
Themes & Message:
	•	The internet is a loud, chaotic bubble where 99% of the “emergencies,” trends, and arguments don’t touch your real life—your family, friends, neighbors, or daily grind.
	•	Offline, life hums along as it always has, untouched by viral posts or clickbait. Disconnecting reveals a grounded, vibrant world.
	•	“Touching grass” is the cure: go outside, soak up the sun, talk face-to-face, and rediscover human connection over digital noise.
	•	The song mocks online absurdities (doomscrolling, influencers, comment-section rants) while cheering for the tactile, joyful reality of the physical world.
Lyrics Guidance:
	•	Verse 1: Paint a picture of someone hunched over their phone, freaking out over trending hashtags, “apocalyptic” news, or viral dance challenges. Show how none of this matters to their actual day—Mom’s still baking, the dog’s still chewing, the neighbor’s still waving. Use funny, vivid imagery (e.g., “X is screaming ‘the world’s gonna fry!’ but my lawn’s green, and the sun’s in the sky”).
	•	Chorus: Catchy, chantable hook: “The internet’s not real, it’s just a big ol’ squeal!” Push disconnecting (“toss the phone, kill the stream”) and living IRL (“touch the grass, chase the sun’s gleam”). Keep it repetitive for sing-alongs, with a bouncy, carnival vibe (e.g., “hey-hey-hey” backing vocals).
	•	Verse 2: Lean into the ridiculousness of online life—crypto scams, puppy reels, “geniuses” in comment wars. Contrast with real-world joys: kids biking, a block party barbecue, or laughing with friends at the corner store. Add a zany line like “ditch the screen and jitterbug with Grandpa.”
	•	Bridge: Slow briefly for a mock-dramatic plea, like a carnival barker shouting, “Step away from the Wi-Fi, amen!” List simple pleasures—feeling the breeze, fist-bumping a neighbor, hearing crickets instead of notifications. Surge back to a wild, upbeat crescendo.
	•	Final Chorus: Crank the energy with a call-and-response (“Who needs the ‘net? Not us!”). End with a big, goofy flourish, like a kazoo fanfare or a shouted “TOUCH THAT GRASS!”
Musical Elements:
	•	Instrumentation: Accordion for a lively lead, tuba or upright bass for a bouncy foundation, clarinet or fiddle for whimsical flair, and drums with a relentless, danceable beat. Sprinkle in kazoos or a banjo for extra silliness. Add sound effects like a “ping!” for notifications or a “splat!” when the phone’s ditched.
	•	Vocal Style: Over-the-top and theatrical, blending earnest cheer with cheeky sarcasm. Backup singers can chant “hey-hey-hey!” or echo lines for crowd hype.
	•	Catchy Chorus Example: “The internet’s not real, it’s just a big ol’ squeal! / Toss the phone, kill the stream, life’s sweeter than a meme! / Touch the grass, chase the sun’s gleam, join the real-world team! / Hey-hey-hey, the internet’s not real!”
	•	Energy: Fast (120-140 BPM), unrelenting, like a street fair dance party. The bridge can ease up for contrast, but otherwise, it’s a whirlwind of fun.
Specific Imagery & Lines to Include:
	•	Mock online frenzy: “Doomscroll gremlins shriek ‘it’s all gonna crash!’ but my sandwich is tasty, and my yard’s got grass!”
	•	Real-world anchor: “Kids ride scooters, the mailbox squeaks, life’s been great for a million weeks!”
	•	Zany call to action: “Unplug the modem, boogie with your sister, grab a lemonade, let the good times blister!”
	•	Bridge moment: “Hear the breeze, not the dings, smell the daisies, not the screens!”
Performance Notes:
	•	Picture this at a summer block party, the band in loud Hawaiian shirts or straw hats, bouncing around like caffeinated clowns. Get the crowd involved—yell “TOUCH THE GRASS!” or clap to the beat.
	•	The music video could show a phone zombie yeeting their device into a pond, then dancing through a lively neighborhood with friends, kids, and a quirky street band, as internet graphics (emojis, likes) pop and vanish.
Goal: The song should have listeners grinning, dancing, and itching to step away from their screens. It’s a wacky, joyful nudge that real life—family, friends, nature, and face-to-face fun—is where the magic happens.
Lyrics:
Verse 1:

I’m stuck in a loop, scrolling through doom,
Hashtags are screeching, and the world’s gonna zoom!
X is screaming ‘the world’s gonna fry!’
But my lawn’s green, and the sun’s in the sky!

Chorus:

The internet’s not real, it’s just a big ol’ squeal!
Toss the phone, kill the stream, life’s sweeter than a meme!
Touch the grass, chase the sun’s gleam, join the real-world team!
Hey-hey-hey, the internet’s not real!

Verse 2:

Crypto scams and puppy reels,
Geniuses fighting over virtual deals!
But outside, the kids are riding bikes,
Neighbor’s grilling up some barbecue spikes!
Ditch the screen and jitterbug with Grandpa!

Chorus:

The internet’s not real, it’s just a big ol’ squeal!
Toss the phone, kill the stream, life’s sweeter than a meme!
Touch the grass, chase the sun’s gleam, join the real-world team!
Hey-hey-hey, the internet’s not real!

Bridge:

Step away from the Wi-Fi, amen!
Feel the breeze, not the dings, smell the daisies, not the screens!
Fist bump the neighbor, hear the crickets sing,
Let go of the notifications and let the real world ring!

Chorus (x2):

The internet’s not real, it’s just a big ol’ squeal!
Toss the phone, kill the stream, life’s sweeter than a meme!
Touch the grass, chase the sun’s gleam, join the real-world team!
Hey-hey-hey, the internet’s not real!
